story:
Short Summary

“Just as the ocean may be turbulent above, but is always still in its depths, so beneath the surface noise of our thoughts there is always available a deep reserve of calm and tranquillity.” Bodhipaksa

I'm Bodhipaksa, and I've been teaching meditation since the late 1980s. Since 2001 I've been running an online meditation center (www.wildmind.org) which offers free guidance on meditation. I've also published a bunch of books, audiobooks, and guided meditation albums.

I do this because nothing makes me happier than seeing other people become happier.

These four meditations, born from over 30 years of practice and exploration, offer highly effective techniques for slowing down the mind, creating calmness, and bringing into being a more authentic, calm, and positive approach to living. We plan to publish them as "Guided Meditations for Inner Peace."

Research shows that on average we’re caught up in distracted thinking 48 percent of the time, and often much more than that. Research also shows that our distracted thinking causes unhappiness. These distractions are often driven by anxiety, irritability, and self-doubt, which undermine our well-being and lead to stress and depression.

Mindful attention, on the other hand, brings freedom from the tyranny of compulsive thinking and allows us to have a deeper, richer, and more joyful experience of life.

What we're asking is simply that you purchase the album (plus or minus some enhancements!) in advance. You can also make a donation, if you wish.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,500 to cover the costs of editing four guided meditations I've already recorded (in the wonderful Mill Pond Music Studio, in Portsmouth, New Hampshire), for designing the cover art, and for publishing the CD.

Our perks include the CD or MP3 version of Guided Meditations for Inner Peace, plus enhanced versions of the meditations in different lengths (so that you can choose the one that fits the amount of time you want to meditate), as well as other benefits.

The four tracks are: 

  1. The “Eyemax” Experience: Simply changing the way we pay attention visually can create a cascade effect resulting in deep calm and relaxation.
  2. Just Listening: An awareness of sound, and of the space around us, creates a "perceptual stretch" that quiets the mind.
  3. Resting in the Present Moment: Our distracted thoughts are almost always about the past and future. Embrace the reality of the present moment (which is the only reality) and much of our thinking simply drops away.
  4. “Mind Full”-ness of Breathing: Mindfulness of the breathing is the key method for calming the mind. But often it fails because we pay attention to too few of the sensations of the breathing. Letting the mind become filled with the breathing leaves insufficient mental bandwidth for rumination to take place.

The total running time is around 72 minutes.

If we don't reach our entire goal, nothing changes. The funds will simply underwrite the costs of production. Publication of the CD may just take a bit longer! 

For those of you who think, "Why CDs? Why not just MP3s?" the answer is that a surprising number of people still like to buy CDs, and we make more of our income from CDs than from digital downloads.

The Impact

Your contribution will help relieve us of some of the financial stress of bringing out "Guided Meditations for Inner Peace." 

This project will give you tools that you can employ anytime in your life to help you calm down your mind and feel more at peace. You'll also be supporting a small independent publisher, and helping us to bring the benefits of meditation to a wider audience.

Wildmind has already published nine albums of guided meditations, which have been very popular. One of our CDs was Amazon's best-selling meditation title for three straight years.

Bodhipaksa's guided meditations are highly regarded. He has a simple, direct, down-to-earth, and step-by-step approach to teaching. His teachings are delivered with gentleness, warmth, and humor.

Risks & Challenges

There's really no risk to this project. Although we've had to go into the red in order to do so, we've already recorded the material, and are working with our designer on the cover art. We're ready to go as soon as we have the funding to continue. (That bit's up to you!)

If we raise more than we're asking for, this will go toward covering our running costs and help us to bring the benefits of meditation to the world.

Here’s a sneak peak at the OUTBOUND table of contents. These pieces first appeared in the following publications:

“The Lion Makers” The Virginia Quarterly Review, Autumn, 1967 

“Lagos Boy” The Antioch Review, Spring, 1970

“Listening to the Middle East” The Antioch Review, Spring, 1971

“Horst Wessel” The Paris Review, Summer, 1977

“The Way to Prague” Harpers, May, 1976

“The Exile” Star Magazine, December 21, 1986

“Yesterday, the World” The Virginia Quarterly Review, Summer 1982

“The Broken Twig,” Blair & Ketchum’s Country Journal, August 1985

“The Fragility of Skepticism,” Star Magazine, February 5, 1984

“Moonrise to Mourning: Echoes of the Race,” Audience, May-June, 1972

“Before the Mountain Fell,” Audience, January-February 1973

“An End to Loving the Land,” The Missouri Review, 1987

Also included:

“The Patriots,” “A Journey from Spring,” “In the Season of Big Waves,” and “Sparrows and Hawks.”


Outbound:  A Lifetime's Adventures in Journalism is a collection of C.W. Gusewelle pieces originally published in The Star Magazine, Harper’s, The Antioch Review, The Virginia Quarterly, The Paris Review, and others -- stories of special places and events and award-winning fiction.

C.W. Gusewelle joined The Kansas City Star in 1955 as a general assignment reporter.  From 1966 to 1978 he wrote editorials on foreign affairs, was named Foreign Editor and traveled extensively in Latin America, the Middle East, Western Europe, Eastern Europe and the former Soviet Union.

In 1979, Gusewelle became Associate Editor and Columnist.  Over the years, his column has regularly featured his bird dog Rufus, his beloved Ozark cabin, the numerous wayward cats that have found their way to his doorstep, his wife who “inflates to the size of a 1957 Buick” when he attempts to interfere with her cooking, his travels and his daughters.

In 1991 Gusewelle led a joint American-Russian expedition following Siberia’s Lena River 2,732 miles to the Arctic Ocean.  He wrote and narrated a 90-minute documentary chronicling the adventure, “A Great Current Running,” for Kansas City Public Television.

His later KCPT documentaries have included, “Stories Under the Stone,” “Away from it All,” and award-winners “This Place Called Home” and “Water and Fire: A Story of the Ozarks.”

Gusewelle is the author of twelve books.  He and his wife Katie celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary April 17, 2016.  They have two daughters, Anne and Jennie.


"Every so often gifted American writers come along to chronicle a particular part of Americana and in so doing leaves a wondrous and indelible imprint in the reader's mind . . . C.W. Gusewelle elevates himself to the level of E. B. White, William Least Heat-Moon, Willie Morris and other noted observers of the American scene."

  - Winston Groom author of Forrest Gump for the Los Angeles Times

story:
The F.E.S.S.U.P. File

This file includes:

  • parables
  • a personal account of the homeless shelter system
  • defense blueprints against The Mark of the Beast
  • my testimony of Jesus the Christ (like a woken up sleeper agent)
  • interpreted Bible stories to whet the thirst in new believers
  • a candid disclosure of my messed up life in this messed up world
  • flashbacks of the enemy's camps and what those camps are
  • ways the enemy has infiltrated your relationship with God, even now
  • how amazing Jesus is, was and will be
  • a critique of the world from freshly awake 'eyes that see' 

A fresh new breeze for those with Faith and those without.

Pocket Change Needed 

That's right, for your high-end pocket change I will send you a copy of my story. From God's call-to-service to why I'm sitting on the Pillar of Hope Throne and right up until December 1st, 2016, when I'm homeless again (as of campaign launch date) 

  • Why did I give notice at the Christian Shelter?  
  • How did I get there in the first place?
  • What Truth did God show me that some people are confusing with mental illness?
  • I'm shaking an imaginary cup for your change, please buy my story

The Way, The Truth and The Life

So, Jesus bled for me. And as a writer, I'm gonna sit right down and bleed for Him. I'm gonna bleed my words from my heart all over the page like any true writer does and I'm doing it for Jesus.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my mission with as many believers as you have email contacts, and use this to break the ice with non-believers. Get lead by The Spirit! Other ways you can help:

  • make sure there is no middle man between you and Jesus
  • a short prayer of thanks to Jesus for Salvation for everyone 

The following are excerpts from my story:

The Corporation

The Owner built the Corporation and it was good. He diversified the business and gave power over it also to His Son, The Boss. Codes of conduct and ethics for conducting business were set forth. There were buildings, resources, tools and equipment. The Owner and the Boss had work for everyone, benefits and a retirement package. All the employees were given contracts and became the workforce of The Corporation. The Corporation was operated by the authority of Head Office.

Reports came from The Corporation that a manager was trying to take business in a new direction. The Boss went undercover as a regular employee to check up on the new business practices and manager's influence on the Corporation and workforce. The Owner had established proper Rules and Conduct for the Corporation to follow to do business in the right way. The Boss found that under the manager's misdirection, business was a mess, employees were misbehaving and The Corporation's business had become unethical and dirty.

The Boss stepped forward doing the work of The Owner by His rules; a few recognized The Boss' Authority, the Truth of His Words, and His flawless work. The manager terminated the undercover Boss under false allegations; many employees followed the manager's rules, some that they might also share in the power structure created by the manager and others for fear of that power structure. The Boss' Word came back, after He was terminated, that those who kept to the rules of the Owner would keep their retirement packages, but those that followed the manager would ultimately be fired.

...Okay, this parable continues on for another twenty six sentences, but you need to buy the whole story to get there. This parable is a contrived allusion/metaphor of God, Jesus, Satan and living here on earth. (Corporation=body) The sentence structure is built upon the meaning of numbers in the Bible. The first sentence is 1, the fifth sentence is 5, the tenth sentence is 10, etc. (six is man, ten is the Law, twelve is divine government, seventeen is victory, and thirty is dedication to authority)  When you receive my story, Jason Bornagain: The Fess Up File, you get the whole forty sentence parable and the meaning of each number. This story is not so much a work of bleeding out my life, in as much as it is a critical understanding that a major key to understanding the Bible is in it's numbers and the meaning of those numbers.

The F.E.S.S.U.P. File

General Contents:

Chapter 1

For Jason Kerr, that's me, life was a bit strange already. Sure I knew there was a God and spirits and ghosts and probably aliens and stuff, but how it all fit together I didn't know. I was stumbling around finding out. Sleep walking, really, like most people. Little did I know that I was working for the enemy. I didn't even think there was an enemy. I was Agent Satan's Sleeper. That's right, I was an A.S.S. and I was only vaguely aware of it. (the things I gone done and did...)

Chapter 2

Awake up call from God. Agent Jason Bornagain activated by Jesus Division. Same old person, brand new person. 

Chapter 3

I've ready almost a thousand books in my life, and now I read the Book...here's some things to interest the new reader and rile up people who already have it "figured out."

Chapter 4

"You don't deserve to eat,"  "You're not a writer," and "You're not following Jesus."  Are all Christians like this? No, and it wasn't the Christian but the enemy, Satan, that puts those words in some one's mouth. The real enemy is the influential force behind wicked words. We all struggle the same struggle. There are many different denominations and buildings and gatherings and they all claim divine patience, understanding and compassion... They all have their own rules. Lots the same, lots different. Agent Bornagain visits many different denominations. Good news is Jesus is everywhere. Bad news, so is the devil.

Chapter 5

The Holy Spirit effect and the inner workings of being a Bornagain agent of Jesus Division.

Chapter 6

The basic needs of Man and the Canadian Greenhouse Effect.

Chapter 7

So, the campaign is over and I was able to raise $???????. Here's whats happening now....(even I don't know how it is going to end, but I will soon and I'll tell you all about it.)

 

You only have until November 27 to buy your copy!

I look forward to sharing with you, dear reader, the amazing changes my soul has experienced with Jesus and the wonderful insights God has blessed me with,

These are the last words in the Bible and the truest I wish to bless you with:

May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

Love, Jason Claude Kerr

a.k.a. Jason Bornagain

P.S. Revelations 13 tells us that the Mark of the Beast will prevent any God fearing soul from buying and selling stuff. So how's a good Christian gonna eat when you can't buy food? The answer is the Canadian Greenhouse. What? You think you got time to build one later? And why don't churches already have one to feed the poor? Give a fish, eat for a day. Teach to fish, eat for a lifetime...until he can't buy a fishing license because the Mark of the Beast. Build a greenhouse and feed a community (Canadian Greenhouse all year round) and register that greenhouse as part of the church, separate from state, like now!

story:
fotografía de la serie  “Algo Ahí”

Sobre “Algo Ahí”, nuestro proyecto

Hace un año iniciamos el proyecto para publicar el nuevo fotolibro de Billy Hare, quien es un referente en la fotografía peruana. En este punto, ya hemos terminado la fase de diseño y edición, y nos encontramos en la búsqueda de los fondos necesarios para imprimirlo y distribuirlo.

                                                                                                                                 Interiores del libro

El libro se titula “Algo ahí”, y contiene una serie de imágenes del trabajo reciente de Billy. Es un libro de 21 x 32 cm., y 120 páginas. Las fotos que contiene son el registro de sombras en movimiento proyectadas sobre un muro y apelan al fenómeno que en psicología se conoce como pareidolia, que es donde un estímulo vago y aleatorio (habitualmente una imagen) es percibido erróneamente como una forma reconocible.


                                                                                                                                 Prototipo del libro

El resultado es una pieza geométrica completamente negra, irreal, inidentificable como libro, en una referencia manifiesta al minimalismo y a lo sombrío de la obra de Samuel Beckett.


                  

                                                                                           Fotografías de la serie  “Algo Ahí”


Las características del libro lo hacen una pieza compleja en su producción, por lo que hemos trabajado con profesionales de primer nivel. El diseño estuvo a cargo del estudio español Underbau, la fotomecánica de Víctor Garrido y la coordinación editorial de Gonzalo Golpe. Además, claro, de la participación del mismo Billy y el equipo de KWY.


Reunion de trabajo con Pablo Suárez y Juanjo Justicia de Underbau, y el coordinador editorial Gonzalo Golpe.


El libro será impreso en España tras este crowfounding, y considerando los plazos de envío, la entrega está estimada para la primera semana de marzo.

Por todo esto, hemos abierto esta preventa con el fin de recaudar los fondos necesarios para hacer posible este proyecto; y puedes estar seguro que adquiriendo una copia estarás colaborando de manera especial. Nuestra meta son 9.000 dólares los cuales cubrirán parte de la  impresión del libro.

—

Sobre el autor, Billy Hare 

                                                                                                                 Aaron Siskind y Billy Hare 


(Lima,1946) Fue discípulo de Minor White y Aaron Siskind. Entre 1977 y 1978 asistió al Master del Rhode Island School of Design (RISD) en calidad de becario de la Comisión Fulbright. En 1992 fue distinguido con la beca Guggenheim.

Fue miembro fundador de la Asociación Secuencia (1976-1980), y de Secuencia Fotogalería. También participó en la fundación del Departamento de Fotografía del Instituto Gaudi (1993), del Centro de la Fotografía (1999) y de la fotogalería El Ojo Ajeno (2000). Ha ejercido la docencia en la Pontificia Universidad Católica del Perú, la Universidad de Lima y la Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas. Como una actividad paralela a su trabajo creativo y de enseñanza, Billy ha colaborado en diversos proyectos editoriales entorno al paisaje y las culturas del Perú.

En 1997 la Fundación Telefónica del Perú organizó una retrospectiva de su obra, publicando el catálogo “Billy Hare Fotografías”. Su obra forma parte del Museo de Arte de Lima (MALI) y de colecciones públicas y privadas del Perú y el extranjero. Billy es representado por la Galería Lucía de la Puente. Actualmente, vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Lima. 

—

"En la fotografía, la preponderancia de una pauta estética tardo moderna sería anunciada por Billy Hare, quien ha sido una de las figuras más prominentes desde fines de los años setenta".

Jorge Villacorta y Max Hernández Calvo, Franquicias Imaginarias, PUCP 2002.



"Billy Hare enfoca un objeto, una peña, una montaña, un detalle de la llanura, y lo extrae de un todo. Evoca una extraña soledad, como si en el mundo solo se hubiera conservado ese fragmento encerrado en un círculo".

Erika Billeter, Canto a la Realidad, Fotografia Latinoamericana 1860-1993, Lunwerg Editores.




"Only recently I came across a reproduction of Billy Hare’s very splendid aerial photograph of Pampa Grande at Lambayeque.That is certainly a stunning image. Likewise, I am very moved by the remainder of the photographs for the Lambayeque region. These posses an elegant and respectful steadiness and openheartedness which I find especially touching and at the same time gravely serious. It is a stunning landscape deeply felt and feelingly rendered". 

Emmet Gowin, (comunicación personal 1998).

—



Sobre la editorial, KWY Ediciones

Nacimos el 2014 en Lima como una plataforma independiente para autores principalmente peruanos y latinoamericanos. Nuestros esfuerzos se enfocan en crear fotolibros que propongan una experiencia con voz propia, en donde todos los elementos constructivos, tanto conceptuales como formales, se alineen con la perspectiva del autor.

Hasta la fecha ya hemos publicado 5 fotolibros cuya distribución ha alcanzado librerías especializadas en Nueva York, París, Sao Paulo, México y Buenos Aires, además de participar en ferias y encuentros como Paris Photo, Lima Photo, Guatefoto, La feria de libros de autor y el Fola en Buenos Aires, el FIFV en Valparaiso, CMYK en Montevideo, entre otros. 

Para más información visita nuestra página web.

—

En este punto, ya hemos terminado la fase de diseño y edición, y nos encontramos en la búsqueda de los fondos necesarios para imprimirlo y distribuirlo.                                                                                                                                 Interiores del libroEl libro se titula “Algo ahí”, y contiene una serie de imágenes del trabajo reciente de Billy. Es un libro de 21 x 32 cm., y 120 páginas. Las fotos que contiene son el registro de sombras en movimiento proyectadas sobre un muro y apelan al fenómeno que en psicología se conoce como pareidolia, que es donde un estímulo vago y aleatorio (habitualmente una imagen) es percibido erróneamente como una forma reconocible.                                                                                                                                 Prototipo del libro

story:
Dear Friends and Fans of Poetry,

This year, Spooky Girlfriend Press will be turning nine years old. Nine! We've published 14 titles to date, everything from a debut full-length poetry collection (Getting Lucky by Nicole Steinberg), an e-chapbook (Libido by Cathy de la Cruz), to a chapbook of non-fiction essays (Stone Boats by Elizabeth Taddonio). We believe that women continue to be underrepresented in the world of literature, poetry in particular, and our primary goal is to fight against this condition and attempt, in our own way, to make a dent in this situation. Given the political horror movie that we will all soon have parts in, we think this cause is more valuable than ever and we want to continue publishing poetry our way.

But we need your help.

Now a one person operation, our primary goal is to raise enough money to be able to produce two chapbooks this year, the first being What Urge Will Save Us by the immensely talented Alina Pleskova. (You can see some poems from her chapbook in this issue of Mistress!)

"Fierce like the history of poetry itself, Alina Pleskova gives us poetry that explores how relations, love, and even failed love are where the real answers await.  I would read anything she writes, a poet who gives the world back to us with her brilliant, assertive poems.  Say Thank You Alina and BUY THIS BOOK!"
--CAConrad
 

"In Alina Pleskova's What Urge Will Save Us fever, competing economies of intimacies, work, and cultural expectation circulate together around a speaker who resists definition(s). Off-handed insight and candor brew an extremely subtle defiance here, allowing Pleskova to ask in subways, on sidewalks, of partners and friends all the gorgeous questions about how to resist and persist."
--Cynthia Arrieu-King
 

“I thought it’d be more years of / men repeating my jokes louder /instead I swallowed / something electric” and I’m not exaggerating when I say Alina’s is the only poetry I read these days. What Urge Will Save Us is a potent little book, all summer thighs sticking to the bus seat and late-night existential crises tempered with tarot; the kind of thing you write “!!!” in the margins of and make your friends borrow like they could ever care the way you do. Forget mamochka with her zakuski and come drink up the sun tonight, it’s all-in out here, it is, excuse me, really fucking great. You’ll
remember this one."
-- Sonya Vatomsky

We are hoping to reach a goal of $1,000, all of which will be used for Spooky Girlfriend projects. Here's some of the things we want to do with our fundraising goal:

  • Produce Alina's chapbook and a second chapbook this fall / winter.
  • Restock SG titles (and buttons!)
  • Have funds to be able to properly compensate the poets we publish.

The more we raise, the more we can do! Some of the things we want to do include celebrating our 10th anniversary by publishing another full-length collection in 2018, as well as go to regional book festivals to get our name out there even more.

Thank you so much for your time and consideration. Please consider sharing our campaign via Facebook, Twitter, your blog/website, and wherever else poetry lovers in your life frequent using Indiegogo's helpful sharing tools above. We know there are a lot of good causes out there, a lot of small poetry presses who also need help to do what they love, but we sincerely hope that you'll help us making 2017 the spookiest year yet.

Spookily,
Nate

***

Alina Pleskova lives in Philly ​and​ strives to maintain optimum chill. She is coeditor of bedfellows, a literary magazine focused on narratives of sex/desire/intimacy, ​and​ cohost of Poetry Jawns, a podcast. ​Recent ​poems appear in Public Pool, Queen Mob's Teahouse, ​​​​​Sea Foam Mag, Mistress, & Vagabond City. She writes a tinyletter called Vibe Digest w/ rotating monthly guests.

story:
Who am I? 

Hello beautiful people. My name is Dynahlee Star Padilla and I go to The Beacon School in New York, New York. I am 17 years old and I love to read, write, and gain insight from other innovative individuals.

Why is my campaign so important to me?        

This campaign is all about raising money for Rena’s Promise Foundation so that I can attend its summer writing camp for teens. Every time I write poems and read them aloud, I receive a positive reaction from individuals whom are captivated by my words. Through these poems, I attempt to give the audience a message in order to connect with them. Raising money for this campaign is important to me because it gives me a great opportunity to learn different methods of writing, improve my talent, and get closer to achieving a career in the professional writing world.   

What will you help me achieve?

You will all help me achieve my dream goal-to become a better writer, speaker, performer, and listener. At the same time,  you'd help me network myself with different guest speakers, authors, and writers who may open up windows for future job opportunities. These individuals  can also give me beneficial writing advice and possibly become my mentor(s) for this career interest. Therefore, I would be honored to become a part of Rena’s Promise  writing camp because it would help me become the aspiring writer and poet I was always meant to be.

How much money do I need?

I received a $600 scholarship award from Rena’s Promise Foundation, but I still need the other half in order to attend its' writing camp for teens. For this purpose, I would like to raise $600 to pay for the rest of the tuition at this camp by June 21st. I would really appreciate any amount of money because every penny counts, and without contributors of any sort, I would probably not be able to attend.

If I cannot reach my goal,  the money  raised will still go directly towards the tuition for this camp. If I get over my original goal, the rest of these generous donations will go to Rena’s Promise Foundation as a whole in order to provide for other students with a passion for writing.  Additionally, thoughtful poems will be written as a thank you with a future- author signature. I hope my words and messages allow you to become inspired, and keep writing even if you believe yourself that you are not a writer. I believe everyone has an inner voice and sincere story they want to share somehow and someway.

Why is my project so valuable to you and the world?

This project is valuable because writing helps people find their true identity in ways other talents and hobbies cannot. Here are snippets from my poem and essentially a perquisite to why writing is so important to the world, and for you:

We write to exercise our conscience,                                                                                                       and for a while,
isolate ourselves from the designated areas
we call
Home.

We write to endure
adversity with a sense of control and power.

We write to find who we are
because no one else can tell us,
remind us,
or create who we are.                                                                                                               

We write to shape who we are…

We write                                                                                                                                             

Because authentic words weep onto the
white, lined, crisp, clean, paper all so

Naturally.

We write.

What other ways can you contribute?                                                                                         

Honestly, if you can’t contribute with donations, it is okay. Please spread the word by posting my campaign on your social media page or any other outlet that would help my cause. Also, if you know of young writer's ages 13-17 please tell them about this writing camp opportunity for next year. Without humanity, how can the world exist? We need writers. We need storytellers. We need more generations of voices who want to be heard, admired, and remembered. Please fund my campaign if you are willing and able to, and if you can’t, please just spread the word about my campaign and Rena’s Promise Writing Camp.  Try and use Indiegogo’s share tools to make it easier for yourself.  One more thing--don’t forget that words are powerful and we cannot live without communicating our wonderful notions.

Thank you for reading, listening, sharing, and contributing to my campaign. 

Dynahlee Star Padilla_aspiring writer

story:
La Roja de Bruselas es un equipo amateur de fútbol que representa a España en la Brussels Euroleague (www.bxleuroleague.eu), una competición en la que participan 22 equipos formados como selecciones nacionales.

Hemos completado cinco temporadas con muy buenos números: 3º, 1º, 3º, 3º y 2º, además de la victoria hace tres años en el trofeo de Copa. Entre 2010 y 2011 pasamos 44 partidos sin perder (40 victorias y 4 empates).

Además, la temporada pasada se puso en marcha "La Rojita de Bruselas", un proyecto formativo para niños de entre 3 y 11 años. Por ahora tenemos cuatro equipos: 1 sub11, 2 sub8 y 1 sub5 que ya suman casi 50 niños. Son la cantera, la apuesta de futuro y una forma de organizar actividades para los niños españoles que viven en Bruselas. Por ahora se financian gracias a sus padres, pero queremos ayudarles para que den un salto adelante.

Necesitamos tu ayuda para seguir creciendo. La crisis nos ha hecho perder varios sponsors y el crecimiento del equipo genera más gastos: alquiler de campos, inscripción en competiciones, equipaciones, material de entrenamientos, etc. Los jugadores ponen una cuota anual, tenemos varios pequeños sponsors, organizamos fiestas e incluso vendemos algo de merchandising, pero no llega.

Ahora acudimos a ti para que, dentro de tus posibilidades, nos ayudes a seguir adelante con este proyecto que tantas alegrías nos ha dado y que moviliza a buena parte de la comunidad española de Bruselas con iniciativas como la de "La Rojita de Bruselas", el germen de la cantera que ya es una realidad.

Si haces tu aportación firmándola, aparecerás en nuestra web (www.larojadebruselas.eu) en el apartado de "miembros de honor". !Serás nuestro socio!

Pero también puedes hacerla de forma anónima. No hay ningún límite, puedes donar desde 1 dólar. Si quieres hacerla a nombre de tu empresa, pondremos tu logo entre nuestros patrocinadores durante un año si tu contribución es de un mínimo de 300 euros y durante 2 años si aportas 500 euros.

Y si no tienes medios para ayudarnos, te agradeceríamos que dieras a conocer nuestro proyecto entre tus contactos y, sobre todo, en las redes sociales. Cuelga el link de esta página en facebook, tuenti, twitter, etc, muévelo, que llegue a tus amigos.

Idafe Martín Pérez, capitán de La Roja de Bruselas

La Roja de Bruselas es un equipo amateur de fútbol que representa a España en la Brussels Euroleague (www.bxleuroleague.eu), una competición en la que participan 22 equipos formados como selecciones nacionales.

Hemos
 completado cinco temporadas con muy buenos números: 3º, 1º, 3º, 3º y 2º, 
además de la victoria hace tres años en el trofeo de Copa. Entre 2010 y 
2011 pasamos 44 partidos sin perder (40 victorias y 4 empates). 

Además,
 la temporada pasada se puso en marcha "La Rojita de Bruselas", un 
proyecto formativo para niños de entre 3 y 11 años. Por ahora tenemos 
cuatro equipos: 1 sub11, 2 sub8 y 1 sub5 que ya suman casi 50 niños. Son
 la cantera, la apuesta de futuro y una forma de organizar actividades 
para los niños españoles que viven en Bruselas. Por ahora se financian 
gracias a sus padres, pero queremos ayudarles para que den un salto 
adelante.
Necesitamos tu ayuda para seguir creciendo. La crisis 
nos ha hecho perder varios sponsors y el crecimiento del equipo genera 
más gastos: alquiler de campos, inscripción en competiciones, 
equipaciones, material de entrenamientos, etc. Los jugadores ponen una 
cuota anual, tenemos varios pequeños sponsors, organizamos fiestas e incluso 
vendemos algo de merchandising, pero no llega.
Ahora acudimos a ti
 para que, dentro de tus posibilidades, nos ayudes a seguir adelante con
 este proyecto que tantas alegrías nos ha dado y que moviliza a buena 
parte de la comunidad española de Bruselas con iniciativas como la de 
"La Rojita de Bruselas", el germen de la cantera que ya es una realidad.

story:
Short Summary

Movable is an independent art and culture magazine that started as an online blog and website. We feature artists from all over the world, covering everything from contemporary art, writing, music reviews, interviews, photography, and a bit of fashion. I design the magazine myself using Adobe InDesign with the help of a few technical editors.


What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $1,000 to pay for the cost of maintaining the website, promotional materials like business cards, and 100 copies of ISSUE02 printed in full color. It's really that simple. Once the money is raised copies will be accessible to the public for free!


The Impact

Movable is one of the only independently printed art magazines coming out of the Northeast United States. I am moving across the country this month and hoping to do some marketing along the way. I will be settling in Northern California in December hoping to contintue the magazine from there. It certainly is Movable.  It is a collaborative effort and a great way to showcase up and coming as well as established artists. It's fascinating to see it come to life. This fundraising campaign is in effort to build it's momentum. The next step is to build a wide enough audience and generate advertisements to help pay for the cost of printing. 

Risks & Challenges

The only major risk I can predict is my computer crashing or my Adobe programs like Photoshop and InDesign not working. If that occurs, I'm sure to find a way to get the magazine designed and printed if I have to borrow a computer and or buy new software. If we do not reach our goal, the money raised will still go to printing ISSUE02 and I will be fronting the rest of the money myself. In this scenario, it will take longer to get it printed, but we will find a way. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate certainly copy and paste the indiegogo URL and help promote via your social networking sites. It means a lot!

Our indiegogo URL: http://igg.me/at/movablemagazine

Also our website is http://movablemagazine.com/

Our Facebook is https://www.facebook.com/MovableMagazine

story:
About me

Hello, My name is Daisy Copelin I am a author, writer and spoken word poet who expresses the heart of God through poetry and writing. Also a recent graduate from Nyack College where I served there for two years as the president and founder of the Got Poetry? Slam Club to bring about greater exposure to the art. Shortly after starting the club God began opening up doors for me to perform poetry across the New York City area at various churches. I am ecstatic about my book release, however need your assistance in bringing greater exposure to this book. Read a little bit further to find out whats in it for you. FREE excerpt (3 chapters) Enjoy

http://booklocker.com/books/7163.html

What is in it for YOU?

Unfortunately the book is only in paperback your contributions will help convert it into ebook,kindle and ipad format.

Press release is a plus in marketing as it deals with getting media exposure contributions will get a great press release and distribution.

A wholesale order of books to sell

And lastly an inexpensive marketing package tailor made for authors will give the book the exposure it needs.

YOU get so many rewards like signed copies of " The Diary of an Overcomer" personalized thank you cards, personalized pens and notepads with my name and title of my book engrafted on it. Just to name a few. Still interested? Read further 

The Impact

But the greatest reward is getting this book into the hands of many youth that have gone through or is currently going through the situations I endured at childhood such as physical, sexual, verbal abuse, homelessness, alcohol and marijuana dependency, battling suicide due to hopelessness. However God caused me to become and overcomer help them too discover the overcomer in them by the grace of God. FREE excerpt at http://booklocker.com/books/7163.html 

Cant help financially? no problem spreading the word about this book is more than enough. 

www.daisycopelin.com

Contact info: info@daisycopelin.com

story:
WORLDWIDE HARDCORE

- an insight into a global scene -

The book takes you on a journey through the development and history of hardcore music in more than 60 countries.

PART ONE...

...discusses the disappearing, change, and comparison of generations, the origin of DIY and the impact of the World Wide Web, the straight edge movement, and the clinch between subgenres and subcultures.

Bands like 108, Antidote, Bane, Ensign, Get It Done, H2O, In My Eyes, Ignite, Madball, No For An Answer, Outspoken, Slapshot, Terror, Trial, Up Front and Warzone illustrate their stories and exchange their views.

 PART TWO...

...gives you a good insight into the hardcore music scenes of more than 60 countries. The book is a milestone of hardcore literature. It is a realistic view of the past and present.
 
Bands like 562, All For Nothing, Anchor, Billy The Kid, Clearsight, Daydream, Enough, Evolve, Focused X Minds, For The Glory, Fumbles In Life, Knuckledust, King Ly Chee, Last Hope, My Turn, No Warning, Onesta, Only Attitude Counts, Outright, Punishable Act, Pointing Fingers, Positive Youth, Relentless, Remission, Risky Business, Ryker's, Second Combat, Strength Approach, The Geeks, Through These Eyes, Wisdom In Chains, and Xibalba are just a corn of rice compared to the whole package of bands, labels, and promoter that will give you an in-depth knowledge about their local scenes.
 
Along with the reports about hardcore and thought-provoking stories from some living circumstances and political situations, an immense pile of photographs and flyer is to find on almost every page.
 
 

THE FORMAT

  • Print Length: 220 - 250 pages (Because we're still working on the layout, we can't tell you how many pages the book will have at the end)
  • Book Size: 17x24 cm (6.69"x9.45")
  • Softcover
  • Circulation: 600 - 1000pcs first print
  • ISBN: 978-3-944681-00-9

 

WWHC SHIRTS

Don't forget to specify your size! ALL shirts will be printed on GILDAN by Epidemic Clothings in Berlin. CHECK THE GALLERY!
 
www.epdmc.com
 

WWHC COMPILATION (it's a CD)

On this limited (100pcs) compilation are Expire, Trial, Enough, Get It Done, Ill Vision, Eisberg, Envision, For The Glory, Providence, Strong Belief, Custodia, Paroximia, Appraise, King Ly Chee, Billy The Kid, Toma El Riesgo, and many more!
 

3-DAY PASS | Fluff Fest

The annual Fluff Fest in Rokycany (CZ) is one of the wildest events in terms of hardcore, punk, crust, veganism, etc. in whole Europe. The team backed this campaign with twenty 3-Day Passes. It is the first time that they gave away tickets. So don't hesitate and don't miss that chance!

http://www.flufffest.net
 
 

THE PERKS

If there is any perk that doesn't conform your wishes, or a record that doesn't fit to the level you'd like to pledge, feel free to get in touch because I'm always open for other deals!


inside_x@gmx.net

 

BANDS from the campaign

Coldburn

www.facebook.com/coldburnfuckyou

United & Strong

www.unitedandstrong.de

Risk It!

www.facebook.com/riskithc

Ghostwriter 

www.facebook.com/ghostwriterhc

Reflections

www.facebook.com/xreflectionsx

Bitter Verses

www.facebook.com/bitterverseshc

The Storm

www.facebook.com/thestormhc

Light It Up

www.facebook.com/lightituphc

 

 

NO PAYPAL?

If you have no Paypal account, then please get in touch with me personally! Just let me know how much money you'd like to donate and we'll find another way!!

inside_x@gmx.net

 

SOUTHEAST ASIA!!!!

When you don't have PayPal, please get in touch with Anis and let him know how much money you would spend, your name and your adress, etc. He will do the paypal payment for you! So don't be afraid!

ANIS: store@onevoiceasia.com

 

 -------------------------------------------------------------

FAQ

Can I pledge from Australia, Canada, Panama, etc?

YES! Just read the instructions on Indiegogo how to donate.

Why is this project so expensive?

We plan on printing 600 to 1000 copies of the book (which is the bulk of cost), so whatever is left over after the fundraising will be sold individually. We're expecting to spend 2k-3k alone in Indiegogo fees and taxes, printing out the rewards (shirts, poster, the compilation, etc.), and mailing everything out.

I forgot to specify my shirt size and name for the acknowledgment! How do I relay that info?

We'll be sending out a survey in July asking all donors for this info, so don't sleep!

 

Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute financially, please:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family
  • Share this campaign on facebook, twitter, Google+, etc.

story:
ThanksGivingAmerica

It happens every year on Thanksgiving. Local TV and newspapers cover it. Friends post about it online and blogs promote it. Politicians and clergy, corporate executives and athletes jump in. Out of compassion, they come to help to feed the homeless and visit the poor. Clean crisp aprons, big smiles, handshakes. For one day, for one meal – and then they are gone.

Just as surely as they show up in the morning, the holiday helpers vanish by dark. The next day only the deeply committed return. No turkey dished out under the glare of television lights, no scrum of reporters. Suddenly those in poverty have once again, become invisible.

ThanksGivingAmerica is committed to changing that.

Our Project

During the third week of November 2012, in celebration of our national day of Thanks, ThanksGivingAmerica will open an exhibit of 50 photographic and multimedia essays – one from each state – highlighting the struggles and dreams of impoverished Americans, as those with little join those with a little more to give Thanks.

Award-winning photographers in all 50 states will carry out the project during the late summer and fall. The result will be a powerful visual reckoning unseen since Dorothea Lange and the Dust Bowl photographers chronicled the Great Depression and created riveting images that helped mold the nation’s collective memory and conscience. We will photograph a broad array of those struggling economically showcasing how they embody the enduring American spirit. Since poverty knows no zip codes or city limits we will visit people in need in rural, urban and suburban communities, and in each of America’s states.

The exhibit will open at Columbia College Chicago in a beautiful street-front gallery at the corner of Congress and Wabash Streets in Chicago's Loop, and travel to schools, colleges, town halls, libraries, community centers, and houses of worship throughout the United States.

The Context and the Need

According to 2011 Census data 46.3 million Americans – nearly 1 in 6 of us – live in poverty. This is the largest increase in the fifty-two years that the government has measured poverty.

Twenty million Americans – more than the entire population of New York State – live on less than $11,000 a year for a family of four.

One in five American children lives in poverty, most in families where at least one parent has a job.

Our Organization

ThanksGivingAmerica is a project of the AmericanPoverty.org campaign (http://americanpoverty.org), a 501(c)3 non-profit alliance of some of the most accomplished photographers in the United States. Joining us are renowned American writers, filmmakers and educators, all of whom seek to make alleviating poverty a national priority. Together we are working to dispel stereotypes and encourage actions that can create lasting impact on the lives of the disadvantaged. We believe that the stories of people struggling to overcome poverty deserve to be told - and that by sharing them we can inspire thousands and thousands of people to take action and create change.

Founded by Steve Liss, Columbia College Chicago teacher, Aspen Institute Ascend Fellow and thirty-year veteran Time Magazine photographer, AmericanPoverty.org and its parent organization, In Our Own Backyard, have mounted exhibits in galleries, town halls, libraries and schools from San Jose, CA to Washington, DC (https://vimeo.com/channels/231864.)

Beyond Thanksgiving

The result of this project will be published, exhibited and made available to those wanting to help reawaken the conversation, who want every day to be Thanksgiving, when our collective eyes – along with our hearts – are opened to those in poverty.

The exhibit will travel throughout the United State. Pending sponsorship, a book of photographs and essays would also be published as a permanent, tangible product that could be used as an ongoing reference and a record of the project. Moreover, the photographs and multimedia will become part of the AmericanPoverty.org Student Leadership Project (https://vimeo.com/28254822), which provides high school students opportunities to learn about poverty and encourage community involvement.

We can’t do this alone – we need your help!

IF this were easy, we wouldn’t be asking for your help. But even with photographers and editors donating their time, there are trememndous expenses: hotels, airfare and meals, the costs of making, mounting and shipping prints and the financial reality of launching a publicity campaign once the images are made.

And that's where you come in: your support today can help make this project a reality. Your support of both dollars and spirit will be present in every print, every exhibit and every step we collectively take towards making the invisible, visible.

The project is highly scalable, and the number and location of exhibits will dependent on the success of our Indiegogo campaign, as well as ongoing outreach to potential funders.

Our parent organization, In Our Own Backyard, NFP is a registered 501(c)3 non-profit organization. Accordingly all contributions to the ThanksGivingAmerica project are tax deductable under U.S. tax code.

Cool Perks

In addition to our boundless gratitude, we are offering some terrific rewards; a chance to own historic and beautiful photography, printed from original transparencies or files using archival pigment ink insuring they will last a lifetime and more.

IMPORTANT INSTRUCTIONS FOR ORDERING PERKS

1. Remember to select "CLAIM THIS PERK" in the column above and to the right of this text before you make a donation.

2. Where a choice of photographs is offered, please email us at perks@americanpoverty.org with your name, your choice of photograph and your shipping address.

Thank you!

Here are the choices, matched with minimum donations at right:


THE FIRST DAWN, INTERNATIONAL DATELINE, JANUARY 1, 2000

The first dawn of the new millennium, Chatham Islands, New Zealand, at the Interantional Dateline. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.


MOTHER TERESA

A rare portrait of Mother Teresa, taken for Time Magazine in 1991 but never published or exhibited. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

PERSONAL WORK

A ten-year-old boy sits alone in his juvenile detention cell in Texas. From the book No Place for Children: Voices From Juvenile Detention by Steve Liss.

 

Children as young as 10 march through the juvenile detention prison yard at dawn in Texas. Some have skipped school too much; some are gang members. From the book No Place for Children: Voices From Juvenile Detention by Steve Liss.

 

Earlene Grayer, 36, raised 16 children and grandchildren in this tiny shack with no running water in the Mississippi Delta, one of the poorest reagions in the United States. Photograph by Steve Liss.

 

A mother and child behind the screen door on the porch of their two-room shack in Tunica, Mississippi. As difficult as it is to believe, children still go to bed hungry in the United States of America. Photograph by Steve Liss.


AMERICAN SCENES

The homefront on the day that Iraq War I began, Illinois, 1991. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

Boston, Massachusetts. An historic view before the 'big dig' changed the city forever. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

Coming home: A cowboy in Wyoming returns to a mountaintop cow camp for the night. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

Dawn in Texas: A Texas Cowboy rouding up horses in the pre-dawn light. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

The Casper, Wyoming fire department in their new hazardous material suits, post 9/11. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

THE CLINTONS

The new President and First Lady, Pennsylvania Avenue, Inauguration Day 1993. Photographed from the camera truck leading the Presidential motorcade. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

In an exclusive photograph, Bill Clinton poses on the railroad tracks in his home town, Hope, Arkansas. The Secret Service closed the track for one-hundred miles in either direction for the shoot. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

RED SOX NATION

After eighty-four years, my beloved Red Sox win the World Series, the old Busch Stadium, St. Louis, 2004. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

In an historic comeback, the Red sox clinch the 2004 American League pennant in Yankee Stadium, the Bronx. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

 

Pitcher Jim Longorg is carried off the field at Fenway Park as the 100-to-one shot Boston Red Sox clinch the American League pennant on the final day of the season, October 1, 1967. This was the single highlight of my childhood and this photograph was taken by a UPI shooter unknown to me then but who would become my friend and mentor: the late, great Don Robinson.

 

Ending what many have called the greatest baseball game ever palyed, Red Sox catcher Carlton Fisk jumps on home plate after his 12th inning home run won game 6 of the 1975 World Series at Fenway Park. Church bells rang throughout New England and John Kiley, the Red sox organist, played the Hallelujah Chorus as Fisk rounded the bases. Photograph by Steve Liss.

 

STATE OF THE UNION

In an historic moment, President Barack Obama deliver his 2009 State of the Union message before a joint session of Congress, at the same podium where President Lyndon Johnson told Congress in 1965 that "...we shall overcome." My friend and colleague Brooks Kraft donated this beautiful photograph, and the one below, out of his respect for what we're trying to do at AmericanPoverty.org. And we're deeply indebted to him. Photograph for TIME by Brooks Kraft.


THREE PRESIDENTS

In the tradition of the great LIFE photographers before him, Time shooter Brooks Kraft chose to forego the obvious picture from the front and instead captured an unforgetable and rare image of three American presidents walking the colonade of the White House. Photograph for TIME by Brooks Kraft.

 

Facebook and Twitter

Please participate on our brand new Facebook page (http://www.facebook.com/ThanksGivingAmerica) and follow the campaign on twitter @americanpoverty. 

 

Our Team

Steve Liss, Founder, director, 30-year veteran Time magazine photographer, Aspen Institute Ascend Fellow and lecturer in photography at Columbia College Chicago.

Jon Lowenstein, Co-founder, TedGlobal 2011 Fellow and 2011 John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation Fellow, former Pictures of the Year International Magazine Photographer of the Year.

Bill Healy, Communications Director, BA in Sociology from Georgetown, Master’s in Journalism from Northwestern, Masters in Education from Northwestern, Carnegie/Knight News 21 Fellow.

William C. Diehl, Educational Director, Ph.D. in Adult Education from Pennsylvania State University and interviews editor at The American Journal of Distance Education.

Mary Studley, former Time magazine Midwest picture editor, Indianapolis Community School Coordinator

Our advisory board includes:

Marion Wright Edelman, President of the Children’s Defense Fund.

Alex Kotlowitz, noted author of There Are No Children Here and producer of The Interrupters

Peter Loge, Principal, Milo Public Affairs, Washington, DC, and instructor at George Washington University and Emerson College.

story_txt:
ThanksGivingAmerica
It happens every year on Thanksgiving. Local TV and newspapers cover it. Friends post about it online and blogs promote it. Politicians and clergy, corporate executives and athletes jump in. Out of compassion, they come to help to feed the homeless and visit the poor. Clean crisp aprons, big smiles, handshakes. For one day, for one meal – and then they are gone.

Just as surely as they show up in the morning, the holiday helpers vanish by dark. The next day only the deeply committed return. No turkey dished out under the glare of television lights, no scrum of reporters. Suddenly those in poverty have once again, become invisible.
ThanksGivingAmerica is committed to changing that.
Our Project
During the third week of November 2012, in celebration of our national day of Thanks, ThanksGivingAmerica will open an exhibit of 50 photographic and multimedia essays – one from each state – highlighting the struggles and dreams of impoverished Americans, as those with little join those with a little more to give Thanks.
Award-winning photographers in all 50 states will carry out the project during the late summer and fall. The result will be a powerful visual reckoning unseen since Dorothea Lange and the Dust Bowl photographers chronicled the Great Depression and created riveting images that helped mold the nation’s collective memory and conscience. We will photograph a broad array of those struggling economically showcasing how they embody the enduring American spirit. Since poverty knows no zip codes or city limits we will visit people in need in rural, urban and suburban communities, and in each of America’s states.
The exhibit will open at Columbia College Chicago in a beautiful street-front gallery at the corner of Congress and Wabash Streets in Chicago's Loop, and travel to schools, colleges, town halls, libraries, community centers, and houses of worship throughout the United States.
The Context and the Need
According to 2011 Census data 46.3 million Americans – nearly 1 in 6 of us – live in poverty. This is the largest increase in the fifty-two years that the government has measured poverty.
Twenty million Americans – more than the entire population of New York State – live on less than $11,000 a year for a family of four.
One in five American children lives in poverty, most in families where at least one parent has a job.
Our Organization
ThanksGivingAmerica is a project of the AmericanPoverty.org campaign (http://americanpoverty.org), a 501(c)3 non-profit alliance of some of the most accomplished photographers in the United States. Joining us are renowned American writers, filmmakers and educators, all of whom seek to make alleviating poverty a national priority. Together we are working to dispel stereotypes and encourage actions that can create lasting impact on the lives of the disadvantaged. We believe that the stories of people struggling to overcome poverty deserve to be told - and that by sharing them we can inspire thousands and thousands of people to take action and create change.
Founded by Steve Liss, Columbia College Chicago teacher, Aspen Institute Ascend Fellow and thirty-year veteran Time Magazine photographer, AmericanPoverty.org and its parent organization, In Our Own Backyard, have mounted exhibits in galleries, town halls, libraries and schools from San Jose, CA to Washington, DC (https://vimeo.com/channels/231864.)
Beyond Thanksgiving
The result of this project will be published, exhibited and made available to those wanting to help reawaken the conversation, who want every day to be Thanksgiving, when our collective eyes – along with our hearts – are opened to those in poverty.
The exhibit will travel throughout the United State. Pending sponsorship, a book of photographs and essays would also be published as a permanent, tangible product that could be used as an ongoing reference and a record of the project. Moreover, the photographs and multimedia will become part of the AmericanPoverty.org Student Leadership Project (https://vimeo.com/28254822), which provides high school students opportunities to learn about poverty and encourage community involvement.
We can’t do this alone – we need your help!
IF this were easy, we wouldn’t be asking for your help. But even with photographers and editors donating their time, there are trememndous expenses: hotels, airfare and meals, the costs of making, mounting and shipping prints and the financial reality of launching a publicity campaign once the images are made.
And that's where you come in: your support today can help make this project a reality. Your support of both dollars and spirit will be present in every print, every exhibit and every step we collectively take towards making the invisible, visible.
The project is highly scalable, and the number and location of exhibits will dependent on the success of our Indiegogo campaign, as well as ongoing outreach to potential funders.
Our parent organization, In Our Own Backyard, NFP is a registered 501(c)3 non-profit organization. Accordingly all contributions to the ThanksGivingAmerica project are tax deductable under U.S. tax code.
Cool Perks
 In addition to our boundless gratitude, we are offering some terrific rewards; a chance to own historic and beautiful photography, printed from original transparencies or files using archival pigment ink insuring they will last a lifetime and more.
IMPORTANT INSTRUCTIONS FOR ORDERING PERKS
1. Remember to select "CLAIM THIS PERK" in the column above and to the right of this text before you make a donation. 
2. Where a choice of photographs is offered, please email us at perks@americanpoverty.org with your name, your choice of photograph and your shipping address.
Thank you!
Here are the choices, matched with minimum donations at right:

THE FIRST DAWN, INTERNATIONAL DATELINE, JANUARY 1, 2000
The first dawn of the new millennium, Chatham Islands, New Zealand, at the Interantional Dateline. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.

MOTHER TERESA
A rare portrait of Mother Teresa, taken for Time Magazine in 1991 but never published or exhibited. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
PERSONAL WORK
A ten-year-old boy sits alone in his juvenile detention cell in Texas. From the book No Place for Children: Voices From Juvenile Detention by Steve Liss.
 
Children as young as 10 march through the juvenile detention prison yard at dawn in Texas. Some have skipped school too much; some are gang members. From the book No Place for Children: Voices From Juvenile Detention by Steve Liss.
 
Earlene Grayer, 36, raised 16 children and grandchildren in this tiny shack with no running water in the Mississippi Delta, one of the poorest reagions in the United States. Photograph by Steve Liss.
 
A mother and child behind the screen door on the porch of their two-room shack in Tunica, Mississippi. As difficult as it is to believe, children still go to bed hungry in the United States of America. Photograph by Steve Liss.

AMERICAN SCENES
The homefront on the day that Iraq War I began, Illinois, 1991. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
Boston, Massachusetts. An historic view before the 'big dig' changed the city forever. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
Coming home: A cowboy in Wyoming returns to a mountaintop cow camp for the night. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
Dawn in Texas: A Texas Cowboy rouding up horses in the pre-dawn light. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
The Casper, Wyoming fire department in their new hazardous material suits, post 9/11. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
THE CLINTONS
The new President and First Lady, Pennsylvania Avenue, Inauguration Day 1993. Photographed from the camera truck leading the Presidential motorcade. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
In an exclusive photograph, Bill Clinton poses on the railroad tracks in his home town, Hope, Arkansas. The Secret Service closed the track for one-hundred miles in either direction for the shoot. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
RED SOX NATION
After eighty-four years, my beloved Red Sox win the World Series, the old Busch Stadium, St. Louis, 2004. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
In an historic comeback, the Red sox clinch the 2004 American League pennant in Yankee Stadium, the Bronx. Photograph for TIME by Steve Liss.
 
Pitcher Jim Longorg is carried off the field at Fenway Park as the 100-to-one shot Boston Red Sox clinch the American League pennant on the final day of the season, October 1, 1967. This was the single highlight of my childhood and this photograph was taken by a UPI shooter unknown to me then but who would become my friend and mentor: the late, great Don Robinson.
 
Ending what many have called the greatest baseball game ever palyed, Red Sox catcher Carlton Fisk jumps on home plate after his 12th inning home run won game 6 of the 1975 World Series at Fenway Park. Church bells rang throughout New England and John Kiley, the Red sox organist, played the Hallelujah Chorus as Fisk rounded the bases. Photograph by Steve Liss.
 

STATE OF THE UNION

In an historic moment, President Barack Obama deliver his 2009 State of the Union message before a joint session of Congress, at the same podium where President Lyndon Johnson told Congress in 1965 that "...we shall overcome." My friend and colleague Brooks Kraft donated this beautiful photograph, and the one below, out of his respect for what we're trying to do at AmericanPoverty.org. And we're deeply indebted to him. Photograph for TIME by Brooks Kraft.

THREE PRESIDENTS
In the tradition of the great LIFE photographers before him, Time shooter Brooks Kraft chose to forego the obvious picture from the front and instead captured an unforgetable and rare image of three American presidents walking the colonade of the White House. Photograph for TIME by Brooks Kraft.
 
Facebook and Twitter
Please participate on our brand new Facebook page (http://www.facebook.com/ThanksGivingAmerica) and follow the campaign on twitter @americanpoverty. 
 

Our Team

Steve Liss, Founder, director, 30-year veteran Time magazine photographer, Aspen Institute Ascend Fellow and lecturer in photography at Columbia College Chicago.
Jon Lowenstein, Co-founder, TedGlobal 2011 Fellow and 2011 John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation Fellow, former Pictures of the Year International Magazine Photographer of the Year.
Bill Healy, Communications Director, BA in Sociology from Georgetown, Master’s in Journalism from Northwestern, Masters in Education from Northwestern, Carnegie/Knight News 21 Fellow.
William C. Diehl, Educational Director, Ph.D. in Adult Education from Pennsylvania State University and interviews editor at The American Journal of Distance Education.
Mary Studley, former Time magazine Midwest picture editor, Indianapolis Community School Coordinator
Our advisory board includes:
Marion Wright Edelman, President of the Children’s Defense Fund.
Alex Kotlowitz, noted author of There Are No Children Here and producer of The Interrupters
Peter Loge, Principal, Milo Public Affairs, Washington, DC, and instructor at George Washington University and Emerson College.
Henry Berman, CEO, The Association of Small Foundations, Washington, DC, and a former producer of film and multimedia with a masters and a doctorate in Education from Boston University with a concentration on Educational Media and Technology.
Michelle Keenan, Director of Community Programs, Brigham and Woman’s Hospital Center for Community Health and Health Equity, Boston, MA.

story:
Luck, lust, loss, and love. A memoir about a little girl’s journey from a Shanghai brothel to Beijing society.

My Memoir:

The remarkable story of an illiterate sing-song girl who ascends from poverty into the upper levels of Beijing society.  This book reminisces about my guardian Nainai, a beautiful woman who is neither my mother nor grandmother, but rather my grandfather’s concubine.

About the Author:

Growing up in Beijing during China's Cultural Revolution, after two children and comfortably settled in New York, I feel compelled to explore my roots in a memoir spanning more than eight decades of the last century, from the closing days of the Manchu Dynasty, through Mao's reign, to the China's modern era.

The Last Concubine:

Qian RuoHua (NAINAI; 1924‐1986) is a pretty girl from Suzhou whose destitute parents sell her into the decadent world of Shanghai brothels at the age of 7. Her apprenticeship begins every morning when she cleans the mess made by the big girls the previous night. In the afternoons she studies music, poetry, calligraphy and chess, all the lessons needed to acquire the rudimentary qualities of a faux scholar. This potent combination of sexual charm and intellectual foreplay is an essential aspect of brothel culture. The Shanghai sing-song girls are Page Six trend setters, even holding their own beauty pageant.

Already a sought after virgin‐in‐waiting when she reaches puberty, Nainai's first night is auctioned off to the highest bidder. Her prize money sets a record, much to the delight of her greedy madam. After a few more years of plying her trade, Nainai is sold once more to a Beijing playboy, Yeye, my grandfather. Nainai is still only 16, while Yeye is 36 and living with his parents, his second wife, Popo - my grandmother, his three other concubines and four children, one of whom is my mother. After joining my family, Nainai soon relegates the head concubine, Little Willow, to the doghouse. Much to the dismay of Popo and the other concubines, the glamorous new arrival seizes control of the household.

POPO (1901‐1980) is a haute monde heiress, a direct descendant of the Manchu rulers. Her family’s dynasty is vast: banks, railways, mines, textile and cement factories and water works. At one point, the mining operation employed Herbert Hoover, future president of the United States, as its chief engineer. To accommodate her half-bound feet, Popo wears custom-made shoes that make her look ridiculous. A stench of cigarettes repels, and her zigzagged yellow-tinted finger and nails scares me. As warm and engaging as Nainai is, Popo is every bit as impersonal and cold.

Upon meeting Nainai, Popo actually takes a liking to her because of the notion that the teenager has exacted revenge for her on Little Willow. But her satisfaction is short‐lived, as she finds herself sitting at the foot of her husband’s opium bed, watching in anguish as Yeye and the young Nainai smoke and frolic on silken sheets.

Because of the ignominy inflicted by Nainai, Popo moves out of the family compound. When Yeye falls on hard times, she continues to provide financial support to the household. She never stops loving Yeye. On her deathbed she still thinks about his upcoming 80th birthday, even though she has never been invited to any of his parties over the years. Popo dies alone in the hospital.

Craving the love and attention she never received at home, my MOM (1934‐1968) heeds the call of the Communist Party and Chairman Mao, becoming a firm proponent of the cause. To the bewilderment of everyone, Mom runs away and joins the army in 1950, where a down‐to‐earth love and admiration from her platoon comrades fills the void. She transforms herself into a star of the new movement, and is an enthusiastic participant in all of Mao’s radical initiatives. Although hailed as the poster girl for the Party, she is ultimately betrayed by a jealous faction and winds up incarcerated where, completely forlorn and abandoned, she breaks down and commits suicide. Just before she hangs herself, she methodically writes two wills: the one to Chairman Mao is left on the desk. The other, a secret will, she hides in a pillow, hoping that my Dad will find it. The suicide instantly shatters my privileged and serene childhood. To make matters worse, the second will inadvertently sentences me to a virtual Gulag for five long years.

Nothing will impact me as much as the suicide.  I bounce around among family members, where I suffer abuses and instability at the hands of uncaring aunts and an indifferent Dad.

Aside from my three guardians, there are stories from the Beijing household. Poor Little Willow falls from grace when she is unable to conceive children for her master. Then there are the servants who provide the foundation for the household: butler, chauffeur, chef, tailor, wet nurse, nanny and personal maid ‐ stories that are many and entertaining.

This memoir is told during my days spent in the bathhouse with Nainai. When I finally reunite with her after a decade, I find that everything has changed, and any hopes to rekindle the former are gone.

YEYE (1903‐1984) sums up his life, “I have no regrets” is his final conclusion. 


What Is Needed:

I’m currently working on my second draft and plan to finish it by March 2012. Since I am writing in English, a language that was foreign to me not too long ago, extra steps are needed to make sure that nothing is lost in translation. The breakdown of my budget of USD $11,897 is as follow:
 $3,000 research expenses
 $2,500 editor
 $500 promotion
 $5,897 publishing 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share my campaign with your friends and contacts. There is nothing more rewarding than knowing how my memoir might have moved or empowered you. Follow me on my blog, Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn.  May my genealogy project inspire you to seek out your own past and motivate you to bridge a better future. I am sure we are related however distant!

Thank you for your interest and I appreciate your generous support in my quest.

Irene Eng

story:
Our Story

Kalimat is a team of three passionate individuals working with contributors from all over the world. It is a media production company that features bold, engaging political, design, film, fashion, literature, musical and new media content.

Launched in 2010, the magazine is a social, cultural and political quarterly committed to providing an outlet for open expression within the Arab region and its Diaspora. At the same time, it is a visual communication tool that serves to educate both those who read it and work to create it.

The magazine is an open outlet for expression and seeks to increase participation within the cultural/creative scene, providing a platform for Arab creatives to engage in thought and action around ideas, people and business, moving the world forward.

Through the value of design-focused thinking, data visualisation, education and conversations with influential Arab creatives, Kalimat transcends and redefines mainstream media, challenging the status quo."

The Impact

We think magazines are great and we still believe in the value of print. It continues to be the best medium to present and generate fresh ideas, and we want to show the world what weâ€™ve got! 

We want to give you (our readers) something to hold and share, pages to turn and beautiful graphics to look at without the screen making your head hurt. As a visual communication tool, we want it to become a reference guide with content that continues to stay relevant no matter when you pick it up.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donation will go towards printing, shipping and setting up an international distribution channel so you can buy Kalimat anywhere from Abu Dhabi to San Francisco as well as offering it online and via subscription. It will also help the continuation and longevity of Kalimat.


If you donate, you not only help us get closer to our goal, but you get some awesome stuff too like posters, copies of the Spring issue, subscriptions, special edition tote bags, special edition CDs, invitations to our opening night party, handwritten letters, notebooks, t-shirts and free advertising space in our magazine!


Other ways you can help

Word of mouth is one of the most powerful ways to get a message out. Help spread the word about our campaign to your family and friends and through your social networks (Twitter, Facebook, blog posts, Flickr, Google +). We want people to know about this campaign but to also know about the magazine and help us grow our reader base!


About the video

The video is a play on the many dialects in the Arab world. We had various people from different places such as Iraq, Lebanon, Egypt, Syria and Jordan (we wanted to feature every place but that would make for a long video!) say "Zabet Lahejtak" meaning "Fix your accent", because every place in the Arab region has different ways of saying things and sometimes we have to "adjust our accent" in order for the other person to understand us.

story:
If you procrastinate, chances are you think it's because you're uncommitted to the project, or maybe lazy or undisciplined. But I promise you that that's not the case. Procrastination, perfectionism and writer’s block are habits rooted in scarcity and fear – and the great news is that once you characterize those barriers and start working to overcome them, you can "magically" recover all the commitment, energy and discipline you thought you had lost.

My new book, The Seven Secrets of the Prolific, tells you how.

Hi, I'm Hillary Rettig, an author, coach and workshop leader who specializes in helping ambitious and creative people from all walks of life use their time better, create more rewarding careers, and overcome procrastination, perfectionism, fears and blocks. I am also a vegan, a former foster mom of four Sudanese refugees ("Lost Boys"), a lover of dogs and other animals, and a kidney donor. A Bronx native, I now live in the wonderful community of East Boston.


Read more about me, and also check out numerous free ebooks and other downloads here. 


"So on target – I felt like you wrote this just for me."
– Advance Reader
My mission is to help as many people as possible be as productive and happy as possible. In 2006, my book The Lifelong Activist: How to Change the World Without Losing Your Way was published by Lantern Books. It's a self-help book for activists, organizers, educators, human service workers and anyone with a strong progressive mission. The Lifelong Activist has sold thousands of copies, and gotten some great reviews. You can read the entire text here.

"I've read no other book on conquering writer's block that is so wise, practical and compassionate. Your strategies have helped me immensely."
– Advance Reader

The Seven Secrets of the Prolific will tell you everything you need to know to liberate yourself from the forces that cause underproductivity, including perfectionism, resource constraints, time constraints, ineffective writing processes, toxic rejections, bias and internalized oppression, and disempowering career paths. You'll learn, for instance, how to:

  • recognize perfectionism in all its forms - and how to recover from it
  • resource yourself the way prolific writers do
  • increase your writing "tempo" 2x, 3x or even more by replacing a linear process with a two-dimensional one
  • manage your time so that you not only get your writing done, but your other important personal and professional priorities
  • recognize, and cope with, bias, ambivalence and internalized oppression, even a smidgeon of which can really hold you back
  • cope with the silly/annoying/challenging questions, comments and suggestions writers are constantly subjected to (a popular topic in classes!)
  • recognize, avoid, and heal from, toxic rejection
  • avoid exploitative career paths, and craft an empowered career through self-publishing and other means

and MUCH more.

The Seven Secrets of the Prolific is for all writers, including those who do fiction, nonfiction, memoir, screenplays, and business and nonprofit writing. There's a chapter on writing for the Internet, and a whole section devoted to the needs of graduate students and faculty. Click here for sample chapters.

I need your help to make this venture a success. Here's the challenge:

"Showed me the way to consistent productivity!"
– Advance Reader

I'm seeking to fund the project by raising $7,500 through pre-orders, which will be used to print the paperback, produce the ebook, pay for wonderful art by the amazing Barry Deutsch (www.amptoons.com), and do some much-needed promotion. The paperback will retail for $34.95, including shipping and handling, but you can pre-order it now for $25 (including s&h) – a 29% savings PLUS I'll throw in the ebook for free!

The ebook itself will retail for a super-affordable $3.95, but I'll even discount that to $3 for this promotion.

Additionally, I'm offering you a rare opportunity to purchase the book plus discounted coaching by yours truly – a great “jump starter” for yourself or any writer or student in your life. Click here for more information on my coaching.

Thank you for your interest and support of my work. Please check out the deals, and preorder now. These deals last only until August 15, so don't procrastinate! :-) Please also let others know about this great opportunity. Together, we can improve lives, and help more people become joyful prolific writers.
