My new book, The Seven Secrets of the Prolific, tells you how.
Hi, I'm Hillary Rettig, an author,
coach and workshop leader who specializes in helping ambitious and
creative people from all walks of life use their time better, create
more rewarding careers, and overcome procrastination, perfectionism,
fears and blocks. I am also a vegan, a former
foster mom of four Sudanese refugees ("Lost Boys"), a lover of dogs and other animals, and
a kidney
donor. A Bronx native, I now live in the wonderful community of
East Boston.Read more about me, and also check out
numerous free ebooks and other downloads here. "So on target – I felt like you wrote this just for me." – Advance ReaderMy
mission is to help as many people as possible be as productive and
happy as possible. In 2006, my book The Lifelong Activist: How to
Change the World Without Losing Your Way was published by Lantern
Books. It's a self-help book for activists, organizers, educators,
human service workers and anyone with a strong progressive mission. The Lifelong Activist has
sold thousands of copies, and gotten some great reviews. You can read
the entire text here.  "I've read no other book on conquering writer's block that is so wise, practical and compassionate. Your strategies have helped me immensely." – Advance Reader

The Seven Secrets of the Prolific will tell you everything you need to know to
liberate yourself from the forces that cause underproductivity,
including perfectionism, resource constraints, time constraints, ineffective writing processes, toxic rejections, bias and internalized oppression, and disempowering career paths. You'll learn, for instance, how to:
recognize perfectionism in all its forms - and how to recover from it
resource yourself the way prolific writers do
increase your writing "tempo" 2x, 3x or even more by replacing a linear process with a two-dimensional one
manage your time so that you not only get your writing done, but your other important personal and professional priorities

recognize, and cope with, bias, ambivalence and internalized oppression, even a smidgeon of which can really hold you back
cope with the silly/annoying/challenging questions, comments and suggestions writers are constantly subjected to (a popular topic in classes!)
recognize, avoid, and heal from, toxic rejection
avoid exploitative career paths, and craft an empowered career through self-publishing and other means

and MUCH more. The
Seven Secrets of the Prolific is for all writers,
including those who do fiction, nonfiction, memoir, screenplays, and business and nonprofit writing. There's a chapter on writing for the
Internet, and a whole section devoted to the needs of graduate
students and faculty. Click here for sample chapters.I need your help to make this
venture a success. Here's the challenge:
"Showed me the way to consistent productivity!" – Advance Reader
I'm seeking to fund the project by raising $7,500 through pre-orders, which will be used to print
the paperback, produce the ebook, pay for wonderful art by the
amazing Barry Deutsch (www.amptoons.com),
and do some much-needed promotion. The paperback will retail for
$34.95, including shipping and handling, but you can pre-order it now
for $25 (including s&h) – a 29% savings PLUS I'll throw in the ebook for free! The ebook itself will retail for a super-affordable $3.95, but I'll even discount that to $3 for this promotion. Additionally, I'm
offering you a rare opportunity to purchase the book plus discounted
coaching by yours truly – a great “jump starter” for yourself
or any writer or student in your life. Click here for more information on my coaching.Thank you for your
interest and support of my work. Please check out the deals, and
preorder now. These deals last only until August 15, so don't
procrastinate! :-) Please also let others know about this great
opportunity. Together, we can improve lives, and help more people
become joyful prolific writers.

story:
Help send me to the Native American Journalists Association/Native Public Media conference in Tempe, Arizona from July 18 through July 21!

I am a 28-year-old graduate of Georgia State University's Journalism program, with a minor in English and a research specialty in American Indian and advocacy media. Since graduation, I have been working as a nanny during the day and as a journalist and Native American activist at night.

I have written for Last Real Indians and have worked as an activist on two sacred site campaigns -- Pe Sla and Hickory Ground. I am active in the southeast chapter of Idle No More and actively engage in education and dialogue regarding Native American issues and rights. I am particularly interested in problematic imagery (mascots, Halloween costumes, etc) and land rights/sacred sites. I have also begun to focus on tribal access to education and language & spiritual/cultural preservation, as well as tribal community health & wellness.

In addition to this, I work as a volunteer media adviser for the student newspaper at my alma mater, The Signal (where I was editor in chief), and am currently organizing an alumni association to support the current newspaper staff in its endeavors. In the future, I would like to find a full-time advisory position, preferably at a tribal college. In the meantime, I am interested in putting together journalism curriculum for reservation high school students, as well as presenting on media sensitivity and diversity. I am also working on putting together curriculum for local elementary schools here in Georgia to use during their required Georgia history section that will involve regionally accurate representations of Native Americans from the southeast, rather than skewed and often past-tense depictions (the curriculum will be taught by tribal representatives as well).

As I mentioned, I am a full-time nanny during the day, which leaves me little time, energy and money to pursue other projects. However, in the fall, I will be able to nanny part-time and spend more time and energy on these other projects and endeavors. This transition is very exciting for me, as I've been working toward this goal since graduation. None the less, it's also quite frightening, as I will no longer have quite so stable a salary.

This brings me to one of the main reasons I am hoping to attend this upcoming conference -- it will not only allow me to network with other Native American journalists, but I will have the opportunity to learn the skills I need to explore other endeavors. The conference schedule has been released, and this is what I'm planning on doing during my time in Tempe:

Thursday, July 18:
- NewU's Entrepreneurial Idea's Talking Circle
- Heard Museum Tour
- Opening Ceremony & Reception

Friday, July 19:
- NAJA News Conference
- Exhibitions
- First Nations & the Freedom of Information Act
- Founder's Luncheon
- Set Your Social Media Policy
- Applying Native American Values in Leadership and the Workplace
- Student Celebration

Saturday, July 20:
- Native Fit Morning Run
- Sacred Spaces and Access in Indian Country
- Advance Your Career With A Journalism Fellowship
- Exhibitions
- The Importance of Digital Inclusion for Indian Country
- National Native Media Awards Banquet

My registration fee of $117 has already been paid, thanks to a generous sponsor. However, another sponsor I had been depending on backed out last minute, leaving me solely responsible for my hotel ($275 total) and flight (estimated between $275 and $350).

This is where you come in! If you believe in what I do, if you want to see any of the above listed projects come to fruition, or if you just want to see me write more, the best possible way to help me do that is to donate and help me get out to Arizona in July! Every little bit will help tremendously, even just $5! I need roughly $600 to get there, but if I don't get that much it will still help and, if I miraculously raise more than that, the remainder is going toward a new laptop (my current one is seven years old, so you can imagine that a new one might also help get some work done!).

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and contribute if you decide to do so. Knowing that people believe in me enough to financially support me is such a humbling, incredible feeling!

story:
Short Summary

Kraken Reading Series is based in Denton, Texas with headquarters held in Paschell's cocktail bar on the Denton Square. We are an independent poetry reading series that hosts readings from August to April that features poets from across the country. Founded in in 2012 by Kyle McCord and Justin Bigos, the series met with great success as well as hosting a phenomenal reading at AWP Boston. We bring poetry to the Denton community and bring readers to new audiences and audiences to new readers. The 2013-14 season begins this August with series directors Kyle McCord and Trista Edwards. Trista Edwards joined in 2013 after Justin Bigos departed for Arizona for professional pursuits! 

Please check out our Facebook page to see past and future readers! We have astounding line-ups!

We want to bring the second season in with a bang! We are looking to bring merch to the Kraken Reading Series! T-shirts and, perhaps, a few surpise goodies! 

What We Need & What You Get

For our t-shirt funds we will need to raise $800. The shirts will come in styles/sizes for both men and women. They will be heather-grey and feature our trademark logo. (compliments of Kraken team member, Luke Heister)

If we exceed our goal, the funds will go directly back into the series. This means helping to accommodate our traveling poets and printing more tees in the coming seasons!

 

The Impact

We are grateful for your donations. The poetry community of Denton is booming and we hope to keep that enthusisam strong! We want to wear that Kraken logo proudly and spread the word in our town, in our poets' towns, on book tours, and future AWPs. Help us support poetry in our community and yours!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

You can help by spreading the word for us! 

You can use the share tool here and let all your friends know about our campaign!

story:
Asking for Help Ain't Easy...

Hello friends!

See, there's this retreat I'm planning on attending in October called GayRomLit near Chicago.  This will be my second year attending this fantastic event, and this year is special because I will be attending as a supporting author (under the pen name Nicole Forcine). It feels as if I have finally 'arrived'.  I have a pen name, and some fans, and people looking forward to meeting me.  Being a supporting author gives me a chance to really get out there with my peers and make connections that will really help me in this newly chosen lifepath.

I paid for my admission with my own money, My partner got me the plane ticket as a birthday prezzie...and now I had to worry about a hotel and eating/cab fare/etc.

Last year, I was employed, but since then I've been struggling with the hydra that is depression, anxiety and newly-diagnosed fibromyalgia and writing from home has become my 'job'. So far, I have one full length novel published, a few short freebies, one entry in an anthology, and one novella officially on the way early next year. I was planning on paying for that with an advance from my second full length novel, but I am still working on it. So that advance will not be in my hot little hands in time, so...yeah.  I'm going to need help or a lot of money is going down the drain.



How'd You Get That Total?

  • I'm sharing a room with someone, so my half of the hotel (Indian Lakes Resort) is about $300.
  • From what I understand, Chicago is a pretty pricey city, and for some reason the hotel is bloody far away from O'Hare airport to Bloomingdale, with fare averaging about $50 both ways (approx. $100).
  • ...and of course, once I get there, I'll need to eat.  I have actually no idea how much meals are going to cost since the place is smack dab in the middle of the a golf course, so I might end up having to nosh at the hotel's restaurants (approx. $200-300).
  • And, of course, Indiegogo wants their cut :)

Why you should help?

  •  You will help amplify a wildly diverse voice and allow me to speak about my experiences and process at GRL 
  • I will be documenting the event on several social media streams, with thanks to my backers
  • I've assembled some tokens of appreciation for those of you who help
  • I'll never be able to thank you enough.

Perks

I wouldn't just ask without offering something back, right:

  • At the $5 level, my adorable Munchkin kitty Weasel will pose with a personalized Thank You note (even though you're helping take his Mum away for a weekend :) ).

  • At the $15 level, I will send you one of my crocheted coffee cozies that I am bringing with me as swag OR a knitted bookmark

  • At the $20 level, you'll get a digital copy of every single one of my works up until To The Moon and Back is released.

  • At the $25 level, I will write you lyrics of a custom parody.  Any song, most subjects*
  • At the $50 level, I will put your name in the dedication page of this novel (tentatively titled "To the Moon and Back"), and if you like, a personalized signed copy once it comes out.
  • At $70, you get all of that goodness, and a ticket in a drawing for a badass Innsmouth tiki mug from my friends at Horror in Clay.  I have the Cthulhu mug and I absolutely adore it! The drawing is only for the first five days, though. After that, I will send you a signed copy of my first novel, This Little Whatever, and the novella, Shaken Up (once it's released next year of course!)
  • At the $100 dollar level, you get everything above, plus you'll get a signed copy of This Little Whatever and To The Moon and Back (once published), you also get personalized video thank you every day of the retreat These will be send to your email via and unlisted YouTube link (so it doesn't get mixed up with any other video I will be taking), and released to the public two weeks later.
  • At the $250 dollar level, I will name my first born after you.  Okay, I'm kidding, but wow, thanks!  Not only will you get all of the other perks, but I will arrange an interview with an attending author during GRL, and you can help me with the questions**.

Can't give? 

No worries, I know things are rough these days.  If you could share the link with friends, that would be great!  Thank you so much!



*use common sense, folks.  No threats, no rapes, no punching down, etc...
**depending on author consent, of course.

story:
Welcome to the RESIN RIVER Indiegogo campaign!
     
            I am Sarah E. Cote, an artist from Orono, Maine.
    Growing up in Maine was, as any childhood is in a small university town, boring. Or so I thought. It was too small for me, the big fish. It was too plain, too conservative, too quiet. I knew everyone in high school because we had gone to kindergarten together. It was the quintessential, anywhere New England childhood. Old creaking cold wood floors, wool socks, my mom's coffee cake on the weekend, the sound of light rock easing out of the radio while my dad read the newspaper. It was jeans and sweatshirts, hockey games, town festivals...It was safe.

    Then, suddenly it wasn't.

            Suddenly my family had a secret that I now know many families hold close to their chests. I grew up never talking about this secret, the event that changed my family's entire world. Suddenly it was us against everyone and everything. The trauma that utterly quaked our family apart would be the same one that has proved to be the biggest learning curve of my existence to date.
           
            I began writing RESIN RIVER, first as a journaling exercise to suss out a lot of pent up emotion and aggression that frankly, I never saw myself sharing with a therapist let alone the general public. It quickly took shape, becoming a timeline of the past and present and an imagined future- all the while these difficult things were continuing to pile up and just relentlessly hound me. I soon realized, this could be an outlet to say everything I never said but wanted to say, it could be an outlet to stick up for my family and be there for them in a way I never could in real life. I was fifteen when these vague difficulties I am eluding to started up, and I carried a guilt with me for years. One seeded in being useless, ineffective, in the way emotionally and physically.
            In the process of writing and just living a life full of varied experiences, I came to believe that I am telling a global, relatable story that has the potential to provide reassurance in a sense. That people in similar situations (I know, so vague) can read the story and hear their own fears, excitements, traumas and joys reflected in the words and maybe not feel so isolated, like I did. And that is just one part of the book. The family story intertwines with our protagonist, Myra's story. She finds herself living in an abandoned hunting cabin in the Maine wilderness. There, she survives with a small group of dear friends. These stories weave in and out until they connect and yeild something entirely out of this world.


           Contributors will help give me time. I am at the fifth editing process, I've even gathered a select group of people to read and give notes/edits. It has a lot of editing left to go, but it is a finished manuscript. Beginning, middle and end. It needs polishing, it needs smoothing out, just like any work of art in eternal process, does. Contributors will essentially let me finish my book and get it to the point where I can reach out to literary agents. I can't say that I have ever shared such a raw and personal piece of art. It's terrifying reaching for a dream! It is! But it is also exciting and powerful, and by contributing you'll be doing just that- helping me grab a dream. You'll be helping me tell a story that I have been telling myself for ten years. Only this time, you'll be giving me a pedestal to do so.

Break it Down Now...

        To make this project work, I need your help. To finish my edits, to be able to send out queries by July 1st I am asking for $4,000.

The expenses:

1.) Rent. I need $1,200 for March, April, May and June's rent.

To not be out of housing, but to pursue this goal, I need to afford the place I live.

2.) Living Expenses, minimal salary and saying thank you.

Not only will I be treating the next four months as if writing is my job, I need money to pay my living expenses ie; gas, insurance, groceries, water, electric, internet. In total $2,800 which breaks down to $700 per month or $175 per week.

A portion of this money is also going to provide you with real live perks, it will cover printing and shipping, maybe to get to your very own door!


 
    PERKS



    If you find that this project speaks to you, or you are struck with interest by the background I have given, I hope you contribute. Contributions to me, are gifts and I like to let my contributors know how much I value them, by giving in return.

    Some of the perks you can expect are public digital thanks, digital files of the cover art to print out at your own convenience, how ever many times to be shared with however many friends. Hard prints of the cover art, shout outs on my RESIN RIVER Facebook Page, Skype time with me to ask questions and talk about your own experiences, and a PDF version of the first chapter of the book.



    If I do not reach my entire goal, your contributions will still make a huge impact on the next four months of my editing process. Rent is my main concern, and with a place to be, I will write my little heart out. If I get more than just rent covered, I will still write my heart out. If I surpass my goal, I can expand perks to hard gifts, bookmarks, stickers and postcards!


The Impact

         By finishing RESIN RIVER, getting it to a place where I am ready to reach out to literary agents and small presses, you, the contributor, will have played a major role in launching a life work into the world. A piece of work that I am personally passionate about, also a story that has the potential to touch so many people. Like so many families, so many individuals, the event that shook us was one of sexual violence.
        It's taken years to speak about this event, especially since it was not mine to speak about. Instead I kept quiet because I felt like if it was not my trauma, I had no right to feel so traumatized about it. But there were ripples through us all, of varying speeds and sizes. We each dealt and are still dealing with the repercussions to this day.
        With the recent blessing of my family member who's life experiences I do encorporate into the story, getting it finished will be of paramount meaning to the both of us and to our family. I don't claim to know her true experiences as, I would never claim to know anyone's, but I hope in some way I am giving her a voice, and giving others a voice. I certainly have claimed my voice in the process of writing RESIN RIVER.
 

Risks & Challenges

I will complete my goal. That sounds presumptuous, but it's been a long journey into getting RESIN RIVER to where it is and I don't see the point in ever giving up on getting it published. But to be clear, this campaign is to let me finish editing it. Your perks do not rely on it being published. I would be so honored to have the support in the home stretch.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are like me, and have a minimal amount of financial resources, you can still make a huge impact on this project by contributing with mere pocket change. I mean that is the amazing thing about crowd sourcing, a small amount goes a long way. If you cannot contribute monitarily, you can help by sharing the campaign with your friends and family members. You can make noise for me and RESIN RIVER and the issues it explores. Be my champions! Post it on facebook, on your blogs, tweet the link, shout it out!

There are also tools for sharing on Indiegogo for your ease.

    And that's all there is to it.

It was the quintessential, anywhere New England childhood. Old creaking cold wood floors, wool socks, my mom's coffee cake on the weekend, the sound of light rock easing out of the radio while my dad read the newspaper. It was jeans and sweatshirts, hockey games, town festivals...It was safe.Then, suddenly it wasn't.         Suddenly my family had a secret that I now know many families hold close to their chests. I grew up never talking about this secret, the event that changed my family's entire world. Suddenly it was us against everyone and everything. The trauma that utterly quaked our family apart would be the same one that has proved to be the biggest learning curve of my existence to date.                 I began writing RESIN RIVER, first as a journaling exercise to suss out a lot of pent up emotion and aggression that frankly, I never saw myself sharing with a therapist let alone the general public. It quickly took shape, becoming a timeline of the past and present and an imagined future- all the while these difficult things were continuing to pile up and just relentlessly hound me. I soon realized, this could be an outlet to say everything I never said but wanted to say, it could be an outlet to stick up for my family and be there for them in a way I never could in real life. I was fifteen when these vague difficulties I am eluding to started up, and I carried a guilt with me for years. One seeded in being useless, ineffective, in the way emotionally and physically.         In the process of writing and just living a life full of varied experiences, I came to believe that I am telling a global, relatable story that has the potential to provide reassurance in a sense. That people in similar situations (I know, so vague) can read the story and hear their own fears, excitements, traumas and joys reflected in the words and maybe not feel so isolated, like I did. And that is just one part of the book. The family story intertwines with our protagonist, Myra's story. She finds herself living in an abandoned hunting cabin in the Maine wilderness. There, she survives with a small group of dear friends. These stories weave in and out until they connect and yeild something entirely out of this world.        Contributors will help give me time. I am at the fifth editing process, I've even gathered a select group of people to read and give notes/edits. It has a lot of editing left to go, but it is a finished manuscript. Beginning, middle and end. It needs polishing, it needs smoothing out, just like any work of art in eternal process, does. Contributors will essentially let me finish my book and get it to the point where I can reach out to literary agents. I can't say that I have ever shared such a raw and personal piece of art. It's terrifying reaching for a dream! It is! But it is also exciting and powerful, and by contributing you'll be doing just that- helping me grab a dream. You'll be helping me tell a story that I have been telling myself for ten years. Only this time, you'll be giving me a pedestal to do so.

  Break it Down Now...
        To make this project work, I need your help. To finish my edits, to be able to send out queries by July 1st I am asking for $4,000.
The expenses:
1.) Rent. I need $1,200 for March, April, May and June's rent.
To not be out of housing, but to pursue this goal, I need to afford the place I live. 
2.) Living Expenses, minimal salary and saying thank you.
Not only will I be treating the next four months as if writing is my job, I need money to pay my living expenses ie; gas, insurance, groceries, water, electric, internet. In total $2,800 which breaks down to $700 per month or $175 per week. 
A portion of this money is also going to provide you with real live perks, it will cover printing and shipping, maybe to get to your very own door!
  PERKS 

If you find that this project speaks to you, or you are struck with interest by the background I have given, I hope you contribute. Contributions to me, are gifts and I like to let my contributors know how much I value them, by giving in return. Some of the perks you can expect are public digital thanks, digital files of the cover art to print out at your own convenience, how ever many times to be shared with however many friends. Hard prints of the cover art, shout outs on my RESIN RIVER Facebook Page, Skype time with me to ask questions and talk about your own experiences, and a PDF version of the first chapter of the book. 
If I do not reach my entire goal, your contributions will still make a huge impact on the next four months of my editing process. Rent is my main concern, and with a place to be, I will write my little heart out. If I get more than just rent covered, I will still write my heart out. If I surpass my goal, I can expand perks to hard gifts, bookmarks, stickers and postcards!
   The Impact         By finishing RESIN RIVER, getting it to a place where I am ready to reach out to literary agents and small presses, you, the contributor, will have played a major role in launching a life work into the world. A piece of work that I am personally passionate about, also a story that has the potential to touch so many people. Like so many families, so many individuals, the event that shook us was one of sexual violence.         It's taken years to speak about this event, especially since it was not mine to speak about. Instead I kept quiet because I felt like if it was not my trauma, I had no right to feel so traumatized about it. But there were ripples through us all, of varying speeds and sizes. We each dealt and are still dealing with the repercussions to this day.         With the recent blessing of my family member who's life experiences I do encorporate into the story, getting it finished will be of paramount meaning to the both of us and to our family. I don't claim to know her true experiences as, I would never claim to know anyone's, but I hope in some way I am giving her a voice, and giving others a voice. I certainly have claimed my voice in the process of writing RESIN RIVER.    Risks & ChallengesI will complete my goal. That sounds presumptuous, but it's been a long journey into getting RESIN RIVER to where it is and I don't see the point in ever giving up on getting it published. But to be clear, this campaign is to let me finish editing it. Your perks do not rely on it being published. I would be so honored to have the support in the home stretch.   
  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are like me, and have a minimal amount of financial resources, you can still make a huge impact on this project by contributing with mere pocket change. I mean that is the amazing thing about crowd sourcing, a small amount goes a long way. If you cannot contribute monitarily, you can help by sharing the campaign with your friends and family members. You can make noise for me and RESIN RIVER and the issues it explores. Be my champions! Post it on facebook, on your blogs, tweet the link, shout it out! There are also tools for sharing on Indiegogo for your ease.   And that's all there is to it.

story:
My name is Thomas Sartain. I was raised by poor parents in the mid-west during the 70's and 80's. My parents died 42 months apart from 1983 to 1986 leaving my siblings and I to fend for ourselves. At age 19, a series of bad decisions landed me in prison where I had to learn to survive without any help from the outside. I had a spiritual awakening at age 30 while on parole and changed my behavior. I applied the concepts of cognitive therapy to my life and it took 10 years to get my life in order. At age 40, I almost died 3 times and the good Lord spared me. I decided that my life no longer belonged to me and I wanted to share my story to help troubled youth. I am walking a path now. I have a legitimate story and the ability to communicate it to the troubled kids of this country because I was one of them. 30 Years & a Wake Up can be my platform to do that.                         Without this INDIEGOGO fundraising campaign, I will be unable to move forward. I receive S.S.I./R.S.D.I. and I cannot afford to pay my publisher and get books printed. With $5,000, I can change the culture of troubled kids.

     I only need start up money. $5,000 will allow me to pay my independent publisher Studio Z Publishing, and the rest will be used to print copies of my book. Once I sell the first crop of books, I will be able to afford moving forward without any help.

     Anyone that donates $25 or more will receive a free autographed copy of 30 Years & a Wake Up.

     If I don't meet my goal of $5,000, I will use whatever money I do raise towards paying Studio Z Publishing for their services. 

     I believe that my project is valuable to the world because it is written with the intention of introducing cognitive therapy to today's troubled kids. I made many of the same mistakes as them and I found a way through the darkness. I made genuine change. I want so badly to talk to the kids and to give them someone to listen to and learn from, that is real. My entire appeal is that I do relate to today's kids. Parents and society are looking for a solution to the growing problem of the behavior of many of today's youth. My book tells a story that will grip its reader, and then encourage them to change through inspiration and example. I hope to use 30 Years & a Wake Up to launch an advice blog for teens and to do motivational speaking at jails, prisons, juvenile detention centers and possibly even high schools.

story:
I am currently between Army deployments (and between jobs) but want to take advantage of an unbeatable opportunity to visit Antarctica. Before my serious surgical complications in 2009, I funded adventures for myself and my staff to remote areas to provide dental treatment to the underserved. Since I left private practice to join the Army, I can no longer afford to plan mission trips, but since my near- death experiences in 2009 and 2010( during and after the surgeries), I have realized how brief and wonderful life can be. I am compiling my essays into a book with the hopes of inspiring others to grab life by the horns and make the most of every day.

www.drwilliamhartel.com

story:
Though we did not meet our campaign goal, Guide Her Home is still a reality. Order your copy today!

Welcome to part two of the IndieGoGo Campaign for Guide Her Home: A Year of Hope After a Child’s Tragedy.


    As April of 2010 came to a close, Jolene Lavine wondered why her family’s typically packed schedule was suddenly empty. Her question was answered on April 29, when tragedy struck.

    While preparing for a weekly horseback riding lesson, her ten-year-old daughter, Jessica, was kicked in the head by a horse. That day Jolene’s family began traveling a road they’d never imagined possible.

    Guide Her Home: A Year of Hope After a Child’s Tragedy follows the family through the first year of Jessica’s injury. From the accident itself to all that followed, readers share the intimate experience of a family’s fight for a child’s life and a mother’s search for the light that will help guide her daughter home again.


Part One of this campaign, including weekly updates on the project’s progress can be found here.


Click here to read the first 17 pages of Guide Her Home: A Year of Hope After a Child’s Tragedy.

Click here to listen to the first 17 pages of Guide Her Home: A Year of Hope After a Child’s Tragedy. Read by the author, Jolene Lavine. 19 minutes long.


Our goal is to self-publish this book in the summer of 2014.

Because our first campaign was not fully funded, we took the opportunity to reevaluate both the costs for this project, as well as our personal budget to determine where we could save money along the way.  Both avenues brought savings to light, but at the end of the day not quite enough, so here we are.

Having received positive feedback regarding the incentives involved in the prior campaign, we have kept many of them in place, with just a bit of tweaking. Once again, we hope the incentives will help make the support of this book more enticing.

The funds raised in this campaign will help to issue the final payments to the editor, the graphic designer, the interior book designer, the printing of the books, as well as the processing and shipping fees.

This has been a truly humbling experience. Jolene is very excited and, honestly, scared to see this book go out into the world. We thank you all who are eager to read it and feel it is a story that must be told.

Thank you for your consideration and any help you can lend to making this dream a reality.

As always, peace and love, and Gratitude Rising for any support you can give to Guide Her Home.

story:
A kezdeményezés utóélete részletesen a http://vasarnapi.tumblr.com címen követhető. A 3 kutatás eredményéről Indiegogo-s update formájában is be fogok számolni.

A gyűjtés sikeres volt és lezárult, alább az eredeti szöveg olvasható.

FIGYELEM! A kampány sikeres volt, de a gyűjtés tovább folyik. A Paypal fizetési szolgáltató által levont magasabb jutalék miatt az 1300 eurón felül még kb. 100 euróra lesz szükség a közvélemény-kutatók kifizetéséhez.

Az ezen felül összegyűlt pénzt az utolsó forintig civil szervezetek támogatására fogjuk fordítani. Azt, hogy melyik civil szervezet kapja a támogatást, a kampány támogatói fogják szavazással eldönteni.

 (Update: a +100 eurót közben össze is dobtátok, innentől civil szervezetek támogatására gyűjtünk. Köszönet érte!)

Kérlek, oszd meg ezt az oldalt az ismerőseiddel!

Mi ez az egész? Please click here for an English summary.

A terv az, hogy a közösség összefogásával reprezentatív közvélemény-kutatási eredményeket szerzünk a vasárnapi boltbezárás ügyében, melyekkel szembesíteni lehet a kormányt. 

A 3 nagy közvélemény-kutató mindegyikétől megrendeljük ugyanazt az egy kérdéses kutatást. Ez összesen kb. 370 000 Ft-ba kerül (lásd lejjebb), amit a kezdeményezés támogatói dobnak össze, itt az IndieGogon.

A támogatások csak akkor jutnak el hozzám, és a kutatásokat csak akkor rendeljük meg, ha összegyűlik a kitűzött 1300 eurós összeg. Ha nem gyűlik össze a pénz, akkor az IndieGogo automatikusan visszautalja a befizetéseket a támogatóknak.

Segíts Te is, hogy kiderüljön az emberek véleménye egy fontos és mindenkit értintő kérdésben!

Abban reménykedem, hogy egyértelműen kiderül: az emberek többsége nem támogatja a vasárnapi boltbezárást.

Az álom az, hogy az eredmények ismeretében a döntéshozók meghátrálnak, és visszacsinálják az egészet.

A projekt lezajlását a http://vasarnapi.tumblr.com címen dokumentálom.

A támogatáshoz mindössze egy netes fizetésre alkalmas bankkártya szükséges. Részletes, magyar nyelvű útmutatót itt találsz:

http://vasarnapi.tumblr.com/post/110160955422/hogyan-kuldj-tamogatast

Miért fontos ez számomra?

Nem láttam semmilyen kutatási eredményt, tanulmányt, amivel a kormány érdemben indokolta volna a boltok vasárnapi bezárását, az ezzel kapcsolatos nepszavazási kezdeményezéseket pedig mondvacsinált okokkal utasítják el.

Az, hogy a családok legyenek együtt vasárnaponként, számomra kissé álszent indoknak tűnik. Aki a családjával szeretne lenni vasárnap, az minden további nélkül meg tudja ezt tenni úgy is, hogy közben nyitva vannak a boltok.

Ez alól egyedül azok a kereskedelmi dolgozók a kivételek, akik vasárnap épp dolgoznak, de nem hiszem, hogy őket különösebben boldoggá tenné, amikor a munkaerő-igény hetedrészének megszűnése miatt minden hetedik embert lapátra tesznek közülük.

Azt akarom, hogy kiderüljön az emberek véleménye a vasárnapi boltbezárásról.

Ezt a kezdeményezést saját ötletem alapján, civilként, magyar állampolgárként, bármiféle politikai párt vagy szervezet támogatása nélkül folytatom.

Hogyan segíthetsz?

  • Támogasd a gyűjtést néhány száz (vagy néhány ezer) forinttal
  • Oszd meg a kampányt Facebookon, Twitteren, mesélj róla ismerőseidnek
  • Ha a sajtóban dolgozol, írj róla

A támogatás elküldésének folyamatához összeállítottam egy képes útmutatót, melyet ide kattintva tudsz megnézni.

Mi a haszna?

Őszintén szólva, közvetlen haszna valószínűleg semmi. Bármi is lesz az eredménye a kutatásnak, nem hiszem, hogy a kormányt ez lépéskényszerbe hozná.

Közvetett haszna annyi, hogy kiderül az emberek véleménye a kérdésben. Az eredmények mindenki számára nyilvánosak és felhasználhatók lesznek.

A sajtó levonhatja a konzekvenciákat, odadörgölheti a kormány orra alá az eredményt, a választópolgár pedig elgondolkozhat azon, hogy vajon kinek az érdekeit képviselik az ilyen döntések.

Emelett egy új, izgalmas módszert találunk épp fel arra, hogy a társadalom kifejezhesse véleményét a kormány intézkedéseiről. 

A kapott eredmények reprezentatív mintán, 3 független kutatóintézet által is elvégzett kutatásból származnak majd, így nehezen vitatható, hogy valóban az emberek véleményét tükrözik.

Részletes terv

A teljes projektet maximális transzparencia mellett, minden dokumentációt, számlát, információt nyilvánosságra hozva, a teljes költségelszámolást tételesen bemutatva fogom lebonyolítani. Keresni nem fogok rajta.

A projekt életét a http://vasarnapi.tumblr.com címen lehet követni.

  • A pénzt arra gyűjtjük, hogy legalább 3 közvélemény-kutatótól meg tudjunk rendelni egy 1000 fős, reprezentatív  mintán végzett közvélemény-kutatást, ugyanazt a kérdést feltéve: "Azt, hogy a boltok továbbra is nyitva tarthassanak vasárnaponként, ön támogatja, vagy nem támogatja?"
  • Az 5 legnagyobb közvélemény-kutatótól ajánlatot kértem a kutatás elvégzésére. Eddig hárman válaszoltak, a Medián 95000 Ft + Áfa, a Tárki 60000 Ft + Áfa, az Ipsos 135 000 +Áfa áron vállalja a kérdezést.
  • A kutatást csak akkor végeztetjük el, ha összegyűlik a kitűzött összeg. Ha nem gyűlik össze, akkor a befizetett támogatásokat mindenki visszakapja az IndieGogotól.
  • A kampány lezajlását és a kutatások lebonyolítását követően megmaradó pénzt maradéktalanul jótékonysági célokra fogjuk fordítani. Azt, hogy kit támogassunk a megmaradó pénzzel, online szavazással fogjuk eldönteni, melyben minden támogatónak szavazati joga lesz.

Költségek és a gyűjtött pénz felhasználása

  • Kutatás a Mediántól: 95 000 Ft + Áfa = 120 065 Ft
  • Kutatás a Tárkitól: 60 000 Ft + Áfa = 76 200 Ft
  • Kutatás az Ipsostól: 135 000 Ft + Áfa = 171 450 Ft
  • Összesen: 367 715 Ft

Az IndieGogo az összegyűjtött pénzből 4%-ot tart meg magának, a Paypal fizetési szolgáltató, akin keresztül a fizetés történik, további 3%-ot.

1300 euróból tehát 1300*0,93 = 1209 euró marad meg felhasználásra, ami mai középárfolyamon kb. 376 000 Ft, tehát pont elegendő a céljainkra.

Az is megeshet, hogy többet gyűjtünk, mint 1300 euró, de a terv ez esetben is változatlan. A közvélemény-kutatóknak kifizetett összegeken felül megmaradt pénzt az utolsó forintig jótékony célra fogjuk fordítani. 

Hogy kit támogassunk belőle, azt a kampány támogatói fogják megszavazni egy legalább 10 tételes listából, amit én állítok össze.

Kockázatok

A tervnek különösebb kockázata nincs. 

Ha összegyűlik a pénz, akkor a közvélemény-kutatók márciusban elvégzik a kutatást, mi pedig március végén nyilvánosságra hozzuk az eredményeket.

Ha nem gyűlik össze a pénz, akkor mindenki, aki befizetett, visszakapja a támogatását, és gazdagabbak leszünk egy érdekes tapasztalattal.

Kapcsolat

A munkám mellett nem fogok tudni a kampánnyal kapcsolatos telefonokat fogadni. Ha bármilyen kérdésed van, a http://vasarnapi.tumblr.com/ oldalon akár névtelenül is felteheted, és ott fogom megadni rá a választ is.

Ha ez nem szimpatikus, akkor a vasarnapnyitva@gmail.com címre is írhatsz, de itt nem tudom garantálni a gyors választ.

English summary

The Hungarian government decided that all bigger retail units and shopping centers should be closed on Sundays. There was no public consultation, no public opinion polls, and no one really knows if the people agree with this decision. (Most likely not.) 

I'm raising money to order public opinion polls from at least 3 of the main public opinion research companies. The goal is to get independent, representative results about the public support of the new regulations, make them public and let the press  confront the government with the results.

The campaign goal covers the costs of 3 polls from 3 different companies. Funds above the campaign goal will be used to support non-profit public benefit companies which will be selected in a vote by the campaign supporters.

story:
A bit about the artist

Hello, my name is Rhonda Fazio, Environmental Alchemist. I am a graduate of art history and textile design from the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth. I maintain an educational studio and gallery at the Narrows Center in Fall River, Massachusetts, where I teach and facilitate natural dye and historical textile design research and methods. more about the artist


The Campaign

For this campaign I will be doing a series of photo essays and primary source documentation that will form the foundation for my research tour of Color Across America: Southern Rim. This is the first installment to what is going to be an ongoing series of campaigns. Upon their completion, there will be a published, catalogued collection of information and stories about the use of natural dyes and pigments in American history. This also includes people in an historical context as well as in the present. 

(Primary Materials: blue red and yellow color sources)

I love telling stories about the dye sources I use in my studio. People who visit me are so surprised by how far these resources date back into human history. It is important for me as an artist to connect with my materials as well as my people, not just in and around my studio and community but all around America.


For reasons of diversity

This campaign will enable me to reach out in a broader extent - personally and literally to research, educate and instruct on the importance of preserving the history and resources of natural color. There are people, plants and pigments everywhere but yet, they hardly know each other. This is my specialization of task: To bring it all together and make it concise, doable, responsible use of, and simplify enough of the knowledge to sustain the methods for coming generations. All of this will be done without further compromising our environment.  




The long road ahead

This is the beginning of my research tour. I need funds to reach my destinations: particular cities along the east coast (research libraries and historical societies) into the southern rim of America straight on through to the deserts of southern California (field work) and then back again. follow my blog to see where I will be going(Fill 'er up!)

I have a car, places to stay, and I plan to prepare my own food. Most importantly, I love the road. I do my best thinking in the car. I have a wealth of knowledge already in my head and by the time I return, the entire concept of Color Across America will be intensified, solidified, logged on paper and the computer (as I believe in the value of both), and the next trip will be planned for the Summer of 2015 (The Northern Rim). Hawaii and Alaska may take me longer to reach, so I will have to publish those separately when the time comes. 



Perks of being a benefactor

The perks in helping me achieve success with this campaign are the beautiful natural dyed textiles and pigments I make in my studio.  The real bonus is that all of my perks come gift wrapped just in time for the Holidays! Please visit my website to see the examples of the perks.

(Silk body wrap)
All Dyer Maker materials are made from 100% natural fibers and pigments.  Each color is hand-crafted from raw materials and extracted without the use of harmful chemicals. Reflective of ancient cultural methods and hand processes of design, Each piece is unique and may be  wrapped in a number of ways to complement the individuality of the wearer. 


Credentials

  • I have received grants for community projects from local cultural councils where I live. The grant process is long, limited and competitive. While I am always up for the challenge, It is my hope to find a grant that would support a project such as this one, but as of now, I have not. If you know of one give me a shout. contact me
  • Contact the UMASS Dartmouth/College of Visual and Performing Arts. Professors Charlotte Hamlin, Memory Holloway, and Adrian Tio will provide references to my character and ethic.


My Resiliency

  • Since I believe in people and hope that they believe in me, I thought I would try the crowd-funding platform.
  • I decided to break the trip up in increments instead of doing one entire sweep of the nation. It makes it more affordable and reasonable not to mention realistic. 

Challenges

For me, the risk is giving up on your hopes and dreams--and that is never an option for me. I will see this through. 

I raised a son entirely on my own, an unanticipated turn of events that turned out to be a blessing for my family. I went back to school and earned two degrees in the arts: a BFA in Textile Design and a BA in Art History. Not very lucrative fields, but I found my passion and persevered. I raised my son to be sharp-minded and hard-working, and he uses these assets today in college. (He's doing very well, I might add!) I became car-less in a rural town, which of course led to the dissolution of work and job opportunities... No public transportation there made for disaster. I became homeless for the second time in my life and felt the pressure of my past heavily at this point. However, I managed to maintain a beautiful art studio in an amazing music venue. I maintained my studio and it helped me to maintain myself--without it I don't know how I would have survived the hardest year in my life.

And here I am. 

Now, I see challenges as stone barriers that, with much determination, will give way to a crumble that can easily be set aside for a clear path. I am more afraid of the weather patterns changing while I am on the road. Only a tornado could stop my journey. 

Momentarily, of course.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, no worries! Sharing is caring! 

Send me a post on my blog to let me know you are thinking of me and wishing me well on the road.

Everyone gets a nod and a credit in my book upon completion. Good vibes, prayers, salutations, good karma, peace and love, whatever it is - your names get printed on the page.


With love,
Rhonda Fazio


"Dye, Don't Kill." -- Michael J.F. McNelly

the beginning of my research tour. I need funds to reach my destinations: particular cities along the east coast (research libraries and historical societies) into the southern rim of
America straight on through to the deserts of southern California (field work) and then back
again. follow my blog to see where I will be going(Fill 'er up!)
I have a car, places to stay, and I plan to prepare my own
food. Most importantly, I love the road. I do my best thinking in the car. I have a
wealth of knowledge already in my head and by the time I return, the entire
concept of Color Across America will be intensified, solidified, logged on
paper and the computer (as I believe in the value of both), and the next trip will be planned for the Summer of 2015 (The Northern Rim). Hawaii
and Alaska may take me longer to reach, so I will have to publish those
separately when the time comes. 




Perks of being a benefactor
The perks in helping me achieve success with this campaign are the beautiful natural dyed textiles and pigments I make in my studio.  The real bonus is that all of my perks come gift wrapped just in time for the Holidays! Please visit my website to see the examples of the perks.



(Silk body wrap)


All Dyer Maker materials are made from 100% natural fibers and pigments.  Each color is hand-crafted from raw materials and extracted without the use of harmful chemicals. Reflective of ancient cultural methods and hand processes of design, Each piece is unique and may be  wrapped in a number of ways to complement the individuality of the wearer. 



Credentials


I have received grants for community projects from local cultural councils where I live. The grant process is long, limited and competitive. While I am always up for the challenge, It is my hope to find a grant that would support a project such as this one, but as of now, I have not. If you know of one give me a shout. contact me

Contact the UMASS Dartmouth/College of Visual and Performing Arts. Professors Charlotte Hamlin, Memory Holloway, and Adrian Tio will provide references to my character and ethic.



My Resiliency

Since I believe in people and hope that they believe in me, I thought I would try the crowd-funding platform.
I decided to break the trip up in increments instead of doing one entire sweep of the nation. It makes it more affordable and reasonable not to mention realistic. 


  Challenges For me, the risk is giving up on your hopes and dreams--and that is never an option for me. I will see this through. 
I raised a son entirely on my own, an unanticipated turn of events that turned out to be a blessing for my family. I went back to school and earned two degrees in the arts: a BFA in Textile Design and a BA in Art History. Not very lucrative fields, but I found my passion and persevered. I raised my son to be sharp-minded and hard-working, and he uses these assets today in college. (He's doing very well, I might add!) I became car-less in a rural town, which of course led to the dissolution of work and job opportunities... No public transportation there made for disaster. I became homeless for the second time in my life and felt the pressure of my past heavily at this point. However, I managed to maintain a beautiful art studio in an amazing music venue. I maintained my studio and it helped me to maintain myself--without it I don't know how I would have survived the hardest year in my life.
And here I am. 
Now, I see challenges as stone barriers that, with much determination, will give way to a crumble that can easily be set aside for a clear path. I am more afraid of the weather patterns changing while I am on the road. Only a tornado could stop my journey. 
Momentarily, of course.

  Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot contribute, no worries! Sharing is caring! 
Send me a post on my blog to let me know you are thinking of me and wishing me well on the road.
Everyone gets a nod and a credit in my book upon completion. Good vibes, prayers, salutations, good karma, peace and love, whatever it is - your names get printed on the page. 



With love,Rhonda Fazio 



"Dye, Don't Kill." -- Michael J.F. McNelly

story:
Saturday 08/09 
UPDATE!!
There is a new Coloring Page available as a free perk!!  


Summary- This is the Briny Scoop!

Tide Day is a children's book about a stubborn, silly, and bubbly little mermaid who wakes up on a day where there is no school! Hooray!! But Mom wants Pearl to do chores and stay in the jellyfish cove away from the rip tide. Will she listen to her mother and do her jellyfish chores, or will she venture out to find her speediest, funniest, shiniest friends? 

This tale is inspired by the snow days of Minnesota where sometimes it is just too snowy to go out and have fun. If you are lucky, you will get to break free of your chores!

Melissa Marroquin - Illustrator and Writer

Melissa began her career at the Minneapolis College of Art and Design and graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Illustration. While in her final years she studied Children's book and narrative illustration specifically and created dummy books to become comfortable with the process. Tide Day began its development in Fall 2012.

Through telling children's stories there is a balance between words and images and a playful stream of events that splashes through every page. I tell simple stories with lots of color and a touch of mischief.

Making a Splash! - What Your Contribution Achieves

Once the campaign is completed the production of the book will be underway. The contributions received will be used to support the following:

- Acquisition of ISBN number making the book available in stores and online.

- Printing of the first edition of the book which will include 1,000 copies.

The book will be published in November 2014.

The Waves - What This Book Will Do

Encourages the Family 

In a world that is increasingly independent, children have the opportunity to see how the loyalty and love of friends and family can get you through anything!

Promotes Parent and Child interaction

Children and Parents can bond through the lessons of listening and learning from our "oops" moments together.

Creating Awareness

Tide Day is an introduction to the oceans inhabitants and their environment. 

Hidden Treasures - All the Perks

Contributors will receive their copies of the book first along with the perks listed under their donation bracket! These include book donations to organizations of your choice, Your name in the Special Thanks page, and custom artwork from the Author!

Can't donate? Don't twist your fins! Spread the word through sharing on Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr through the tools below. Also enjoy a free coloring page just for taking a look at this campaign! Thank you for your support and get ready, Tide Day is coming soon!

Free Coloring Pages

story:
Do Not Look There, Unless You'd Leave...

Apparently, I'm going to New Grange for Midwinter Solstice.

Each year, 50 people are selected from a lottery of 30-40 thousand entries to witness the brief moment of the year when the chambers illuminate from the light of the midwinter sun.  A friend in Dublin put my name in on a 'whim,' and, well:
"your application form to attend the Winter Solstice at Newgrange was one of those picked out by local school children . There were 30,532 applications altogether..."

And I need your help.

I'll Have Words for You

My pilgrimage journals from last year were what got me my first (unpaid) writing position, which is what then got me my first paid writing position.  I need not tell you that I'll have more stories to write from this. Maybe pretty soon I'll be writing full time?

I also probably need not tell you I don't have the money for this.  Most of my words are spun from the threads of dream and time and not of wealth.

Fortunately, my expenses for this trip won't be high.  The friend who put my name in has a place for me to stay, so the primary expense is travel.

I'll be working some overtime to throw towards this, but I'll need 500 dollars to pay for the airplane and travel within the UK and Ireland.  It's not much, but it's more than I've got at the moment.

I expect to cover the rest of the cost by sales of my upcoming book, Your Face is A Forest.

Which reminds me--want a signed copy when it comes out?   I'll send you one if you donate at least $50!

Only have $10 to give now?  I'll send you a hand-made thank you card. There will be a tree on it, because it's the only thing I know how to draw.

And if you donate $100, I'll make you a candle with the book and tree-card.

Update!!

Thanks to some incredibly awesome people, I reached my goal in just under 5 days!

I've added a short trip to Wales to my itinerary, so any additional donations before the close of the fundraiser will go towards that part of the trip.  More information here.


If You Can't Donate Now


Mind telling other people I'm doing this?  They might be able to help, or at least will think it's pretty cool that a low-class nomadic tea-swilling punk bard gets to have adventures. I'm pretty much overwhelmed with awe myself.

Also, Your Face is a Forest will be released in a few weeks.  It's a collection of writing you've probably seen and some stuff you definitely haven't seen.  Buying a copy of it will help a whole lot.

Thank you!

story:
THANK YOU FOR GIVING!

Thanks to the support of all of you wonderful people, I was able to hit my fundraising goal. I can never thank you enough for your love and encouragement. That being said, if you're looking for a way to still support the project, please feel free to Venmo me @Matty_Noomz. Let's publish this book!

About the Project

"What do you want to be when you grow up?"

This is a question that many people struggle with, even as adults; however, it's one that I have known the answer to since I was ten years old. For as long as I can remember, I've wanted to be a young adult fiction writer. Whether it started when my father first read me Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone, or when I encountered more complicated ideas through The Golden Compass, fantasy has always been central to my identity. This passion turned into two self-published novels, which I released in high school. These books, though near and dear to my heart, were never destined to become bestsellers. However, publishing them did set a milestone: I was officially a writer.

There have always been two quotes that truly speak of writing to me: The first is from Maya Angelou, which reads, "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." The second is from David Foster Wallace's The Pale King, which reads, "How odd I can have all this inside me and to you it's just words." 

In March of 2014, I had a dream in which I was standing outside of a large cathedral. Upon walking into the building, I was met with a desolate room, filled with nothing but a throne in the center. In this chair was a man whom I would come to know as Tam Desmond, the deuteragonist of the novel you are about to read about. We shook hands and when I woke up, I had the plot of an entire book series in my head.

I have not been satisfied since.

Even though it was 3AM, I began writing out the rough outline for The Betwixt and Between Chronicles, a series of what will one day be five books. These novels chronicle the adventures of Henry Williams, a fourteen year old boy who after witnessing the murder of his favorite author, is given an ability known as the Writer's Eye, a magical power that allows him to see the World of the Written, a universe parallel to our own where everything ever written down by humans comes to life. Using this power, Henry is tasked with solving the author's murder, and understanding just why he has been given this gift in the first place.

Why Indiegogo? Why self-publishing?

First, why am I not traditionally publishing this book, i.e. through a publishing house? The disadvantages of traditional publishing are plenty: first, you need to go through the process of getting an agent, and then your agent has to get your book picked up by a publisher. Next, you need to wait around for the publisher to deal with the process of creating the book, and often times authors have very little say in what happens to the final product. Titles are changed, characters are deleted, and authors end up powerless.

Me with my previous two novels:

However, self-publishing isn't all sunshine and rainbows. The disadvantage to it is that all of the business functions that traditional publishers would take care of are now the writer's responsibility: organizing editors and illustrators, marketing the novel, creating the bound product and selling it. These are all barriers to entry that dissuade people from self-publishing their books.

Luckily, these barriers are not ones that will stand in my way. Not only have I self-published two novels and already know the process, but I have professional work experience in the publishing industry, and am working full-time for a Fortune 100 company in a business and marketing-related role. My real barrier to entry is money: all costs associated with this venture will be taken up by me. And unfortunately, there are a lot.

What do you need?

Depending on the sources I utilize, costs will break down like this:

  • $3,000 for editing (this covers both grammar & content)
  • $2,000 for start-up marketing costs
  • $1,500 for the logistics surrounding this Indiegogo campaign
  • $500 for illustration and design
  • $500 to get the actual book bound and printed
  • $500 for start-up business costs (establishing my LLC, my website, etc.)

These costs are what it will take to launch this Indiegogo campaign, the book itself, and some basic business functions. It doesn't even begin to encapsulate how much it costs to maintain my LLC ($300+/year), fund and market my website ($100/year minimum, and that's just barebones),  establishing trademarks and copyrights, and a whole slew of small but important tasks; however, it's a start. I can put this book out there for $8,000, and all I need is a little bit of help. 

How long is this going to take?

The timeline looks like this:

  • August 2019: Indiegogo campaign is completed, and professional editor & illustrator are hired. The editor and illustrator begin working.
  • December 2019: Editing & illustrations are completed. I reach out to influencers in order to get testimonials for the novel. Internal designers are hired and are sent the book for final production phases.
  • February 2020: Testimonials are obtained and incorporated into art for the book. Completed final drafts are sent to Amazon Kindle Direct Publishing, where they are prepped for launch.
  • March 2020: The book is available for pre-order. Final marketing efforts are executed.
  • May 2020: The World Only They Could See is released.

This is truly a journey that has seen me through so many things: high school. College. The start of my first adult job. I'm ready for it to come full circle and be released into the world. So join me on this journey as we venture into Betwixt and Between, together, and explore the World of the Written.

story:
Campagna RDC 2018/2019

Ciao a tutti classicisti. Dato il successo della campagna dell’anno scorso siamo tornati con una nuova edizione dell’unico diario dedicato interamente agli studenti del classico. 
Siamo sempre i soliti 4 ragazzi con lo stesso obiettivo: creare un diario scolastico per alleggerire le ore infinite di greco, latino e compagnia bella. 
Questa campagna di raccolta fondi rappresenta la realizzazione di un nostro sogno e il vedere ripagate tutte le ore che abbiamo dedicato a questo progetto. 
Come l’anno scorso, la parte fondamentale siete voi, perché se riusciremo a pubblicare questo diario sarà solo grazie al vostro contributo.

Come utilizzeremo i soldi raccolti?

Come detto prima, siamo dei normali studenti del classico e di conseguenza non abbiamo la possibilità di stampare diari in larga scala senza sapere il numero preciso di copie. 
Per questo motivo abbiamo deciso di appoggiarci a Indiegogo per far partire il progetto. 
Per potervi fornire un diario di qualità abbiamo bisogno di raggiungere un obiettivo di circa 2500 euro con i quali potremmo stampare i diari e spedirli direttamente a casa vostra.

Cosa riceverete?

Con un ordine riceverete il nostro diario (stavolta col filino segna giorni!), all’apparenza un’agenda come tutte le altre, però pensata appositamente da classicisti per classicisti.
Abbiamo pensato che tutti dovrebbero farsi due risate anche a scuola, magari durante l’ora di greco, e per questo motivo abbiamo concepito l’idea del diario.
Il pacco contenente uno o più diari sarà spedito a casa vostra tramite il corriere Bartolini, che assicura tracciabilità e sicurezza, un notevole miglioramento rispetto all’anno scorso.

Altri modi per aiutare

Oltre a prendere il diario ci sono altri modi con i quali ci potete aiutare: parlandone con gli amici di classe, di scuola e perché no, magari anche con i professori, che forse riusciranno a capire quello che proviamo ogni giorno. In fondo ci troviamo tutti sulla stessa barca, no?
Comunque vada la campagna, vi vogliamo ringraziare per l’affetto che ci fate sentire ogni giorno sulla nostra pagina, di cui voi siete parte integrante.

Grazie mille e vale, classicisti!

story:
Most people would agree that there are no real second chances. Well, we’re here to introduce a Real Second Chance®, a 501c3 that helps ex-felons, homeless, drug addicts and distressed people, become entrepreneurs. The people we help in Orlando Florida, come mainly from two community districts, Pine Hills and Parramore.

The Orange County Republican Party is located in Parramore just across the street from a top supporter of our cause. Joel Hawksley the Executive Director for the local party happened to pop in on our supporter, where my wife and I had a chance to converse with him.

This was a great opportunity to talk to someone about our Real Second Chance Candidates, especially ex-felons, who point out that local politics prevent them from thriving after paying their debt to society. They rightfully point out that politicians use them, and actually need them to be an example to voters on how tough they are on crime and then they try to convince the community that they’re providing for felons’ transition after prison. Many won’t get any assistance after prison and the county works against them with no remorse. The reality is they’re abandoned and stigmatized for the rest of their lives. This leads to survival instincts kicking in and they revert to the only thing they’ve ever known, crime.   

We found out that Hawksley was aware of these problems because his twin brother went to prison in Massachusetts. After his brother was released, he couldn’t get or even hold a job. When he was hired, he’d soon be getting fired, especially when people wanted to know more, or other employees become aware. His brother owns and operates a kennel in Tennessee now.

After speaking with Hawksley, we were convinced that his political acuteness and his bold honesty about the political system would be a phenomenal book. We approached him with the idea and convinced him to write a book and open everyone’s eyes to everything they just aren’t aware of in politics and campaigning. The topic is so vital to us we decided to set forth and raise funds through our charity.   

We believe Hawksley is one of the finest people we know. In this exercise, we found a caring, considerate and dedicated human being to making our target community, Parramore, a better place. He may represent a political party, but he is not a politician. He is a human being using the political system to help make his community a better place to live.

Although a Republican, this book could easily have been written by a member of the Democrat Party. And that is exactly what we need.

We may be wrong, but we don’t think politicians will like this book. Honesty sometimes isn’t the best formula for the way they work. However, honesty is the way Hawksley works, and it has been a pleasure to work with him in helping get this book started and on track. Now we need to complete the writing and get published, and Hawksley will need more funds to do that, we estimate $15,000. We don’t know where this book will go, but we do know it will have an impact on anyone who reads it. We can’t thank Hawksley enough, and hope you enthusiastically support what he has to say.

We need more Political Party members like Hawksley, a true credit to the people who believe in politics as it should be. If both parties were full of his honesty, our country would be so much better off.

Please help if you can.

 

Claude and Donna Smith

Founders, Real Second Chance®, Inc.
story_txt: Most people would agree that there are no real second chances. Well, we’re here to introduce a Real Second Chance®, a 501c3 that helps ex-felons, homeless, drug addicts and distressed people, become entrepreneurs. The people we help in Orlando Florida, come mainly from two community districts, Pine Hills and Parramore.The Orange County Republican Party is located in Parramore just across the street from a top supporter of our cause. Joel Hawksley the Executive Director for the local party happened to pop in on our supporter, where my wife and I had a chance to converse with him.This was a great opportunity to talk to someone about our Real Second Chance Candidates, especially ex-felons, who point out that local politics prevent them from thriving after paying their debt to society. They rightfully point out that politicians use them, and actually need them to be an example to voters on how tough they are on crime and then they try to convince the community that they’re providing for felons’ transition after prison. Many won’t get any assistance after prison and the county works against them with no remorse. The reality is they’re abandoned and stigmatized for the rest of their lives. This leads to survival instincts kicking in and they revert to the only thing they’ve ever known, crime.   We found out that Hawksley was aware of these problems because his twin brother went to prison in Massachusetts. After his brother was released, he couldn’t get or even hold a job. When he was hired, he’d soon be getting fired, especially when people wanted to know more, or other employees become aware. story:
Story of My Book

bathtub in flames. is a collection of poems that examine the repercussions of childhood trauma and the intricacies of human relationships. 

My name is Bailee Noella and I am the author of bathtub in flames. I wrote this book because poetry has always been my coping mechanism. As a kid, I lived in a sometimes chaotic household and experienced sexual abuse. I often tucked myself away to capture moments and emotions that were important to me. Sharing my story has started me on the non-linear path of healing that I never thought would be available to me.  

My hope is that, in reading this collection, you will discover the importance of sharing your story. Ultimately, I want you to see these poems as a tool to help you find your voice.

You will love this book if you feel alone in your journey with mental illness, have a loved one who is struggling and would like to get a glimpse into what life is like for them, or if you simply enjoy poetry.

bathtub in flames. speaks to anyone who believes that mental illness should not be something we are ashamed of.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The cover design of my book (the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!).
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, e-book formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
  • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements section of my book (“With special thanks to...”)
  • Early access to some of the content of my book with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help me select my cover
  • A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book and answer questions
  • And more!

About the Author

I am a freelance copy editor, writer, and fashion stylist. I founded a streetwear brand called cyno apparel in hopes of raising awareness of mental health issues by designing clothes with gentle reminders like “check on your friends.” (You can check it out at www.cynoapparel.com.) My debut poetry collection stems from the same desire to take the stigma out of depression, OCD, anxiety, PTSD, and other mental health issues.

Growing up, I struggled with the effects of abuse and several mental disorders. They severely impacted my social life, my relationships, my performance in school, and my self-esteem. I lived in silence for the majority of my childhood and never fully shared with anyone the suffering that I was going through. When I finally opened up and told my story, I was surprised to find that not only was I not alone, but that healing was possible.

When I’m not writing poetry or coordinating outfits, you can usually find me brushing up on my skincare knowledge or watching a true crime documentary. 

If you'd like to connect, feel free to email me at baileenoella@gmail.com or follow me on Instagram @baileenoella.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up to date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #bathtubinflames and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts!
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of this page.
  • Share news of my book with five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or as a DM on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Bailee Noella
