story:
Story of My Book
 

First-Gen, NextGen is a book that explores the first-generation Latinx experience in the American workplace, focusing on the first five years of a young professional's career.

My name is Victoria Banuelos and I am the author of First-Gen, NextGen. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore what successful Latinx business leaders and entrepreneurs accomplished in the first five years of their careers to accelerate their leadership potential. I also wanted to examine the workplace through the lens of first-gen Latinx individuals and the cultural factors that shape our experiences. Latinx and Hispanic individuals are often grouped into a monolithic cohort when in reality, there are subsets of nationalities, generational influences, and cultural understandings that shape our approach to work. I believe the oversimplification of our identity limits the perceived contributions and value-add that we bring to our workplaces.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will see how Latinx business leaders have navigated the already complex work environment with resilience and integrity. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement I have for integrating diversity, equity, and inclusion in an authentic, proactive way. Ultimately, I see this book as a tool to help first-generation students accelerate their leadership potential in the first five years of their career and a way to helping corporate America understand how first-gen colleagues, employees, and peers perceive the workplace.

You'll get insights into why echandole ganas (working hard) is often not enough for first-gens to reach their career goals, how Latinx young professionals feel they fit into the workplace, and how the effects of these sentiments impact the overall leadership pipeline of corporate America.

You'll learn from:

  • Ingrid Otero-Smart, CEO of Casanova//McCann, about how she turned her first advertising job in Puerto Rico into an opportunity that led her to the top position of one of the most renowned ad agencies in the world.
  • Ryan Renteria, a Goldman Sachs alum who became a partner at a capital management firm at twenty-five years old, retired at 30 and made a career pivot into sports analysis for the Indiana Pacers.
  • Jocelyn Ramirez, author and owner of Todo Verde, a vegan Mexican food enterprise with a diehard social media following and a rapidly growing catering segment.
  • and many others!


​First-Gen, NextGen is a nonfiction book that speaks to first-gen Latinx students, early-career young professionals, and employers who want to enrich corporate culture, create more inclusive spaces, and embrace the business case for a diverse labor force.

You will enjoy this book if you are all about supporting a diverse environment in the workplace and changing the nature of work for the better. For me, hearing the "lessons learned" from first-generation Latinx professionals and entrepreneurs who have successfully created a path in the way they earn their living was an incredible opportunity. Each of them is excited to share their genuine teachings with you.

We want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the themes of authenticity and the true faces of leadership in the workplace.
 

The Book: First-Gen, NextGen

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 How We Got Here: Foreword + Introduction + Chapters 1-3.
We introduce the meaning of Latinx (instead of Latino/a), as defined by various first-generation voices. We will explore how our upbringing and cultural perspectives shape the way we approach work. Then we dive into the echale ganas fallacy and why 'hard work' is often not enough for first-gens to accelerate their leadership potential, especially in the first five years of their career. This section also features a foreword by Frank Carbajal, founder of the Silicon Valley Latino Leadership Summit and consulting firm, Es Tiempo.

Part 2 Principles of Accelerants: Chapters 4-9
Here we dig into specific examples of the accelerant principles and what this mindset looks like through a variety of stories from Latinx business leaders, such as the CEO of Casanova//McCann, the Executive Director of a global non-profit, a Global Head at Microsoft, a Goldman Sachs alum, culinary author, Hollywood actress, and more. We also look at the strategies used by Latinx employees in tech, advertising, finance, healthcare, and historically underrepresented industries. From code-switching at work to building social capital, you'll see how relatable the workplace challenges are for many first-generation folks and how to leverage proven strategies to engage with work successfully.

Part 3 How to Use Your Accelerants: Chapters 10-11
In the final section, we'll reveal how first-generation Latinx students and young professionals can develop their personal accelerants by breaking through mental hurdles and identifying the systemic ones. We'll see how Latinx wellness and therapy professionals have supported their Latinx patients with strategies to balance their authentic identity with corporate America's existing structure. Additionally, we'll take a look at how employers can support, enable, and empower their teams and organizations to create a more inclusive environment - not just for Latinx employees but for their workforce at large.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor works with me to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copy Editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (with "Special Thanks to")
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
     

About the Author
 

Victoria Banuelos is a marketing strategist who enjoys integrating data and design in her management of creative projects. She earned her BA in Communications and International Studies from UC San Diego and MS in Strategic Communication Management from Purdue University. Victoria currently serves on the Young Professionals Advisory Board for the Los Angeles Music and Art School in East Los Angeles, California, and is pursuing a Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in the Workplace certificate from the University of South Florida.

After several years of volunteering with Latinx students and having discussions about their college and workplace concerns, Victoria began to notice a pattern in their challenges, questions, and internal dialogue. Not only did she relate, but she realized that some of the lessons she had learned along her professional career were unique to her first-generation upbringing and not often shared. She began to storyboard First-Gen, NextGen on Post-It notes to keep track of her outreach to Latinx business leaders, and eventually, this became the framework for her book.

When she isn't writing, Victoria enjoys making puns in English and Spanish, much to the dismay of those around her. She's a cheese-lover, proud dog mom of two pups, Google and Samosa, and hopes to dust off her passport soon!

For more information, you can connect with Victoria at vfbanuelos@gmail.com and at @_hellovictoria_ on Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, and Clubhouse.

International Pre-orders

For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • No worries if you can't contribute - I'd still love your support! 
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. You may use the #FirstGenNextGen and tag me (and my publisher), New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
     

Thank you so much for all your love and support!

Victoria Banuelos

story:
Short Summary

Have you ever wondered why our world is speeding faster and faster toward anger, shame and polarization?  Or what’s the solution for church conflicts and increasing family skirmishes? At personal level, have you ever struggled with inferiority, or outburst of anger, where you say or do stupid things, because you are feeling anxious, insecure, attacked or hurt?   

What do you crave?  Is there a hunger for more relational connection?  More success?  More meaning?  We all have had to deal with these hunger pains before.  The question is how?

My name is David Braun, author of Are We All Cannibals?  I wrote this manuscript back in 2017…    and then life got busy, putting a pause on it's release.  Then the pandemic of 2020 hit us all, unveiling a train wreck of fear-fueled political unrest and racial tension.  In August of 2020, a good friend of mine asked me to seriously pursue publishing this book.  Days later my wife echoed the same encouragement.  We feel the time for this message is now.  We are planning on publishing this book on Amazon  in March.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with Kindle Direct Publishing.  I have set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.  Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor and I will work to revise and publish my manuscript on March 12, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, e-book formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The book website for promoting and giving online resources for my book.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book, when I ultimately publish this coming Spring.

I am also offering some exclusive treats for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You can receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • You can receive early access to my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You can have the opportunity to be entered in a draw for a chance to give direct input on the cover of my book.  (please refer to apple on front cover of my book mock-up).  All my children are gleefully proud their faces, in miniature, will be on the front cover…   LOL. * see FAQ for more details
  • You will be invited to join my private online Facebook community called Cannibals No More and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

The Impact

The global insecurity, polarization and anxiety, due to the pandemic, political uncertainty and economic hardship, reveals a visceral need for the light and hope and practical guidance my book offers.  Part of Are We All Cannibals  is  my story and how God met me in a new and fresh way.  Through writing this book, I’ve learned to be transparent as I share my personal weaknesses and insecurities.  For the past 7 years I have been sharing and teaching the truths in this book around the world ( North and South America, Asia and my home country, Canada)        I have been learning to grow in these truths myself, while seeing others touched and set free. 

Some of the Highlights in the Book:

  • Your Basic Motivators…  

God created everyone with the same core needs.  These core needs first revealed in the gospels, directs every decision, behavior, and attitude we have.  My book will explore how we can meet our needs to live to our fullest potential.

  • Orphan Shadow Types…  

There are several basic ways humans react, when trapped in insecurity or fear.  These types of behaviors limit us in our all decisions, our ability for personal growth and our ability to enjoy relationships.  My book will examine these basic survival strategies through scripture.  Through this study you will be able to identify the types hidden in your life.

  • Your Impact Driver Styles… 

Based on what Jesus did at the cross, we already carry a powerful impulse to live differently than a depraved world.  True fulfillment comes by letting our Father show us who we already are in Jesus.  My book will help you unpack your unique impact style.  Stories and examples will explain how simple and powerful it is to live with impact and meaning.

 

Ways For More Impact Beyond the Book

As a certified professional coach, mediator and consultant, with years of experience teaching this material, I've decided to offer 3 different tracks and resource you with tools to see the message of this book carry beyond the pages and into your day to day life.

Track 1:  My Impact Growth Program (3 month)

This 3-month personal development track is based on my book, Are We All Cannibals?  It will include monthly training on topics such as goal setting, communication, conflict, and your Personal Impact Style.  Group coaching and email Q & A will give you an opportunity to realize meaningful transformation. 

Track 2:  My Leadership Impact Growth Program (3 month)

This 3-month journey is based on my book, Are We All Cannibals?  It will include monthly training on topics such as decision-making, team building, conflict, and your Personal Impact Style.  Group coaching and email Q&A will give you an opportunity to realize meaningful change. 

Track 3:  My Relationship Growth Program (3 month) 

This 3-month adventure is based on my book, Are We All Cannibals?  It will include monthly training on topics such as communication, intimacy, conflict, and your Personal Impact Style.  Group coaching and email Q & A will give you an opportunity to realize meaningful ways forward. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Sharing a message that has been transformative to me and others is exciting.  Part of the reason I decided to fund raise on this platform is because there are challenges to overcome.

  • Money:  The cost of this project was around $4000.  The price tag includes the editing process, cover design, layout, formatting and book launch website.  Whatever remainder amount we can raise will go directly toward marketing of this message to as many people as possible.  .
  • Marketing:  I believe the whole world needs this message so I’m really believing we can raise much more than $5000.  Therefore, donations above $4000 will go directly toward advertising.  In fact, we have already recorded several video ads to use on Facebook to spread the word.
  • Pandemic:  Because of a global pandemic, it is much harder to market books.  Opportunities such as book signings and conference speaking, and in person readings are not possible.   However, good news spreads the quickest by simple word of mouth.  As you all know, I am not a well known name...    but that doesn't matter.  I need people like you sharing and inviting others to buy the book on Amazon or check out the book webpage:  www.areweallcannibals.com.  

 

What Makes the Book Special

Are We All Cannibals, brings together a Biblically-based lens for understanding how our core needs, our toxic human reactions and our new identity in Christ affect us, our walk with God and our world. As an executive coach, pastor and consultant, I have looked to find a Bible-based psychometric test (think DiSC, MBTI or Enneagram) to use for my clients and congregants.  I came up empty.  This book lays out the foundations for the first Bible-based Psychometric Test I'm aware of connecting core needs, your walk with God & your impact in the world…      

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/AreWeAllCannibals) with your friends, family and network. Please use #AreWeAllCannibals and tag me as well as my publisher, Amazon, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

story:
Short Summary

The Fall is a coming-of-age narrative that follows the life of a college freshman learning to deal with loss, influence, and identity.

The title represents a fall from grace and the descent before hitting rock bottom. The fall is a period of uncertainty and adversity where it feels as if one “needs directions and manuals for this story mode." 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover value in the experiences that influence your persona, both good and bad. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with self-doubt, mental health, and apprehension, as well as to discover the significance of contentment in your life. 

In this book, you’ll join me in exploring the mindset of a first-generation college student and discovering themes of apprehension, self-doubt, and identity through poems like: 

“The Fall” — This composition reflects on the fear of knowing hardship is knocking on your door, and portrays the mindset of somebody anticipating failure. 

“Writer’s Block” — This composition details the struggle of a self-deprecating mentality when pursuing goals. Self sabotage can only hinder you from seeing your own greatness...

“Pulpit” — This poem details the importance of finding fulfillment in yourself and all of your success. In this composition, the narrator comes to terms that his own contentment is the key to wholeness.

You will love this book if you share a love for rap music, are a college bound student or are currently enrolled, or if you deal with the pressure of an uncertain future. 

Ultimately, I hope this book inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Do I place enough value in every milestone?

Can one rise above the influence in a negative environment?

How can I confront fear in the face of the unknown?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing discontentment, negative influence, and apprehension will change us all for the better. 

About the Author

Marqui Williams is a full-time student at Bowie State University, where he is pursuing a degree in English. He has a deep passion for creative writing. He wrote this book to help others who may have trouble navigating their way through college. He was inspired to write this book based on his own experience as a freshman and a first generation college student. He wants to provide encouragement and insight into the possible dilemmas of a college student. 

Marqui Williams is an aspiring rap artist with a love for Hip Hop. He believes that poetry and music are synonymous. In his free time, he uses his passion for words to develop lyrics that he transforms into songs. 

For more information, you can connect with Marqui Williams at imarquirasheed@gmail.com and at @marquirasheed on Instagram

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.
 
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.  

And much more!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheFall2021 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Marqui Williams

story:
CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN IT'S OVER

AND LILITH'S TREASURE IT'S READY TO BE PRINTED.

THANKS TO EVERYONE!

LILITH'S TREASURE WILL BE DELIVERED ON FEB/MARCH 2018.

YOU CAN ORDER YOUR TREASURE NOW.

OUR SHOP ONLINE IT'S ALREADY AVAILABLE!

WWW.LILITHS-TREASURE.COM

Lilith’s Treasure – A Story Of Sexuality, Pleasure And The Menstrual Cycle

This story was written to help little girls understand

from a very early age the great treasures they are.

It was written for young women to help them discover the butterflies they carry within.

It was written for women to help them reconcile with their sexuality

while falling in love with the great wonder that is the menstrual cycle.

And it was written for all boys and men, so that they may know and learn

how to appreciate female sexuality with love.

Welcome to this exciting journey!

**************************************

Carla Trepat Casanovas, author of Lilith’s Treasure

 

About the book

Lilith’s Treasure was written, illustrated and self-published in 2012 by Carla Trepat Casanovas. The Spanish original has since then been translated into eight languages and has been hugely successful all over Europe, allowing Lilith to travel in order to create a new generation of women who embody self-love, trust and a healed, joyfully confident sexuality

Now Lilith is ready to bring her message of the beauty and power of the female body, our menstrual cycle and our sexuality to girls, women and families all over the world. This is your chance to be among the very first supporters helping us publish this globally unique book in English!

Lilith’s Treasure is a beautiful tale aimed at children of all ages that explores topics such as the sexual organs of girls, menarche, the stages of the menstrual cycle and pleasure through metaphors. The use of metaphors helps share the information in accordance with the age and needs of the reader. By gifting our children with this kind of knowledge we increase their confidence and self-esteem.

Lilith’s Treasure helps us tackle these subjects with our children while at the same time we inspire them to make all of these topics a conscious part of their lives, ask questions and communicate openly about them.

Lilith's Treasure comes with a guide for teachers and parents written by Anna Salvia Ribera, psychologist specialising in sexual health.

By making it possible for us to publish Lilith’s Treasure in English, you will help spread genuine sex education and allow for an ever greater number of parents, teachers and children to create a world full of women walking their paths in confidence and love. 

If you think Lilith’s Treasure is valuable, please contribute to the campaign, and spread the word!

What We Need & What You Get

With this crowdfunding we are hoping to print the 1st 1.000 copies of Lilith’s Treasure – English edition, to be sold and distributed to women, families, schools and communities around the world.

We will also allocate a portion of the money to print the "extra" perk, The Treasure Map.


Another part will be used to finance the video of this campaign, to pay the work of the translators and proofreaders of the story and their work on the website and the crowdfunding campaign.

In addition, a percentage of the donations will be used to pay for indiegogo's services and bank fees.

*If you encounter any difficulty making a payment by credit card, please do not hesitate to contact Carla and we will find a solution: liliths.treasure@gmail.com.

Project Schedule 

The crowdfunding campaign will finish on December 3rd, 2017.

In December Carla will put the last finishing touches on the book. She is planning to send the book to print in January 2018.

We will send the perks in March 2018.

Other Ways You Can Help

Lilith's strongest desire is for the beauty, magic and power of menstruation, sexuality and femininity to be known. If you can't contribute to the campaign yourself but you think the project is worth supporting, please share the campaign's link as much as you can; talk about Lilith to your friends and family and keep in touch with us through Facebook and Instagram (CarlaTrepat) and visit Lilith’s website!

Share the video, share the campaign and a new generation of women will grow up full of love, power and self-confidence.

Lilith needs you!

A WOMEN’S REVOLUTION IS IN YOUR HANDS!

 

********************************************************************************

The Creator

Hi! I'm Carla Trepat Casanovas. Thanks for stopping by my campaign!

I’m the creator of Lilith’s Treasure – A Story Of Sexuality, Pleasure And The Menstrual Cycle. Before creating this tale, I had no experience in drawing or writing - I had no idea what I was getting into. But the thing is, I felt the need to convey to young women the magic of their female sexuality, the wisdom of their menstrual cycle and the incredible beauty of their female body.

I would have loved to have grown up with this knowledge and this beautiful sense of understanding of myself. That’s why I created Lilith’s Treasure.

I was writing and painting for a year, and in October 2012 I launched a successful crowdfunding campaign to publish Lilith’s Treasure in Spanish. Since then it has been translated into 8 languages, I have become a mother myself and I work on spreading Lilith’s message around the world through my blog and on Facebook. Read some of my articles here!

*This is me in 2012 for an interview with El PERIODICO, a Spanish newspaper.

Campaign Perks 

# LILITH'S TREASURE PERK:

T

#THE TREASURE MAP EXTRA PERK:

THE TREASURE MAP unveils the secrets of female sexuality!

Women have a second heart, our womb, our uterus, the Flower of Life. It guides our steps, sways our dreams and gives shelter to our children and our ideas. Just like the sea with its waves, it elevates us, makes us come down, guides us. Learn to recognize these waves of love, allow them to carry you and channel them towards your well-being and your goals. It's simple - all you need to do is recognize your cycles and tap their energies in the direction that suits you.

Four cards, one for each phase of the menstrual cycle, + one Menstrual Calendar will be your itinerary to accompany you on this journey.

(The Treasure Map will retail for 15 USD.)

A great treasure waits to be revealed inside you. What are you waiting for?

The Spanish original has since then been translated into eight languages and has been hugely successful all over Europe, allowing Lilith to travel in order to create a new generation of women who embody self-love, trust and a healed, joyfully confident sexualityNow Lilith is ready to bring her message of the beauty and power of the female body, our menstrual cycle and our sexuality to girls, women and families all over the world. This is your chance to be among the very first supporters helping us publish this globally unique book in English!Lilith’s Treasure is a beautiful tale aimed at children of all ages that explores topics such as the sexual organs of girls, menarche, the stages of the menstrual cycle and pleasure through metaphors. The use of metaphors helps share the information in accordance with the age and needs of the reader. By gifting our children with this kind of knowledge we increase their confidence and self-esteem.Lilith’s Treasure helps us tackle these subjects with our children while at the same time we inspire them to make all of these topics a conscious part of their lives, ask questions and communicate openly about them.Lilith's Treasure comes with a guide for teachers and parents written by Anna Salvia Ribera, psychologist specialising in sexual health.By making it possible for us to publish Lilith’s Treasure in English, you will help spread genuine sex education and allow for an ever greater number of parents, teachers and children to create a world full of women walking their paths in confidence and love. If you think Lilith’s Treasure is valuable, please contribute to the campaign, and spread the word!What We Need & What You GetWith this crowdfunding we are hoping to print the 1st 1.000 copies of Lilith’s Treasure – English edition, to be sold and distributed to women, families, schools and communities around the world.We will also allocate a portion of the money to print the "extra" perk, The Treasure Map.Another part will be used to finance the video of this campaign, to pay the work of the translators and proofreaders of the story and their work on the website and the crowdfunding campaign.In addition, a percentage of the donations will be used to pay for indiegogo's services and bank fees.*If you encounter any difficulty making a payment by credit card, please do not hesitate to contact Carla and we will find a solution: liliths.treasure@gmail.com.Project Schedule The crowdfunding campaign will finish on December 3rd, 2017.In December Carla will put the last finishing touches on the book. She is planning to send the book to print in January 2018.We will send the perks in March 2018.Other Ways You Can HelpLilith's strongest desire is for the beauty, magic and power of menstruation, sexuality and femininity to be known. If you can't contribute to the campaign yourself but you think the project is worth supporting, please share the campaign's link as much as you can; talk about Lilith to your friends and family and keep in touch with us through Facebook and Instagram (CarlaTrepat) and visit Lilith’s website!Share the video, share the campaign and a new generation of women will grow up full of love, power and self-confidence.Lilith needs you!A WOMEN’S REVOLUTION IS IN YOUR HANDS! ********************************************************************************The CreatorHi! I'm Carla Trepat Casanovas. Thanks for stopping by my campaign!I’m the creator of Lilith’s Treasure – A Story Of Sexuality, Pleasure And The Menstrual Cycle. Before creating this tale, I had no experience in drawing or writing - I had no idea what I was getting into. But the thing is, I felt the need to convey to young women the magic of their female sexuality, the wisdom of their menstrual cycle and the incredible beauty of their female body.I would have loved to have grown up with this knowledge and this beautiful sense of understanding of myself. That’s why I created Lilith’s Treasure.I was writing and painting for a year, and in October 2012 I launched a successful crowdfunding campaign to publish Lilith’s Treasure in Spanish. Since then it has been translated into 8 languages, I have become a mother myself and I work on spreading Lilith’s message around the world through my blog and on Facebook. Read some of my articles here!*This is me in 2012 for an interview with El PERIODICO, a Spanish newspaper.Campaign Perks # LILITH'S TREASURE PERK:T#THE TREASURE MAP EXTRA PERK:THE TREASURE MAP unveils the secrets of female sexuality!Women have a second heart, our womb, our uterus, the Flower of Life. It guides our steps, sways our dreams and gives shelter to our children and our ideas. Just like the sea with its waves, it elevates us, makes us come down, guides us. Learn to recognize these waves of love, allow them to carry you and channel them towards your well-being and your goals. It's simple - all you need to do is recognize your cycles and tap their energies in the direction that suits you.Four cards, one for each phase of the menstrual cycle, + one Menstrual Calendar will be your itinerary to accompany you on this journey.(The Treasure Map will retail for 15 USD.)A great treasure waits to be revealed inside you. What are you waiting for?

story:
Aloha from Maui!  I’m Mike Neal — photographer, woodworker, artist, family man, believer. I am in awe of God’s grace and creativity seen in nature. My passion for Him is often expressed through capturing the beauty that is all around us.     

I will be participating in service/mission trip to Nicaragua to work with Seek the Lamb (http://www.seekthelamb.org/) a ministry that has provided education to over 1200 Miskito Indian children in nine communities along the RioCocoRiver in Nicaragua  and Honduras.

Our team will be installing broadcast radio equipment and helping finish the construction of the building. This facility will allow broadcasting to remote locations, where children cannot get to school. I will be capturing images of natural wonders along the way. These images will be posted in a blog and available to contributors to the trip.

$3500 will provide transportation from Maui to Nicaragua including food and lodging for 3 weeks. 

Perks:

1) Participation in changing the lives of impoverished children.

2) Receive first views of images taken and updates from the trip.

3) Receive a copy of "The Heavens Declare His Glory" in print.

4) Receive images (from Maui or from the trip) in print.

5) Receive a 2013 calendar with scenic Maui or big wave surf at Jaws, Maui.

6) Receive a 2013 calendar of Images from Nicaragua.

7) Digital picture frame in Koa with scenic views of Maui.

8) Full Day Photo Tour on Maui, includes 2 nights at 

    Olinda Bonsai Cottages - Maui - https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/311288

9) My undying gratitude :)

10)  BONUS 8x12 print, to ALL contributors, when we reach the goal amount.

Any part of the first $3500 will go to the expenses of the trip.

The Impact: changed and improved lives of children and families on the Rio Coco River.

God has been working in my life though the creative process of making images that convey the wonder I find in nature. This is a process that has brought me from taking life for granted, to caring for our world and  the people God has placed in it.        

Seek the Lamb has been serving in Nicaragua since 1986 -  http://www.seekthelamb.org/

I have been a full time photographer and woodworker since 2005, and have produced fine art prints and a photo calendar each year. Samples of my work can be found at http://nealstudios.net/. 

Please pray for us!

          1) For the needs of the children and families we will be meeting.

          2) That we love God and others, before ourselves.

          3) For the staff of Seek the Lamb.

          4) For traveling mercies, health and strength.

Please share:

Twitter (@nealstudios)

FaceBook (mikerneal)  

Instagram (nealstudios)

 

E-Mail and whatever other way you like.

Indiegogo share tools can help!

Short Summary

Alec is a child who has Autism and his mother and friends have been working Day & Night trying to get a Autism Service Dog for Alec to enhance and benefit his everyday living.

After seeing this post by his mother on FaceBook and how short they are falling from the goal I thought of IndieGoGo...

"I feel as though the benefit was affected by hurricane Sandy. Attendance is not what we had hoped and we raised about $2,000. This still leaves us about $6,500 from our goal, although I won't know about any donations made directly to 4 Paws for Ability until Thursday or so. I'd be lying if I said that all the planning and hard work of my volunteers truly paid off, however -- there is nothing we could have done differently. We had great food, a great bake sale, amazing raffles, and great people involved. Thanks to all who supported Alec and our family. I have friends out there who have become just like family and it's much needed! ♥What We Need & What You Get"

See more at the FaceBook site, https://www.facebook.com/events/272341206203408/ 

The Impact

The impact you can have on Alec can be tremendous in his everyday living and quality of live. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Forward this campaign to all of your friends.
  • Make any amount of donation that you can afford.

Christina stated in her post she was about $6500.00 short of her goal. I have put this campaign goal at $15,000.00 for Dog Food, Veterinary Pet Insurance and other things that may be needed for the Furry Angel when he is finally realized for Alec.

Please, will you make a donation today?

story:
The Message


Delight in Disorder: Ministry, Madness, Mission is the story of my battle with bipolar disorder—how my faith has at times fueled emotional distortion yet ultimately has fostered healing.

In 1995, I was a young, ambitious pastor serving a small village church.  One Sunday, I delivered a sermon on human illness and divine healing in which I shared these words:

When we become ill, it is important to listen to our bodies and pray that God help us make necessary changes. Our ailments may be blessings in disguise. We may be expecting too much from ourselves, or avoiding things we need to face. As we listen to our bodies, talk and reflect with others, and pray together, we can gain spiritual insight which will help us live healthier, more productive, more abundant lives.

The next day, I was in the seclusion room of a psychiatric hospital.  I was diagnosed with bipolar disorder.  I was told I would never work as a pastor again, that my marriage would likely end, and that I would spend the rest of my life in and out of psychiatric hospitals.

By the grace of God and with much help from others, I served another dozen years of fruitful ministry, have been married “for better and for worse” for twenty three years and have progressed in treatment to enjoy what my psychiatrist calls “maintenance remission.” 

Having served in ministry with madness, I now have a mission, and I could use your help.


The Mission

Many people with mental illness are angry at God, at believers and at faith communities.  People within churches struggle to understand mental illness in light of Biblical teaching.  I have lived in both worlds and wrestle daily with my dual identity as a Christian who has a serious mental illness.

My mission is to bridge the distance between faith and mental illness-- fostering faith among those with disorders and diagnoses and promoting compassion within the faith community.  Sharing my spiritual memoir is the first step towards this mission.

Mission Endorsement:

Delight in Disorder is a resource we have long needed. We all need to hear from people who have struggled with mental illness and have found, indeed, that nothing can separate us from God’s great and redeeming love. This book is honest about the experience of living with bipolar disorder, and it’s full of compassion toward the many people whose own moods betray them so treacherously. It’s also full of hope—not the cheap kind we use to varnish over the truth about ourselves and about this life we live. But the only kind of hope that can stand when everything else falls: hope in Christ and his grace.
 
~Amy Simpson -- Author, Troubled Minds: Mental Illness and the Church’s Mission


The Man Behind the Memoir 

                                

My name is Tony Roberts.  I am a balding middle-aged Midwesterner with an unquiet mind who has a way with words. 

I have been divinely blessed with a devoted wife and four beautiful children.  Yet, I continually struggle to be a supportive husband and stable father and am currently separated from my family.

After serving nearly two decades as a pastor, I now write, read, listen to John Prine, and eat peanut M&Ms.  You can find my work at awaywithwordsblog.com and reach me through my website awaywithwordsforyou.com.

My dream is to share the divine delight I’ve found in the midst of my human disorder.  My nightmare is talking in front of a group of strangers wearing only a pair of Birkenstocks (but I can save that for therapy).


Money Matters

Our goal is to reach as many folks as we can who wrestle with disorder by producing a book that will be a delight to put on your shelves or in your e-reader.  To do this successfully, we have set a goal of raising $2,000.  This covers:

  • Professional Editing Services (Leanne Sype of Pen to Paper Communications).
  • Graphic Design and Media Consultation (Nicole Miller of Miller Media Solutions)
  • Rights to publish original poetry (Matthew Pullar of The Consolations of Writing)
  • Two ISBN #s (one for the e-book and one for the print edition)
  • Professional Formatting (Christina Berry of Ashberry Lane)
  • 100 advance copies.

If we exceed our financial goal, the funds will be used to spread the message to more people through:

  • The purchase of additional advance copies.
  • Professional marketing consultation for the book’s promotion.
  • A speaking tour that will communicate the mission and support the book.


Join the Movement

  • Donate financially to this indiegogo campaign and help us reach our goal.
  • Spread the word about our mission and include the link to the campaign through your favorite social media platforms (Twitter, Facebook, Google+, blog, etc.).
  • Pray for the ongoing Delight in Disorder mission and all the partners involved.


Many thanks

Giving is a way of expressing value.  “Where your treasure is, there your heart is also.”  We thank you that in a world filled with competing concerns, your heart would be in the mission of bringing delight to disorder.

Special thanks to The Function for use of their song "Hosea" from "The Vessels EP".


From my Memoir

Over the past several years now, I’ve often wondered how I could be in a personal relationship with the LORD and still have tried to take my life.  Attempting suicide, while often prompted by disturbed minds (like mine), is an ultimate act of ingratitude for the life God has given us.  Yet, after my attempt, I felt drawn closer to God more than ever.  Perhaps out of desperation.  Perhaps out of desire.

Some talk about the “assurance of salvation” – once saved, always saved.  Others point to Bible passages that show it is possible to “fall from grace.” I’ve thought hard and prayed deep about the subject and have yet to come to any conclusions.  I can only say that, in my life, while there have been plenty of times I’ve felt like giving up on God, God has never given up on me. 

I don’t always feel secure in my salvation, but I do know the power of Christ’s saving love first-hand in my life. 

God has brought me back from the dead.  In Christ, I have hope for abundant life with him now and forever.

The Psalmists show us that those who look to the LORD for salvation experience how intimately God is connected to us. God sees our troubles even before they are troubles. God knows our grief and grieves with us. When we feel the most helpless, we can turn to the LORD and be swept up in God’s warm embrace.

When I came to my senses in the hospital bed after my suicide attempt, I had to face the reality that I had tried to abandon God.  At the same time, I discovered God had not abandoned me.  I say this not to brag about my standing with God – indeed I have no standing with God. I say this instead with tremendous gratitude and wonder that God would take notice of me—even me.

story:
Short Summary

I am Jules Mitchell, a young Antiguan sailor.  I currently race in Laser Radial class and love to represent my country.  I have recently qualified to race for Antigua in the ISAF Youth Worlds in Malaysia this December. This is a really big deal because it is the first time Antigua has participated in this regatta, and it is a really big step for me  sailing in Internationals, and a step closer to ultimately fulfilling my dream of going to the Olympics.

This is a very expensive undertaking and I cannot get there without the kind help and support of people who want to contribute to this cause.

By contributing to this campaign,you will be helping me to represent Antigua taking part in a World Class ISAF event.   ISAF, the International Sailing Federation, is the world governing body for the sport of sailing, officially recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC). 

I need all the support I can get to help me make it to this important world class regatta.

A breakdown of the funds needed

It is a very expensive for me and my coach to get from Antigua to Malaysia for this regatta.  The cost is approximately US$8000.00.

2 return tickets, Antigua, London, Kuala Lumpur, Langkawi -  US$6306,17

Coach registration - US$1071.00

Accommodation - US$400.00

Transportation - US$500.00

Just in case I do not reach my goal, fundraising activities will be ongoing here in Antigua.  If I reach my goal, any funds raised above this amount will go towards the Antigua Laser team going to Laser Youth Worlds next year.


The Impact

Competing in the ISAF World Championship 2015, one of the most important international regattas, will be part of my portfolio of events and also I will have represented Antigua in this very important World Class event. This is the first time Antigua has participated in this event.  I intend to do my very best to live up to the honour of representing Antigua and I am working very hard to prepare for it.

I have been racing for the last 3 years  and have been representing Antigua with the following  results:-

2013 &2014 Orange Bowl International Youth Regatta – Laser Radial – 82nd, 58th

2013 Caribbean Dinghy Championship -  Laser Radial – 2nd

2013 BVI Dingy Championship – Laser Radial – 4th

2014 Byte North American Championship – Byte – 15th

2014 Caribbean Laser Championship – Laser Radial – 3rd

2014 &2015 Antigua Laser Open – Laser Radial – 3rd, 10th

2015 Schoelcher’s International Sailing Week – Laser Radial – 3rd

2015 National Sailing Academy Annual Youth Regatta – Laser Radial – 1st

2015 Cork Week Sail Canada Youth Regatta – Laser Radial – 9th

2015 Laser Youth Worlds – Laser Radial – 9th Bronze Fleet

2015 Dominica Disaster Relief Regatta – Laser Full Rig – 1st

I hope this serves to show that I am serious about my sport andI am improving steadily.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute, but you can share this compaign and get the word out about me and what I need to accomplish my goal.  Use the Indiegogo share tools and share on all of your social media and your email contacts.  As people you share with to share it on as well and let's make some noise about this campaign.  You may know people that I don't know who may be interested in supporting this campaign.

Thanks in advance for your support, it is much appreciated.

By contributing to this campaign,you will be helping me to represent Antigua taking part in a World Class ISAF event.   ISAF, the International Sailing Federation, is the world governing body for the sport of sailing, officially recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC). 
I need all the support I can get to help me make it to this important world class regatta.   A breakdown of the funds needed It is a very expensive for me and my coach to get from Antigua to Malaysia for this regatta.  The cost is approximately US$8000.00.
2 return tickets, Antigua, London, Kuala Lumpur, Langkawi -  US$6306,17
Coach registration - US$1071.00
Accommodation - US$400.00
Transportation - US$500.00
Just in case I do not reach my goal, fundraising activities will be ongoing here in Antigua.  If I reach my goal, any funds raised above this amount will go towards the Antigua Laser team going to Laser Youth Worlds next year.

    The Impact Competing in the ISAF World Championship 2015, one of the most important international regattas, will be part of my portfolio of events and also I will have represented Antigua in this very important World Class event. This is the first time Antigua has participated in this event.  I intend to do my very best to live up to the honour of representing Antigua and I am working very hard to prepare for it.
I have been racing for the last 3 years  and have been representing Antigua with the following  results:-

4th

15th

– 3rd

– 3rd, 10th

Laser Radial – 3rd

Laser Radial – 9th
2015 Laser Youth Worlds – Laser Radial – 9th
Bronze Fleet
2015 Dominica Disaster Relief Regatta – Laser
Full Rig – 1st
I hope this serves to show that I am serious about my sport andI am improving steadily.   
Other Ways You Can Help

 Not everyone can contribute, but you can share this compaign and get the word out about me and what I need to accomplish my goal.  Use the Indiegogo share tools and share on all of your social media and your email contacts.  As people you share with to share it on as well and let's make some noise about this campaign.  You may know people that I don't know who may be interested in supporting this campaign.
Thanks in advance for your support, it is much appreciated.

story:
My Story

Bood, nabood... There was, there was not…

This is the phrase that begins all Afghani fairy tales. Much like its Western equivalent—Once upon a time— Bood nabood invites the reader or listener into a world of possibility, one removed from the everyday, yet closely bound to it. 


My mother's family in Kabul, 1975


Some of my most cherished memories of my early childhood in Afghanistan involve the gathering of family, young and old, around a storyteller. Whether the storyteller was my mother, and her audience my sisters and I, or whether she was a beloved aunt telling long and serpentine tales to dozens of her nieces and nephews, neighbors, and friends, the stories drew us all in and captivated us. Before we settled in, there was a bustle as teapots were filled, and nuts and dried fruits, pastries and cheeses were laid out on a long, low table. Everyone gathered around this table, found their place on a cushion, next to a favorite cousin, or on a parent’s lap, and settled in. Tea was poured for all, sweets passed around, gossip liberated, and appetites satiated. And then there was silence and all eyes and ears drawn by the storyteller’s voice at one end of the table.

Bood, nabood…


My mother, my sisters, and me, Salang Pass, 1977


I left Afghanistan a year after the Soviet invasion of the country, on the day of my seventh birthday. Now 35 years later, I have the opportunity to return to the country of my birth. And what draws me back is that same voice—the storyteller’s voice. The fairy tales of my childhood were not all innocent. They told of magic and adventure, of love and conquest, but they also told of loss and heartache, of violence and death. After decades of war, the country has countless tales to tell.


My Project

My objectives while in Afghanistan are three-fold:

-Interview family in order to gather as much of our history, recent and old, as I can. In a culture where everything is passed down orally (I don’t have a birth certificate, there are no physical records of our family’s history in Afghanistan or of their migrations across Central Asia), my only source is the direct interview. 

-Gather and record traditional Afghani fairy tales told by those whose love for and memory of them is intact.

-Photograph family, the land, and its people.

My objectives on my return:

-Transcribe and translate interviews and fairy tales.

-Incorporate what I’ve gathered into my ongoing projects, which fictionally combine family history and legends with fairy tales and the fantastical. 


My father's sister and her grandchildren on their farm


For the past five years or so, I have been collecting stories of my family’s personal history. I have spent countless hours interviewing my parents, and aunts and uncles living in the West. What I collect are often only pieces of story, only what those who left the country remember or dare remember. I’ve been collecting these bits in order to create longer and cohesive narratives. I’ve wanted to return to Afghanistan for many years now, and wanted very much to return with both of my parents, to visit their respective birthplaces, in Kabul and in the northern countryside, and to have them as guides into the culture and into their memories. My dear mother passed away one year ago this month. The cancer that took her life also put a hold on my work from the time of her diagnosis three years ago. But now, my father, my two younger sisters, and I want to return to Afghanistan to commemorate her passing and to remember her with her family who still reside in Afghanistan. 


My father and his friend, Tomb of Ahmad Shah Baba, 1963


With the Taliban trying to regroup under new leadership, and Islamic State gaining a foothold in parts of the country, it seems that the window for travel to the country may soon close again. And yet, the people of Afghanistan, among them my large and extended family, continue with their daily lives, with work, school, weddings and birthdays, outings and holidays. Life goes on for them, continues to unfold and flower. It is this life that I want to see and document. 


My mother and her mother-in-law, 1969


Your Support

Your contributions will fund the following:

-Flight to, and transportation in, Afghanistan

-Living and accommodation expenses to cover three weeks in Afghanistan

-Vaccines and travel medical & emergency insurance

-Any funds raised above my goal amount will help purchase writing time!

If you can’t make a financial contribution, please help by getting the word out through social media. Your kind support will be deeply appreciated and will fund a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

story:
Short Summary

Hello!

I am a student at the University of Michigan working tirelessly to get a mechanical engineering degree as well as publish this book. After pouring a lot of my savings into getting the book self-published, I have reached my financial limit. I need to raise at least $5000 in order for this book to be sold in stores. I have already paid over $6,000 in self-publishing costs that paid for the ISBN, copy editing, book cover design, and basic advertisement. With your help, I can successfully get this book the attention that it needs! For every $1 donated, I will add 10% of each donation to a scholarship fund for the high school students in the Metro Detroit area.

The Scholar's Key is now available on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Scholars-Key-Unlock-Your-...

Soft-Cover ISBN: 978-1-5035-3080-5

Hard-Cover ISBN: 978-1-5035-3079-9

E-book ISBN: 978-1-5035-3081-2

About the Author:

Donovan graduated from high school in the top 1% of his class with a GPA above a 4.0. Throughout his high school journey, he was a leader within several different organizations, including the National Honor Society, Student Congress, and the Scholars Plus Program. Donovan is a recipient of the Gates Millennium Scholarship, the Buick Achiever Scholarship, the KFC Colonel’s Scholar Scholarship, among other scholarships. The amount earned in scholarships totaled to over $250,000 and has completely paid for Donovan’s education at the University of Michigan as he studies mechanical engineering. By achieving these scholarships, Donovan has been given the opportunity to appear on several news stations, newspaper articles, and radio shows along with being flown to Texas to see the Final Four and California to attend the UNCF Evening of the Stars. Donovan has always been passionate in helping others and hopes to motivate the youth to achieve their dreams. Donovan strongly believes that no matter where or what you've come from, the key to success is within your grasp, and is waiting to unlock a universe of opportunities.

About the Book:

The Scholar's Key is a teen-to-teen advice book aimed at motivating students to apply for scholarships. It was written shortly after the height of Donovan’s senior year of high school when he received several award letters from national scholarships such as the Gates Millennium Scholarship and the Buick Achiever Scholarship. In this book, Donovan shares how molding your future begins with self-reflection, and motivates you to act on your goals. The Scholar's Key isn't just limited to scholarship tips. This book includes a variety of elements such as poetry, personal stories, college advice for freshmen, and several stories from other fellow scholarship recipients from the class of 2011. On the road to achieving your dreams, The Scholar’s Key encourages you to be the first person to tell yourself to stand up to the challenge, focus on what you dream of doing, and have fun throughout your pursuit of happiness.  


What We Need & What You Get

I need $5,000 in order to pay off Xlibris for online advertising which allows my book to be advertised on 2 million websites as well as pay for services that would allow the book to be sold in physical bookstores. This would allow for more visibility of the book and increase the success of the book. If this book is extremely successful, I may be able to start a scholarship fund! 

If you donate $13, you get a signed soft cover copy of The Scholar's Key. 

If you donate $20, you get a signed soft cover copy of the The Scholar's Key as well as an e-book.

If you donate $50, you will get a soft cover, an ebook and a hard cover copy of the Scholar's Key. Both copies will be signed! 

If you donate $100 or more, At this level, you are practically the reason why the book gets sold in stores! I will sign a copy of both a soft cover and a hard cover book. Each copy will have a seperate, personal message written to the donor! 

If the goal is not met, proceeds will cover the costs of online advertisement. 

If the goal is exceeded, I will start a local scholarship fund with the extra money for gifted students in residencies near my hometown, Southfield, MI. 


The Impact

This campaign is important to me because this book has the potential to impact many young lives and motivate more students to go to college. With your contributions, we can change the educational outlook on the future for young adults!

Risks & Challenges

The risks of not having the book be well-received by students is a great risk that I fear. Fortunately, I have mentored many young adults get through their first year of college as well as done motivational speaking at my past high school and middle school. I have been able to grab the young adults' attention, and we have a lot of fun along the way! 

It has also been difficult to overcome the fear of being rejected and having consistent support. I have tried working with a few self-publishers and editors, but did not get a response back or ongoing, fluid communication. I have worked with Xlibris to resolve this problem and their work is amazing! The book will be published very soon because of consistency and good communication.

  • Other Ways You Can Help

If you could like and share my Facebook page, Youtube account, and Twitter account.

https://www.facebook.com/thescholarskey

https://www.youtube.com/user/ScholarsKeyNec

https://twitter.com/ScholarsKey

story:
Mise à jour du 6 juin: on a réussi ! Grâce à vous, on a atteint —et dépassé— le 2e palier, 7500$! 

Grâce au service InDemand d'Indiegogo, vos amis peuvent continuer de donner à la campagne, mais faites vite: cet été, nous prendrons les commandes pour les cadeaux et les candidatures pour le comité éditorial. En attendant, vous pouvez continuer à nous suggérer des sujets: le démarrage est pour cet automne ! Et suivez les activités de Science-Presse par notre site ou notre infolettre pour être à jour sur ce que nous préparons. Merci !


Chaque semaine, des énormités remplissent votre fil Facebook. Et vous connaissez des gens prêts à croire à ces informations sans même les vérifier.  

  • Des ananas pour guérir le cancer
  • L'insecticide qui tue des fœtus
  • Une météorite causera bientôt la fin du monde 
Certaines de ces nouvelles sont simplement amusantes, mais d'autres peuvent avoir un impact négatif sur la santé des gens, sur des décisions politiques ou encore sur la culture scientifique de la population en général. 
Même des médias sérieux tombent parfois dans le piège. Résultat, il est difficile de départager le vrai du faux, surtout quand on n'est pas soi-même outillé pour le faire. 

Vous voulez lutter contre cette désinformation ? Embauchez un journaliste scientifique ! 

Un journaliste scientifique, pourquoi ? 

Chacun de ces dérapages aurait pu être évité grâce à un journaliste scientifique. Parce que les journalistes scientifiques savent :

  •  repérer les informations scientifiques solides ;
  •  remettre en contexte ;
  •  trouver des sources fiables.

Seulement voilà, le journalisme scientifique n'a jamais été une priorité dans les médias et à l'heure où ces derniers vivent une crise, il est encore plus fragile que jamais. 

Aidez-nous à renverser la tendance! Faisons du journalisme scientifique une priorité dans les salles de presse! Primordial, au moment où notre société fait de plus en plus face à des enjeux scientifiques... et où les fausses nouvelles deviennent virales sur Internet. 

Une rubrique de vérification des faits, pourquoi ?



Ces dernières années, plusieurs médias sur trois continents ont pris les choses en main en créant des rubriques de vérification des faits (fact-checking) : des Décodeurs du journal Le Monde jusqu'à Politifact aux États-Unis. Leur succès démontre l'appétit du public pour des textes qui remettent les pendules à l'heure et fournissent des outils contre la désinformation. Ces médias se sont attaqués avec brio aux déclarations politiques douteuses et aux rumeurs virales. 

Jusqu'ici toutefois, aucun ne s'était attaqué aux fausses nouvelles en science — et en français ! Le Détecteur de rumeurs comblera cette lacune. 

Et à l'Agence Science-Presse — un média à but non lucratif — nous sommes bien placés pour le faire : depuis 37 ans, l'Agence décode l'actualité plutôt que de simplement la rapporter. 

Mais pour offrir à nos lecteurs une rubrique de vérification des faits digne de ce nom, il faudra un effort soutenu et de longue haleine (les Décodeurs y consacrent 10 personnes !). De plus, en démarrant cette rubrique, nous ne voulons pas seulement réagir aux actualités douteuses : nous créerons des outils qui vous serviront à vous faire vous-mêmes critiques lorsque vous serez à votre tour confrontés à une nouvelle trop belle pour être vraie. Ces textes et outils pourront aussi être partagés, y compris par d'autres médias. 

Besoin de plus d'infos sur ce qu'est une rubrique de vérification de faits? Notre texte ici. 

À quoi servira votre contribution ?

En soutenant Le Détecteur de rumeurs, vous financez le journalisme scientifique : un journalisme qui prend le temps de vérifier, réfléchir, approfondir, analyser. 



Nos textes comporteront deux volets: une version "courte" pour ceux qui ont besoin d'une réponse rapide, facile à diffuser par les réseaux sociaux, et une version plus "substantielle", incluant un retour sur la nouvelle originale, l'explication, les faits connus et inconnus, des chiffres et des références, des trucs et astuces pour qui serait confronté à des nouvelles similaires, ainsi qu'une description de la démarche de vérification suivie par le journaliste pour en arriver à son verdict — vrai, faux, ou entre les deux. 

Votre contribution sera une première étape pour lancer cette rubrique et démontrer sa pertinence auprès des bailleurs de fonds. La somme recueillie servira exclusivement à la production de contenu (textes journalistiques et éventuellement infographies, vidéos et guide des bonnes pratiques) et sera versée en totalité à notre équipe de journalistes.

Nos objectifs


Créons ensemble une nouvelle habitude : au lieu de partager une nouvelle sur un ananas qui guérit le cancer, demandez à un journaliste  scientifique de la vérifier! 

Un effort participatif

Donnez, mais surtout participez avec nous ! Nous serons à l'écoute de vos suggestions de nouvelles à vérifier. Impliquez-vous : nous créerons lors de la prochaine assemblée annuelle de l'Agence Science-Presse, en juin, un comité de rédaction du Détecteur de rumeurs où tous les donateurs seront invités à élire un représentant qui se fera porteur de leurs idées. 

Vous êtes maintenant convaincus? Contribuez à notre campagne en cliquant sur le montant de votre choix dans la colonne de droite et obtenez une récompense !

D'autres façons d'aider

Partagez cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux. Parlez-en à vos amis. 

Devenez un ambassadeur du journalisme scientifique en collectant un plus gros montant auprès de vos proches. 

Identifiez des nouvelles qui auraient eu grandement besoin des services du Détecteur de rumeurs.

Jusqu'ici toutefois, aucun ne s'était attaqué aux fausses nouvelles en science — et en français ! Le Détecteur de rumeurs comblera cette lacune. 
Et à l'Agence Science-Presse — un média à but non lucratif — nous sommes bien placés pour le faire : depuis 37 ans, l'Agence décode l'actualité plutôt que de simplement la rapporter. 
Mais pour offrir à nos lecteurs une rubrique de vérification des faits digne de ce nom, il faudra un effort soutenu et de longue haleine (les Décodeurs y consacrent 10 personnes !). De plus, en démarrant cette rubrique, nous ne voulons pas seulement réagir aux actualités douteuses : nous créerons des outils qui vous serviront à vous faire vous-mêmes critiques lorsque vous serez à votre tour confrontés à une nouvelle trop belle pour être vraie. Ces textes et outils pourront aussi être partagés, y compris par d'autres médias. 
Besoin de plus d'infos sur ce qu'est une rubrique de vérification de faits? Notre texte ici. 
À quoi servira votre contribution ?
En soutenant Le Détecteur de rumeurs, vous financez le journalisme scientifique : un journalisme qui prend le temps de vérifier, réfléchir, approfondir, analyser. 

Nos textes comporteront deux volets: une version "courte" pour ceux qui ont besoin d'une réponse rapide, facile à diffuser par les réseaux sociaux, et une version plus "substantielle", incluant un retour sur la nouvelle originale, l'explication, les faits connus et inconnus, des chiffres et des références, des trucs et astuces pour qui serait confronté à des nouvelles similaires, ainsi qu'une description de la démarche de vérification suivie par le journaliste pour en arriver à son verdict — vrai, faux, ou entre les deux. 
Votre contribution sera une première étape pour lancer cette rubrique et démontrer sa pertinence auprès des bailleurs de fonds. La somme recueillie servira exclusivement à la production de contenu (textes journalistiques et éventuellement infographies, vidéos et guide des bonnes pratiques) et sera versée en totalité à notre équipe de journalistes.
Nos objectifs



Créons ensemble une nouvelle habitude : au lieu de partager une nouvelle sur un ananas qui guérit le cancer, demandez à un journaliste  scientifique de la vérifier! 


Un effort participatif

Donnez, mais surtout participez avec nous ! Nous serons à l'écoute de vos suggestions de nouvelles à vérifier. Impliquez-vous : nous créerons lors de la prochaine assemblée annuelle de l'Agence Science-Presse, en juin, un comité de rédaction du Détecteur de rumeurs où tous les donateurs seront invités à élire un représentant qui se fera porteur de leurs idées. 
Vous êtes maintenant convaincus? Contribuez à notre campagne en cliquant sur le montant de votre choix dans la colonne de droite et obtenez une récompense !
D'autres façons d'aider

Partagez
cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux. Parlez-en à vos amis. 
Devenez un ambassadeur du journalisme scientifique en collectant un plus gros montant auprès de vos proches. 
Identifiez des
nouvelles qui auraient eu grandement besoin des services du Détecteur
de rumeurs.

story:
About My Book

Playing From The Rough is about how a single mother, raised in Oakland, California single handedly takes on the golf industry and starts a movement to get more Black women on the golf course.

My name is Tiffany Mack Fitzgerald and I am the author of Playing From The Rough. I wrote this book because I wanted Black women and girls to see themselves succeeding in unlikely spaces. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how much power you have when you stop waiting to be invited into spaces you want to be in and create a space for yourself, like I did when I created the Black Girls Golf organization. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for golf and how I use my knowledge of golf to empower Black women through community building and sisterhood. Ultimately, I want readers to see this book as a tool to help them shed the stereotypes you’ve heard about golf being a White man’s sport and learn how you too can use golf as a tool to create opportunities, overcome obstacles, and build confidence.

In this book, you'll learn about the power of community, sisterhood, the rewards associated with adding golf to your lifestyle, and how learning to golf can help you navigate new territory and male dominated spaces.
You'll hear stories such as...

  • My first time on the golf course and how I used it to build a relationship with my male colleagues
  • Being “The Black Girl in Marketing”
  • The “aha” moment I had about how the challenges I faced during my childhood, and how they helped me overcome the obstacles I faced building my business
  • Playing From The Rough is a nonfiction book that speaks to Black women and young professionals who want to learn about golf or how to leverage it to show up in White, male dominated spaces.

About The Author

Tiffany Fitzgerald is a skilled entrepreneur who bootstrapped her way to becoming an industry influencer. She’s on a mission to get more African American women and girls on the golf course and working in the golf industry. Having spent more than 20 years in Corporate America, 10 of those years in Government Affairs and PR, Tiffany understood the role golf played in building successful, professional relationships. She also recognized the absence of African American women on the golf course.

In 2013 she founded Black Girls Golf, an organization that provides access to affordable golf instruction, golf information and community for women who are interested in learning, practicing, and playing golf. Tiffany has grown Black Girls Golf to a community of more than 4,000 members in almost all 50 states and 9 countries, the largest golf community in the United States for African American women and girls. She’s writing this book to help Black women understand the impact of their presence on a golf course and to encourage them to add golf to their lifestyle.

Tiffany is a native of Oakland, CA; an alumna of Grambling State University; the mother of three children; and currently resides in Atlanta, GA.

For more information, you can connect with Tiffany at info@blackgirlsgolf.net and Facebook, Instagram: @blackgirlsgolf, LinkedIn
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in May, 2022.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in Spring 2022

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

The Impact

I've been work for years to advocate for more diversity in the golf industry. Your support of this work through my book, Playing From The Rough will :

  • Amplify my mission to changing the face of golf
  • Expose more Black women and girls to the opportunities available through golf
  • Support creating a more diverse pipeline of diverse candidates and future leaders in the golf industry

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #playingfromtherough and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instagram -@blackgirlsgolf/ @newdegreepress
Facebook  - Black Girls Golf,  @NewDegreePress
Twitter -@blackgirlsgolf / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tiffany Mack Fitzgerald

story:
Help us publish the A Streetcar Named Toronto commemorative photo book by Blurb!

You are going to love this... it's 36 gorgeous pages of their highest quality, layflat design. Double page spreads lie completely flat... no bulge at all. Featuring a dozen fantastic photos* and memories from our official behind-the-scenes photographer, Chet Tilokani, as well as nine beauties from some of our biggest fans.

We are doing an extremely limited run of this book, 200-300 max. Be one of the lucky few with a copy. We have priced the book at $48 which will enable us to compensate all our photographers with free copies. The book will be available for pick up at a yet to be determined location in Toronto in early September. No shipping unfortunately. If you are not in Toronto, it would be best to have someone you know pick it up and ship it for you.

If you'd like to buy more than one copy, please select the number you'd like to buy from the Perks list. That way it can all be done in one transaction. And if you buy more than one copy, they will be signed by our wonderful exterior artist, Jacquie Comrie, and hand delivered to you! And of course, thanks for supporting. This about brings this project to a wrap. On to the next one!

*Indiegogo heavily compresses the sample images you see above. The sharpness of the printed images is outstanding
