story:
What It's All About

My name is Robert Kroll. I teach English at a few schools in Michigan and also at an undisclosed prison (no I won't tell you where). I am also a writer and I want to better offer it to the public.

For the past few years I have been working on a variety of short stories and projects revolving around superheroes. I'm no pretender to this style, as I have been a fan of comics my entire life. My first released short story “Christmas Ashcan” stars my character Kirk Loebs and has received many five star reviews on Amazon. I have plans to release one short story per month for the foreseeable future featuring Loebs and other characters. There will be no delays in between the stories, since there are always two or three ready to go as the next one is released.

Additionally, I am working on a play called Deflection: A Superhero Drama. It is a courtroom drama starring the previously mentioned Kirk Loebs. Deflection is a solid play that has already gotten many great reviews from theatrical producers I've shown it to. The play is gaining some traction and I am working toward producing it this summer. Should that not work out, I will release the play as part of the monthly range I am working on. Because I am so proud of the story, I would like to get a name artist to do the play's poster/cover.

I also released a short academic book, Study Guide to the Lives of Harry Lime, in 2017. The Lives of Harry Lime is a relatively little-known radio series starring Orson Welles as his character from The Third Man. My book is the first in-depth look into the radio series. The book is an early companion piece to my in progress book about Orson Welles' commercials. 

For book on a niche topic, Study Guide has sold close to 100 copies. My short story, “Christmas Ashcan” has been downloaded nearly 200 times and continues to be read in full on Amazon's Kindle lending services well past the holiday season. 

Finally, my next short story, "Lake Drift," will be out by the end of January 2019.

These sales all come from a modest amount of promotion on my Facebook page and other sources. This isn't because I'm not interested in promoting my work! My work as a college instructor comes first, so that job is my priority. I am happy with my progress, but advertising online can cost a lot, and I don't make enough to constantly keep my name out there for people to recognize. I am happy to see the sales figures from my modest promotion, but I know the potential to go bigger is there.

I'd like to see what happens if I can fully concentrate on promoting and selling my work. Considering my topics of interest, I believe the best place to promote my work would be at the 30th annual Motor City Comic Con coming in May 2019.

The Motor City Comic Con grows bigger each and every year. Since it is the 30th annual edition of the convention, there are sure to be more people there than ever, and this seems like the best place to launch the next stage of my writing career.

Unfortunately, at the moment, I don't have the funds to immediately secure a table. I'm only a part-time instructor, and my funds are currently tied up with other living expenses. The guest list for the con is already shaping up to be big, and I think it goes without saying that tables will be in high demand. I earn enough money that I could get a table eventually, but I highly doubt I could raise enough on my own before space is gone.

This is where you come in.

Funds raised through this campaign will go toward reserving a table for me at Motor City Comic Con this year, along with stock for the table, promotional items, and a cover/poster for my play.

What We Need and What You Get

Contributions to the campaign will go to the following:

  • A table reservation at Motor City Comic Con where I can sell some great stories 
  • Stock at my table (Physical copies of Study Guide to the Lives of Harry Lime, physical samples of digital short stories, copies of a decoupage superhero story I am working on, and potentially copies Deflection, should production fall through)
  • A professionally illustrated cover/poster for Deflection: A Superhero Drama
  • Indiegogo's commission
  • Perks

Perks include the shorts and books I have written, special thanks in future stories/books, and  if there is enough interest, even a few autographed comics from my personal collection!

Should I fall short of the campaign goal, at very least the funds will go toward getting me a table at the show or bringing in promotional items to show to the right people.

Impact

  • My works reach a wider audience than I normally can reach
  • I have the chance to pass along my stories to other writers attending the convention
  • Earn extra money to produce better illustrations, photos, or more stories more often than once a month
  • Professionally illustrated and/or photographed covers give credibility and visibility to my stories
  • I keep to my deadlines and promises, so there will be a short story once per month

My works are already proven successes. “Christmas Ashcan” was downloaded nearly 200 times within the first five days of its release in December 2108. The Harry Lime book is also a success. I have sold nearly 100 copies of the book since July 2017, an impressive number for a radio series that only aired for a year in the early 1950's.  Both titles have sold in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and Vietnam. I'm no Geoff Johns or John Grisham, but I'm working on it.

Risks and Challenges

Of course, I'm a relatively unknown commodity. I don't have the name recognition that other artists using this site may have. At the moment I only have one book and one short story available to the public.

However, I believe that this seeming lack of recognition is easy to overcome.

My two releases through Amazon both have five star ratings and have strong sales in spite of the lack of promotion. As mentioned, the Harry Lime book is as niche as it gets, but I'm closing in on 100 copies sold since its release in July 2017. “Christmas Ashcan” was downloaded nearly 200 times within five days of its release. If these modest numbers are any indicator, I will successfully be able to sell my works at comic con.

Of course, should I fall short of my goal, I will still use funds to get a table at comic con. Your contributions will help ensure that.

Should table space be unavailable by the time I get my funds together, I will use the contributions to still promote my works at comic con through promotional items and pieces that I can leave at tables or with writers and artists that I respect.

You can check out my Amazon reviews, plus an interview I did for the Harry Lime book at the following pages:

"Christmas Ashcan" https://www.amazon.com/Christmas-Ashcan-Jacob-L...

Study Guide to the Lives of Harry Lime: https://www.amazon.com/Study-Guide-Lives-Harry-...

Interview at Wellesnet: http://www.wellesnet.com/study-guide-lives-harr...

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this! Facebook! Twitter! MySpace? Tell your friends!
Use Indiegogo's sharing tools!

 

Thank you!

story:
My name is Sara B. Lane and I have wanted to be an author since I was a child.  I used to write even before I could read writing everything out using very creative spelling.  I have spent the last two years writing and editing my debut novel "The Phoenix" and am finally ready to publish this project.  I need help with a professional edit since this is my debut novel and I want everything to be perfect.  

 On wings of crimson she flies through the skies, leaving a trail of fire in her wake.  She is the Phoenix, the leader of the Immortal people.  If a fatal wound should ever strike her she would rise from the ashes anew.  Elliya leads her people with the power of her divine birthright.  The Council of Elders are tasked with guiding the Phoenix to protect her people, but a corrupting force stirs among them and they find themselves hungry for her power.  They sought out a way to steal her power for themselves.  When Elliya is caught with her forbidden lover, the Council turns her people against her and sentences her to a true death.  Aided by an unlikely ally, Elliya finds herself stripped of the flame of the Phoenix, but alive.  Now in the Mortal realm Elliya is given a second chance at life and a chance to reclaim what is rightfully hers.

The Phoenix is a completed manuscript at 83,000 words.  It is a Young Adult fantasy novel that is marketed toward young adults, ages 13 and older The narrative is character driven, focusing on Elliya, her friends, and allies, as they journey through the mortal realm working to reclaim her rightful place as the Phoenix and find her way back to the Immortal realm.  This book explores the themes of revenge, redemption, and the definition of love, both familial and romantic.

story:
About Me And 'Left Behind' Project

My name is Carmine Flamminio and I'm a photo-reporter. Being always interested in immigration, I'd never thought of telling it from this angle, of the children left behind.

 


'Left Behind' is a long-term photo reportage within the Republic of Moldova. The first victims of migration are children. In Eastern Europe half of those who emigrate are women who, in most cases, leave their children at home, entrusting them, at best, to grandparents, or to elderly neighbors, or at worst, and too often, just abandoning them to fend for themselves.


The situation in Moldova makes me question what the real difference is between the developed and undeveloped worlds. Moldova is located only two hours by plane from the heart of Europe and yet it seems to be light years away.


Why Moldova

I chose the Republic of Moldova because, other than it being one of the poorest nations in Europe, it has a shocking level of emigration, some illegally and without visas, so returning home is at best arduous. But if young Moldovans want any kind of future at all for their children they have to go abroad to work. Moldova is the poorest, the most destitute country in the European continent. Ever since the end of the Soviet Union, It's seen a truly immense exodus of young people. Desolate villages wait for their loved ones to return, they've left the countryside in the hands of children and the elderly. Many children live with their grandparents, but others live completely alone.

 


The average monthly pay of a teacher in Moldova is about $150. In Italy, a good bricklayer will earn that sum in two days' work. A caregiver will send home over $1,000 a month. Sadly faced with such inequality, many choose to give up what we might consider a normal family life to give hope for a better life to their children. However, in the meantime, Moldova and its abandoned children seem to be caught in an inescapably downward spiral.


In economic terms, migrant remittance, or sending money home, helps to strengthen the financial inflow of a developing country, but it also increases the number of social orphans, children who might count themselves lucky to see their parents but once a year.


The plight of these children is difficult to imagine. Many will never overcome the psychological trauma caused by separation from their parents. Numerous cases of suicide do nothing but highlight how serious the situation is.


According to the Information and Documentation Center on Child Rights in Moldova, the number of children without parental care is growing steadily. In 2006, there were 94,000 children who had at least one emigrant parent, while in 2009, the number had reached 135,000.


WHY I NEED YOUR SUPPORT

'Left Behind' intends to document and give voice to the suffering of these children. By long trips across different regions of Moldova, I will continue my photographic work to tell of the daily lives of both the children left behind and the parents who have emigrated abroad, mainly to Italy. I intend to follow these children in the future during their adolescence. But I have also met many young people who have already reached that age without their parents. They are a separate chapter; yet part of the same story, as are the elderly who often live in unimaginable conditions alone in villages.

 


The project has only just started and may never end. But my plans now involve collecting other testimonies in different regions of Moldova such as the separatist Trans-Dniester which unilaterally declared independence from Moldova in 1990. 


That said I have been publishing each single trip in my blog (leftbehindmoldova.wordpress.com) and on my personal website (www.flamminio.it) and when the project is complete, I will publish a book and produce web documentaries to publicize their adversity.


My IndieGOGO proposal is to cover approximately one-half of my project budget. These are some expenditures (but not limited to)


  • Travel 
  • Accomodation
  • Interpreter 
  • Website 
  • Car Rental

Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit my website (www.flamminio.it) and support me promoting this project by Indiegogo sharing tools!

 


If you want to know more about my project, read the interview on BBC here or read the article on Popoli Magazine here

story:
Bringing The Electric Jesus to the World

I'm excited to share that my new book The Electric Jesus: The Healing Journey of a Contemporary Gnostic has just come out.  Since I’m working with a small, but very cool independent publisher, the Evolver Editions imprint with North Atlantic Books, there’s unfortunately no budget for a book tour.  This memoir has been six years in the making and I’m reaching out to all of you to help me get the word out through a multi-city book tour early next year.


The book tells how after experiencing a devastating loss as a countercultural media activist during the 2004 election, I unwittingly embarked on a mystical journey marked by underground ayahuasca ceremonies, kundalini awakenings, prankster spirit guides, extraterrestrial encounters at the Burning Man festival, and miraculous energy healings that reshaped my skeptical worldview.  The book explores the mystical roots of Christianity, uncovers the secrets of alchemical symbols found in cultures across the globe, and offers visionary insight on how we can heal our ailing planet.

Healing Christian Wounds

One thing I’m most passionate about is sharing how early Christianity was much more mystical, diverse, and different than today’s dogmatic institutional structures that have been restricting, and often, I believe, wounding us.  The Electric Jesus shows how early Christianity utilized a radical initiation process derived from the Mediterranean Mystery Schools to harness energy in order to achieve gnosis, direct knowledge or experience of the divine. The book is a healing work, to help those hurt by current Christian paradigms see that there’s a much juicier, soul-inspiring tradition available to them if you look past the messed up history and resulting authoritarian doctrine.  After hearing this information at events, people will often  run up to me excitedly, saying things like, “I always knew my pastor wasn’t telling me the whole story!”


Visionary Ways to Heal Our Planet

I’d also like to help spread some of the memes and messages of an incredible consciousness culture that’s been working hard to shift the way our planet is headed, which is covered heavily in the book.  As one of the co-founders of the transformational web magazine Reality Sandwich and social network for conscious collaboration, Evolver.net, I've had some amazing front row seats in watching people turn on to new ways of thinking and being.  I also took a big and difficult risk in the last manuscript draft, finally “coming out of the galactic closet” to mention the extraterrestrial encounters I’ve experienced as part of my spiritual awakening process.  I hope this book will help open some folks up to the vast possibilities of what lies out there in our universe.


What Your Contributions Go For:

As the community director of the Evolver Social Movement, I coordinate 40+ regional Evolver “Spore” groups in the US and abroad who work to transform their local communities in positive, sustainable ways.  I see our culture as energetically being a house divided and this is a way to bring people together to share their gifts, passions and resources for the greater good.  Many Spores have hosted readings in the past for authors like Daniel Pinchbeck, Graham Hancock, Chris Kilham, and Charles Eisenstein.  The book tour will give me a chance to visit their communities, share stories and information, and connect with them firsthand about our growing “network of light.”  I will also have couches to crash on to keep down the cost of the tour.  


I’m hoping to do at least an East and West Coast tour in coordination with these regional groups, and if we raise enough funds, I’d love to hit places in Canada and the middle of America (especially the Bible Belt!).  Since I’m a car-less New Yorker, your contributions will go directly to pay for the  busses, trains, and airfare to move around (no meals, lodging, or lattes -- I'll take care of that).  If we raise $1,500, I can hit the East and West Coast, with $3,000 I can hit places like Boulder, Denver, SLC, the Southwest, and the South.  With $4,000, I figure I can visit all the Spores in the Continental US and Canada, and maybe some cities where we could jumpstart new Spores to activate local transformations.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the message of the book, please share this campaign with your friends and evolutionary allies on Facebook, Twitter, and other places.  Also, I welcome those who read the book to write reviews on Powell's onliine books, Amazon, etc, and share it with your friends.  


Praise for The Electric Jesus

“A modern Odyssey of awakening, Jonathan Talat Phillips's journey into Gnosticism deeply resonates with the eccentric moment. The Electric Jesus, a spiritual autobiography, reveals a life lived in the light of transformation, searching for the mystic core of a planetary civilization.” —Alex Grey, co-founder of the Chapel of Sacred Mirrors, author of The Mission of Art

 

"A fresh, vigorous, and often startling account of a man's introduction to higher planes of reality. If you've ever wondered what the new consciousness movement is about, read this book and find out." —Richard Smoley, author of Inner Christianity and The Dice Game of Shiva: How Consciousness Creates the Universe

 

“Entertaining, celebratory, burning, reflective, and electric—but definitely not for the faint of heart or hard of head. With tales of sex, drugs, elves and Jesus, this memoir romps through the hinterlands of body and soul.” —Sharon Gannon, co-founder of Jivamukti Yoga and co-author of The Art of Yoga.

story:
• Does the Law of Attraction really work? 
  • What on earth is Pranic healing? 
  • Where can I find a yoga class in Abu Dhabi? 
  • Will moving my furniture around really make me richer? 
  • Does anyone teach reflexology in Dubai? 
  • Why do my chakras need cleaning? Do you need some kind of special spiritual soap for that?

AWAKENINGS Middle East magazine will be a guide to holistic and healthy living in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and it’s aimed at people from all religions, cultures, and walks of life, who are searching for new ways of looking at our place in the universe and who believe there’s more to it than the 9 to 6 daily grind and mortgages. It will be the first-of-its-kind for this region… it will also be available globally via subscription, either print or digital formats.

Having lived in Dubai, UAE, for six years, I know there’s an army of people living here who are exploring a more holistic and spiritual approach to life – regardless of their religion or ethnicity. This army is getting bigger by the day. More holistic centres and alternative and complementary health clinics are popping up, more yoga and meditation classes are being offered, more and more people are into everything from acupuncture to angel therapy, Ayurveda, crystal therapy, Feng Shui, NLP, meditation, massage therapy, Pranic healing, reflexology, Reiki, tai chi and so much more.

I want AWAKENINGS to help support and grow this UAE mind, body and spirit community. So the magazine and website and Facebook page is about giving people in this region a focal point and forum for everything to do with holistic living. Whether someone is looking for a local yoga teacher, an organic coffee supplier or a vegan restaurant, they’ll find listings of all the local practitioners, healing and well-being centres, holistic clinics and so on. It’ll give great exposure for people offering alternative health services and be a convenient reference for people searching for these services.

In every issue I plan to features the latest concepts from the world’s thought leaders on spirituality, alternative health and well-being, as well as local interviews, real life stories, local information and listings on everything from finding a hypnotherapist in Abu Dhabi to buying organic produce online in Dubai.


What I Need & What You Get

To get the first issue of AWAKENINGS Middle East magazine out into the hands of the good folk of the UAE -- as well as the rest of the world, as this will be available globally -- I need about $6000. This will pay to get it designed by a freelancer and printed - about 5000 copies for the first issue. As well as for printing a media kit - which will be used to convince advertisers to pick up the mantle of paying for future issues; the domain name and web hosting, website building software (I've built a basic website, see www.awakeningsme.com), trade licenses...

What will I give you if you pledge? See the 'perks' bit for specifics but basically, up for grabs is free subscription to the mag; donations to your favourite charity, copies of my book 'Spokes, Blokes and Blarney'; hour-long spiritual healing sessions with me in person or via Skype if you live overseas; editing help with any written work you need a hand with; the opportunity for you or your business to be featured in the magazine (if relevant subject); a free ad in the magazine; an entry into a draw for a spa voucher (UAE only)... and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to help financially via one of the pledge packages or donation of any amount - no worries at all, believe me, I totally understand! But could you...

Tell your friends. Tell everybody, get word out. (The Indiegogo share tools are good for that... just saying...)

Let me know of any UAE business or healer or organisation who should be listed in my mag

Subscribe to the mag! Go to www.awakeningsme.com and if you're one of the first 1000 people to subscribe, I'll send you the first four issues for free (UAE residents only, if you're from somewhere else in the world, I'll still send you the first four issues but I'll email the PDF to you)

Subscribe to the mag! Go to www.awakeningsme.com and if you're one of the first 1000 people to subscribe, I'll send you the first four issues for free (UAE residents only, if you're from somewhere else in the world, I'll still send you the first four issues but I'll email the PDF to you)

story:
Our Story


My name is Becka Sutton and I've been writing fiction since I was eight years old - I'm nearly forty now. 


For just over two years I've been part of the weblit community posting a piece of serial fantasy fiction called "The Dragon Wars Saga" on my website Firebird Fiction. In that time I've never missed an update - not even when I had the flu in early 2011. If you want to know more about the project check out its landing page or you can see reader reviews on its page on the Web Fiction Guide. However after that amount of slip free time the archive is getting quite daunting for new readers and reading on a backlit screen has never been the easiest.


There comes a time in the life of a weblit when, like its better known cousins the webcomics, it needs to grow beyond its website home and become a book.


So I've decided that the time has come to make the first arc available in both ebook and paper versions.


Impact

  • It will give new readers an opportunity to read the story (or the first arc anyway) without the difficulties of reading on a computer screen. 
  • It will give established readers the opportunity to own a copy of the story they've been reading all this time.
  • And last but not least I won't have to hock the family silver to make a decent book for you. This is a good thing as I don't have any.


What We Need & What You Get

I've already paid for a copy edit to be done on the first arc (and I'll be posting the revised version to the website over the course of this campaign) and for the cover you can see in the video.


That leaves formatting and printing costs.

I'm going Print on Demand for the paperback since this is a shoestring budget project but I'll still need to cover test prints, a distribution package to get it on Amazon and others, and then there's the British Library's copy. I've done some pricing up and $500 should cover this easily if I don't go for anything fancy on the layout front. Any extra I get will go towards preparing Arc 2 for its book release in September.


What you get:

Gratitude, perks and a book you (hopefully) enjoy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please signal boost the campaign on twitter, facebook, your blog or anywhere else you think people might be interested.

story:
My Story

My name is Bill Coon. I am a two-time heart transplant recipient, first-time kidney transplant recipient, and the author of a book entitled, SWIM: A Memoir of Survival. My book has done well throughout the course of the past year, selling well overseas and throughout the United States. Unfortunately, I'm a college student, so any proceeds have gone towards my education. 


My book has managed to touch lives around the globe and inspire them to keep pushing and to never give up their fight to survive a life threatening illness. I managed to achieve this ability to connect with my readers, because when I was sick, I poured every thought and emotion onto my pages. I censored nothing, with the hopes that my (sometimes dark) thoughts were thoughts that everyone fighting an illness would experience. Fortunately, I was right. As stated, the book has found its way to South Africa, Canada, Australia, England, Ireland, and dozen other countries. Granted, the book has been successful, however, I spent so much money putting it together that I do not have the funds to really promote the book.


I am approaching the last spring break of my life (I'm a super senior at the moment at an art school in Chicago), and I want nothing more than to be able to meet my readers and give motivational speeches for 10 days between Chicago and LA. I posted a YouTube video just hours ago, and I already have readers from Indiana and Oklahoma requesting that I speak to their support groups. (A link to the video has been included).


I am in a financial and time pinch. I need to promote my tour/figure out my route/pitch media (TV, radio, newspapers, and college media outlets) all by March 23. Oh, and I need to find the money, too.


If you could please help me, you will be making my dream come true!


**Upon helping me with a $10 donation, you will receive a promotional code for 50% off a signed copy of my book through my website. It's a win-win!**


Synopsis:

In 1989, Bill Coon was born with a congenital heart defect. That year, he became the fourth infant heart transplant in the Midwest, and the eighth in the nation. At the age of twenty, his transplanted heart began to fail. Due to a lifetime of taking medication, his kidneys failed as well.

After he was diagnosed with end-stage heart and kidney failure, Bill unknowingly began writing his first book on Sunday, July 5, 2009. On this day, Bill began journaling his thoughts. These thoughts would later become a story of a young man's physical, mental, and spiritual journey into the depths of his mind, as he fought the clock, awaiting a double transplant and a second chance at life.

Oddly enough, when it was all over, Bill looked back on it all, smiled and said, "Knowing what I know now... I would do it all over again."

Are you ready to SWIM?

The Impact

My road trip will not only help me promote my book, but it will allow me to aid others in understanding that they are not alone with both their post-illness issues and/or with their current illnesses.


What I Need...

How the money will be spent:


$700 ---- A VERY large portion of my budget will be put towards gasoline. I utilized AAA's "Fuel Cost Calculator" (http://fuelcostcalculator.aaa.com/), which utilizes each state's average gas price to give you a rough estimate on your trip. From Chicago to LA, I am looking to spend just under $700 in fuel alone.


$400 ---- My current car is not only a beater, it is a gas guzzler. Not only will I never make it past Kansas City with my car, but it will cost a left arm just to make it 1/4 of the way. I need to rent something sleek like a Honda Civic or a Dodge Charger from a nearby Enterprise. I shopped around, and I can get a rental car for 10 days at this price.


$400 ---- I need food. I also need shelter. Though I have MANY friends throughout the country, I may have to crash a night or two at a hotel/motel somewhere. Consequently, I suspect that I will eat about $200 worth of food and use about $200 in hotel fees.


... What You Get.


As stated, I will e-mail you a promotional code for 50% off my book, SWIM: A Memoir of Survival. This applies to anybody who donates $10-1,000.

Also, if you pledge over $100, I will make a video announcing you as one of my sponsors and share it on my social networking pages.

If you pledge $200, I will give you two mentions in the videos. 1 post-trip. 1 during the trip (from the road).

If you pledge $300 or more, I will give you a daily plug (One plug each day 3.23.12 - 4.2.12) in either my tweets, touts, Facebook posts, or in my picture uploads.


Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE THIS TO EVERYONE YOU KNOW! 


Send e-mails with this link. Tweet about it, post it to your facebook. Encourage dollar donations! IT WILL ALL ADD UP! Keep in mind, even if I only make $400, I will still be able to use $400 to pay for my car rental.

story:
Tangled Roots

Tangled Roots: Dialogues exploring ecological justice, healing, and decolonization is a collection of interviews examining important yet marginalized intersections of social and ecological issues.  Bringing together some of the most powerful interviews from five years of Healing the Earth Radio, this book breaks down barriers between subcultures and social movements, and seeks to educate, engage, and inspire.

Some of the interviews take a critical look at our world today – examining the ongoing legacy of colonialism in North America, the destructiveness of industrial civilization, the ecological impacts of agriculture and the telecommunications industry – others deal with healing emotional trauma, deconstructing conventional scientific paradigms, and repairing the earth, and still others urge us to take action to stop injustice and protect our earth before it’s too late.

Published through Healing the Earth Press in Guelph, Ontario, and edited and authored by Matt Soltys, it is due out Summer 2012.

 

"Tangled Roots is a collection of interviews from a broad spectrum of activists that seeks to penetrate to the root causes of the global system of oppression & exploitation. In essence, it is a radical critique of the industrial society now encompassing the earth, primarily focusing on anti-capitalist and ecological resistance. A thought-provoking and highly educational book on many aspects of what is, admittedly, a complex subject matter that involves several thousands of years of development & expansion. Despite this, it is highly accessible due to the format: a collection of interviews culled from 5 years of Healing the Earth Radio, based in Guelph, Ontario."

Gord Hill, Indigenous anti-capitalist and anti-colonial artist and writer, author of 500 Years of Indigenous Resistance Comic Book and Anti-Capitalist Resistance Comic Book.




 

 
Why this book, why now?

This book is unique in that it's an 'environmental' book that talks about migrant justice, gender violence, mental health, indigenous liberation, police brutality, and more. Within this book are clear discussions on the many interconnections between different social and environmental issues - and why social justice and environmental sustainability must go hand in hand.

Chosen for their relevance and importance, the interviews in Tangled Roots explore a systemic, interconnected analysis, and propose a civic engagement that addresses the depth and complexity of the problems we face. We are encouraged to see how we have more in common with other groups of people than we might otherwise think – and from there, to reach out and cultivate solidarity with others who share a similar worldview but a different focus.


Table of contents

Jihan Gearon and Diana Abellera – Towards climate justice
Richard Heinberg – Oil depletion, civilization, and the end of an era
Betsy Hartmann – Gender, refugees, and the militarization of climate change as a national security issue
Lierre Keith – A hard look at agriculture, and strategies for survival
Blake Levitt – The energetics of life and the dangers of electromagnetic pollution
Stephen Buhner – The lost language of plants and the heart as an organ of perception
Lisa Rayner – Trauma theory, permaculture, and emotional health
Erik Ohlsen – Permaculture, mystery, and industrial collapse
Craig Chalquist – On ecological identity and terrapsychology
Derrick Jensen – The collapse of civilization and the rebirth of community
Ramona Africa – MOVE: On being deeply committed revolutionaries
Waziyatawin – Towards a Turtle Island without the United States and Canada
Kanahus Pellkey – The warriors this Earth needs


More about the book

Tangled Roots contains 13 interviews, but it is much more than just a collection of interviews. It is an edited collection with each interview chosen to complement and build upon each of the others. My introductions to each interview tease out and highlight the tangled roots that weave throughout the book, making it more of it’s own unique project, and illuminating each interview in a much larger context.

An extensive endnote section includes details about people, reports, or events that were briefly mentioned by the contributor, providing in-depth information that makes it more of an educational text. The appendix contains a bio of each contributor and a bibliography detailing their projects and/or books. As an aesthetic attribute, each interview is accompanied by it's own original and beautiful illustration, drawn by an artist after she read and reflected on each interview.

"Here are well-crafted and interesting interviews that expand the conversation--some will make you uncomfortable, which is okay. You don't need to agree with everything, but you do need to know what people who aren't like you are thinking."

Bill McKibben, author of The End of Nature, Deep Economy, and Hope, Human and Wild

Check out the book's website at www.healingtheearthpress.org.






Why this project needs your support

While I am asking for donations, really I'm asking you to buy an advance copy. If you give the basic $25 amount, you're buying the book at its regular cost of $17, with the extra $8 going towards tax, shipping and a small donation. In this sense, it is similar to a Community Shared Agriculture (CSA) farm share - you pay up front to help with capital costs, and then you share in the harvest. If you are able to donate more than that extra few dollars, that would be a tremendous help.

The essential costs are as follows:
$2500 for printing
$400 for layout and design
$400 for illustrations and graphic design
$400 website registration and design

And then extra costs for shipping, promotional materials, IndieGogo's 4% fee, and other loose ends.


About the 'perks'

For a $50 donation, I'll send you the book along with three of my favourite 'zines, and send a free copy to a Books to Prisoners program. 'Zines are independently-produced booklets that can address a range of issues. It is a widely accessible form of publishing that is very popular in Do-It-Yourself (DIY) subcultures. Check out Wikipedia's page on 'zines if you are unfamiliar.

Books to Prisoners programs exist in many cities in North America. They foster literacy, education, empowerment, and a connection with the outside world by sending prisoners books upon request. They are volunteer operations that operate on donations and maintain an updated list of prisoners interested in receiving books.

.

 

 

Healing the Earth Radio

Produced at a community radio station in Guelph, Ontario, Healing the Earth Radio occupied a unique niche as one of the few ongoing media projects focusing on the interconnections between environmental issues, social justice, deep ecology, mental and emotional health, decolonization, prisoner solidarity, and more.

Healing the Earth Radio ran as a weekly two hour show on CFRU 93.3fm from June 2005 to June 2010. During that time I worked on more than 100 interviews that have been downloaded more than 120,000 times and re-broadcast on radio stations across North America. Through Healing the Earth Radio I received an Environment Canada scholarship to be part of the 2005 United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, and in 2009 Healing the Earth contributed to me being awarded Guelph's 'Bonnie McCallum Award for Unsung Environmental Hero'.

story:
About me.

For the past several years, I've been an avid conspiracy theorist.  My adolescent years were filled trying to absorb as much information surrounding conspiracy theories as possible.  I started sleeping less.  In fact, I started sleeping every other night so that I would be able to stay up for entire nights, researching the government's involvement in various events throughout the world.  I'd go up to three nights without sleep, researching stuff.  As expected, problems started developing.  I started getting blinding head-rushes.  I'd lose the ability to see for periods of time, followed by headaches that would leave me on floor.  I finally had to leave the conspiracy theory environment.  

Nearly a year later, I came back as a different person.  I was no longer out to get the government.  I believed that there were good people and that not everybody was corrupt.  I believed that it was possible that the planes were hijacked as the official stories stated.  I didn't reject official stories because they were official.  I began discrediting conspiracy theories just as commonly as I would discredit official stories.  

I started basing my theories on truth.  Truth.  I would research an official story or conspiracy theory until i wasn't able to find any more information on the subject.  After numerous months of researching and collecting information, I finally started piecing the information together in the form of a book.  It's not your average conspiracy theory book; it compares both sides of the story and holds them both in an equally credible light.  It's from the perspective on an unbiased individual, and the book reflects that.

Above all, the book is about promoting truth.  We, the citizens of the United States, deserve the truth about the events that took place on September 11th, 2001.  The families of the 3,000 who died deserve the truth.  

We don't let our employees lie to us.  The government is a employee of the American people, and we should not allow them to lie to us.  And, on that note, we shouldn't be lied to by conspiracy theorists who believe that they have the complete truth.  

We need and deserve the truth.

 

What I Need & What You Get

The book is essentially written.  I have nearly 200 pages, however, I'm planning on adding more.  But, I want the book edited professionally.  I want the book organized by a professional book doctor.  Though I believe that I am somewhat capable of editing the book, I want it to be professional.  I want it to be far superior to your average blogger who has a post on conspiracy theories.  I want it to be as good as a book that you would be able to pick off the shelves in a book store.  

• The money required for this project will be going to two different editors that I've already selected and conversed with.  It will be going to a professional designer for the artwork.  And, it will be going to a professional book doctor who can rearrange my content.  

• I don't plan to pocket any money, as anything left over will go towards the perks, which, by the way, seem pretty good.  Check them out to the right.

The Book


The book, as of now, is 200 pages long.  I wanted it to be somewhat brief.  I wanted it to be readable, and not some heavy piece that one would find at the library for a research paper.  And, as of now, the book is readable.  But, it's not good enough. That's why I need your help.

The book covers every plane and crash in detail, as well as the events that happened directly before and after the events.  The book compares official stories, side by side with the conspiracy theories.  

And, hopefully it will only get better.

Truth.

This book is something that is quite meaningful to me.  I am a supporter of truth and transparency when it comes government.  I believe that the government is a good thing.  We need some governing authority.  However, I'm an avid believer in a smaller, more transparent government.  I encourage everyone to voice their opinions and thoughts on subjects regarding truth.  

We need truth

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people are going through hardships and rough patches in life, so I totally understand if you aren't able to contribute, financially.  However, if you can share this page or write a blog post about national truth, I would be very appreciative.  

Truth is something that needs collective support and cooperation.  This is a movement.

I started basing my theories on truth.  Truth.  I would research an official story or conspiracy theory until i wasn't able to find any more information on the subject.  After numerous months of researching and collecting information, I finally started piecing the information together in the form of a book.  It's not your average conspiracy theory book; it compares both sides of the story and holds them both in an equally credible light.  It's from the perspective on an unbiased individual, and the book reflects that.
Above all, the book is about promoting truth.  We, the citizens of the United States, deserve the truth about the events that took place on September 11th, 2001.  The families of the 3,000 who died deserve the truth.  
We don't let our employees lie to us.  The government is a employee of the American people, and we should not allow them to lie to us.  And, on that note, we shouldn't be lied to by conspiracy theorists who believe that they have the complete truth.  
We need and deserve the truth.
 
What I Need & What You Get
The book is essentially written.  I have nearly 200 pages, however, I'm planning on adding more.  But, I want the book edited professionally.  I want the book organized by a professional book doctor.  Though I believe that I am somewhat capable of editing the book, I want it to be professional.  I want it to be far superior to your average blogger who has a post on conspiracy theories.  I want it to be as good as a book that you would be able to pick off the shelves in a book store.  
• The money required for this project will be going to two different editors that I've already selected and conversed with.  It will be going to a professional designer for the artwork.  And, it will be going to a professional book doctor who can rearrange my content.  
• I don't plan to pocket any money, as anything left over will go towards the perks, which, by the way, seem pretty good.  Check them out to the right.
The Book
The book, as of now, is 200 pages long.  I wanted it to be somewhat brief.  I wanted it to be readable, and not some heavy piece that one would find at the library for a research paper.  And, as of now, the book is readable.  But, it's not good enough. That's why I need your help.
The book covers every plane and crash in detail, as well as the events that happened directly before and after the events.  The book compares official stories, side by side with the conspiracy theories.  
And, hopefully it will only get better.
Truth.
This book is something that is quite meaningful to me.  I am a supporter of truth and transparency when it comes government.  I believe that the government is a good thing.  We need some governing authority.  However, I'm an avid believer in a smaller, more transparent government.  I encourage everyone to voice their opinions and thoughts on subjects regarding truth.  
We need truth
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that some people are going through hardships and rough patches in life, so I totally understand if you aren't able to contribute, financially.  However, if you can share this page or write a blog post about national truth, I would be very appreciative.  
Truth is something that needs collective support and cooperation.  This is a movement.

story:
I've been an avid fan of sci-fi and fantasy all my life, and for the longest time, one of my greatest desires as a writer was to write an epic paean to fandom.  Ten years later, and my new epic sci-fi series, "The Reality Engineers" begins with the story of a bunch of sci-fi geeks who, by way of stolen technology from Area 51, finally manage to get their hands on all the zany sci-fi gizmos they've been reading about and seeing in movies — and drooling over — all their lives.  Will they become heroes, or villains?  The story is projected to take five to seven books to tell properly, two of which — "What Happens At Con Stays At Con", "The Geek Shall Inherit The Earth" — are already written.  The third book is currently in progress and as I write this, it's about  60%  done.  I put its completion at around another month and a half.

"The Reality Engineers" is about more than just a gang of geeks and their wild adventures through space and time, though . . . it's also about the struggle of the mentally ill to cope with and live with their disabilities; it's about finding one's place in society, and about fitting in . . . or being "Mutant and Proud" as the X-Men might say.  I myself suffer from bipolar disorder, OCD, and ADHD symptoms, and as a result, I have been forced to live on Social Security Disability for the past ten years.  But — that doesn't mean I can't sit at my desk and write my little butt off, fully-engaged with my fantasies!  These challenges (and others) mean that the first book took me ten long years to finish, although its sequels have only taken (amazingly) a couple of months each to crank out.  It's been a long uphill battle against this illness, but after 27 failed attempts at having a regular job, dozens of medications, and about 10 different doctors, I finally feel that things have reached a turning point for me.  The publication of Volume 1, along with the almost-completion of Volumes 2 and 3, is a huge deal for me . . . and have given me something to take heart and pride in . . . I have found my place in this world at long, long last; I guess "storyteller" isn't such a bad avocation, is it? 

Anyway.  Enough of all that depressing crap.

The Reality Engineers: Volume 1 is a grand, epic tale of love, loss, adventure, geekery, and dealing with the crippling effects of mental instability . . . Believe it or not, I think this book could actually help people who're having trouble with that — as well as who're trouble with fitting in with the mainstream — if that's not too grand a goal for a weird, offbeat sci-fi series to have.  I also think it makes some important philosophical statements about love, God, the universe, and all that good stuff.  I can't guarantee you'll like all that it says, but I can almost guarantee that you'll enjoy the roller-coaster ride that the book takes getting there.  Plus, my beta-readers agree:  It's pretty damned funny — especially if you're a geek and can get all the cool nerdy in-jokes and references . . . of which there are about a million.  (Well, okay; maybe not that many).  Be sure to check out the video linked above for more info, as well as for a synopsis of the first two books and a list of projected expenses involved with promoting them.

The next five books — if I write that many — are projected to take at least four years to complete, edit, and publish, and the entire series — save Book 1 — will need cover art and promotional swag created  And, I will also need promotional materials — including a few videos, and even full-fledged epic musical scores — and a clever (but costly)  marketing campaign, which is laid out in the video linked above.  Of course, all of this will have to be commissioned, paid for, and then distributed, which is where this Indiegogo campaign comes in. 

Writing and publishing a series of book is easy, these days, if the muse is on your side (and believe me, sometimes she isn't).  It's promotion  and exposure — or the lack thereof— that either kills you, or gives birth to the next blockbuster bestseller.  And that's why I'm raising money for this project . . . the project being the writing, publishing, promotion, and distribution of this series through various channels and venues, and the means to achieve that, including an advertising budget, some kick-ass cover-art, and merchandise to act as swag during the books' promotion!

Book 1 is, as I said, already written and has been self-published through Smashwords.com and Amazon.com (the Smashwords edition is offered FREE to anyone who wants it! — go download it now; see the link below!  And, the print edition is just $10.69 through Amazon — so why not grab both?).  Book 2 is currently finished, but is in dire need of cover art, as is the currently-unfinished Book 3,  which is nearly complete and will be finished  —and hopefully ready to publish — by the end of February, 2014.  When all three books are done, I plan to use the money raised here to start a massive online advertising blitz, and well as use some of it to produce further promotional material — such as t-shirts, posters, and free author copies for those who want them.

Then, it's on to the next four books in the series.  I'll probably need to raise additonal money when the time comes in order to design, distribute, and promote those, though some of the money from this Indiegogo campaign will undoubtedly go toward that goal as well.

Please note:  The Perks listed below (i.e., the swag packs) will only be available if and only if I manage to meet my funding goal of $6,000 within 60 days. If I don't manage to crack $6,000 within that time but I do manage to raise at least $1000, then every person who donates at least $25 will, at the very least, receive both a free eBook edition of the first book as well as a signed physical copy of it, as an expression of my thanks.  I wish I could be more generous, but living on a fixed income and being a self-published author does, unfortunately, place limits on my resources!

So, what are you waiting for?  Pitch in today, and help a struggling novelist promote his awesome-sauce vision of a world gone mad and a world that might be all the better for it!  C'mon, gang — together, we can help make "The Reality Engineers" a worldwide phenomenon!  Don't forget to check out the kick-ass video presentation above for more details!

On Smashwords — http://bit.ly/13t3ysY

On Amazon — http://amzn.to/136xZLM

On Facebook — http://www.facebook.com/subgeniuszero

On Twitter — @wahainline

On the author's official blog — http://bit.ly/1cCsRh3

story:
Our Project


While there are countless yoga books out there, 21st Century Yoga: Culture, Politics, and Practice is the first to critically examine yoga as it actually exists in North America today. Written by experienced practitioners who are also teachers, therapists, activists, scholars, studio owners, and/or interfaith ministers, this unique set of essays provides a fresh take on the promise and pitfalls of contemporary yoga, exploring its relevance for issues including feminism, body image, psychology, activism, ethics, and spirituality.

 

The purpose of this campaign is to raise the funds necessary to independently publish the book. In keeping with our DIY collaborative ethos, we’re keeping the costs as low as we can without sacrificing quality and professionalism. Specifically, the money raised will be used to produce cover art and design, and secure assistance with typesetting and graphics. We plan to run this campaign through April, and publish 21st Century Yoga in September 2012.


Our Team


Co-editors Carol Horton and Roseanne Harvey are yoga bloggers, as well as dedicated teachers, practitioners, and writers. Carol blogs regularly at Think Body Electric,Elephant Journal, and Yoga Modern, and is the author of Yoga Ph.D.: Integrating the Life of the Mind & the Wisdom of the Body (which will be published concurrently with 21st Century Yoga), and Race and the Making of American Liberalism (Oxford University Press, 2005). Roseanne writes the leading yoga blog ,It’s All Yoga, Baby, serves as co-director of Yoga Festival Montreal, and was formerly editor of the beloved Canadian yoga magazine, Ascent.

 

Contributors to 21st Century Yoga include:

  • Frank Jude Boccio, author of Mindfulness Yoga, contributor to Tricycle, Shambhala Sun, Namaskar, and Yoga Journal; and blogger at Mindfulness Yoga and Zen Naturalism;
  • Angela Jamison, founder and owner of Ashtanga Yoga: Ann Arbor, and blogger at insideowl;
  • Melanie Klein, professor of Sociology and Women’s Studies at Santa Monica College, and blogger at FeministFatale, Adios Barbie, Elephant Journal, Ms. Magazine, and WIMN’s Voices;
  • Matthew Remski, co-creator of the Yoga 2.0 project and co-director of Yoga Community Canada;
  • Chelsea Roff, Managing Editor at Intent.com, and blogger at Yoga Journal, Elephant Journal, and Yoga Modern;
  • Tommy Rosen, pioneer in the relatively new field of Yoga and Recovery, and author of posts and articles in the L.A. Yoga, Yogi Times, Aquarian Times, Huffington Post, Daily Love, and Yoga Mint;
  • Be Scofield, founder of www.godblessthewholeworld.org, beyondwhiteness.com, and blogger at Tikkun and Alternet;
  • Michael Stone, founder of Centre of Gravity,Toronto, and author of numerous books, most recently including Awake in the World: Teachings from Yoga & Buddhism for Living an Engaged Life (Shambhala 2011);
  • Nathan Thompson, blogger at Dangerous Harvests, 21st Century Relationships, and Life as a Human; and
  • Julian Walker, an “activist for reality-based spirituality,” blogger, and author of the forthcoming book, The Embodied Sacred: Spirituality Beyond Superstition.

 

Our Content

 

While there may be minor changes before the book is published, the majority of the following essays are finished and ready for publication:

  1. Introduction: Yoga and North American Culture (Carol Horton)
  2. Enlightenment 2.0: The American Yoga Experiment (Julian Walker)
  3. How Yoga Makes You Pretty: The Beauty Myth, Yoga and Me (Melanie Klein)
  4. Starved for Connection: Healing Anorexia Through Yoga (Chelsea Roff)
  5. Questioning the “Body Beautiful”: Yoga, Commercialism, and Discernment (Frank Jude Boccio)
  6. Bifurcated Spiritualities: Examining Mind/Body Splits in the North American Yoga and Zen Communities (Nathan Thompson)
  7. Yoga and the 12 Steps: Holistic Recovery from Addiction (Tommy Rosen)
  8. How Yoga Messed With My Mind (Angela Jamison)
  9. Yoga for War: The Politics of the Divine (Be Scofield)
  10. Modern Yoga Will Not Form a Real Culture Until Every Studio Can Also Double as a Soup Kitchen and other observations from the threshold between yoga and activism (Matthew Remski)
  11. Our True Nature is Our Imagination: Yoga and Non-Violence at the Edge of the World (Michael Stone)
  12. Conclusion: The Evolution of Yoga and the Practice of Writing (Roseanne Harvey)


Our Campaign

 

We’re hoping to raise $2,000 to cover our initial publishing costs; the bare-bones minimum needed to produce a quality work. Given that everyone’s been putting in many, many hours for free, we’re hoping to not only cover our costs, but ideally provide a small honorarium to our hard-working writers and editors too.

 

Any amount you can give will be sincerely appreciated. In gratitude for your support, we’re offering the following incentives:

  • For $10, we’ll thank you as a supporter on our website, 21centuryyoga.com;
  • For $20, you’ll get a “thank you” and a copy of 21st Century Yoga;
  • For $40, you’ll get a “thank you,” a copy of 21st Century Yoga and a copy of Carol Horton’s new book, Yoga Ph.D.;
  • For $75, you’ll get a “thank you,” 21st Century Yoga, Yoga Ph.D., and an IAYB t-shirt;
  • For $100, you’ll get a “thank you,” 21st Century Yoga, Yoga Ph.D., and an IAYB t-shirt & totebag; and
  • For $250, you’ll get a “thank you” both on the website and in the “Acknowledgements” section the book, along with copies of 21st Century Yoga and Yoga Ph.D.

 

Our Intent


It’s safe to say that writing about yoga (both for this particular project and more generally) is a labor of love for all involved. We’re not working to craft a commercial blockbuster, and cash in on the multi-million dollar “yoga industry.” Instead, we’re writing to communicate ideas and experiences that have mattered to us – and that we hope will prove interesting, inspiring, or in some way useful to others. While there’s no single method or mission that unifies our work, we do share a sense that yoga matters – not simply to us as individuals, but as a valuable resource for our deeply troubled society, and the world that we live in today.



Please Join Us! We’d Love Your Help.

This is a social media generated, DIY project – and we need your help to realize its potential. Here’s how you can make a difference:

·   CONTRIBUTE to our campaign! Any amount appreciated.

·   SHARE our project with anyone who might be interested – by word of mouth, via email, on Facebook, Twitter, etc.

·   LEARN MORE about our book by visiting our website, 21centuryyoga.com.

·   WRITE about our book and campaign for your blog, newspaper, magazine, etc.

·   CONTACT US at 21centuryyoga (at) gmail.com to share your thoughts or request more information.


THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Melissa Harris.  I’m on a mission to offer any guidance and/or inspiration I can to assist folks in tuning in to and utilizing their own creative and intuitive abilities.  I want each of you to live life to the fullest which I believe includes being "awake" and tuned into Spirit as well as integrating our creative abilities into our lives in a meaningful way.

SO HOW AM I QUALIFIED TO DO THIS YOU ASK ???

Artistic  Background:  I’m an internationally published author and artist as well as a psychic.  I hold a BFA in Painting from Syracuse University and an MFA in Painting from Queens College in New York.  I attended the Brooklyn Museum Art School on a Max Beckman Scholarship and received a Fulbright grant to study Painting in Paris.

CREATRIX is my publishing line of notecards,  prints, and other gift items. My work can be found on CD covers, book covers, magazines, and calendars  in shops worldwide.  My “Anything is Possible” activation card deck won best in show at the International New Age Trade show in 2008. 

Psychic Background:  After a profound spiritual awakening in my late 20’s I began offering readings, which transformed into hands on healing.  I studied formally with Barbara Brennan at her Hands-on-Healing school.  I’ve been doing readings since that time and in more recent years found that I enjoy doing what I call “Spirit Essence Portraits” which are a combination of an intuitive reading, followed by a narrative watercolor painting of what I discover after tuning in. 

Teaching

I teach workshops and classes that combine artistic technique with spirituality called “Painting Outside the Lines”.   I also offer workshops on developing and using your psychic awareness.

The Book-

The book  is autobiographical in nature and also contains what I believe to be truths about some general traits of artists, as well as common ingredients of an artist’s as well as a psychic’s life.  I've also addressed questions that folks have asked me time and time again:

 Does being psychic have an effect on my artwork?

What’s it like to be psychic?

How is my world different?

How does an artist deal with rejection?

Yes, it may seem like $21.95 is a lot to pay for a book. probably seems like it is. But Painting Outside the Lines isn't just any book.  It has many paintings of mine you won't see anywhere else and lots of them.  It may never be published by a larger publisher and I'm not printing a huge number of copies. 

You'll get a book. But it's a really special book. Only a few hundred other people will have it. And you'll also be helping us change how books get into the hands of readers.

And by the way, if someone tells you that $21.95 is too much to pay for a book, ask them how much they spent for the last concert they went to. Was it worth it? Absolutely. But a book is more than a 2-hour experience. Also, you get to keep it to read again. And if you want to, you can lend it to a friend to experience as well. These things all have value, (And if you really value that live, in-person experience, I have a donation level for that.)

 

WHERE THE MONEY IS GOING

It's going to cost me almost $25,000 to publish the book including production, editing, design, galleys, postage, book tour expense, marketing and publicity.  I'm asking you to help cover a portion of these expenses.

  • Editorial, design and consultation services                               $10,000                              
  • Galleys for review and postage                                                $600                                    
  • Book tour expenses, marketing, and publicity            approx $5,000
  • Production - printing, binding, packing, shipping etc.            $9,000               
  • Payment of Indiegogo fees, and fulfillment of perks            UNKNOWN       

The Impact

I'm sure this book will be helpful for YOU in some way.  Most everyone wants to be able to access and develop both their creativity as well as their intuitive abilities.  Even if you are not interested in either of these you will surely enjoy browsing through the collection of my artwork- much of it never seen before.  People have been enjoying a certain body of my artwork for years and this is an opportunity to see more- a body of very personal work - dear to my heart. So take the leap and donate now to receive your copy.  

I've taken this text from the body of another author's campaign and it is right on.

Let's take a moment for a lesson on how the traditional publishing industry works, because this might help explain why I'm undertaking this experiment. As a writer, I give my book to a publisher. In exchange, they give me a little money (the advance) as a good faith gesture. But that money isn't really a payday. It's a loan. Before I get any more money from my book, I have to pay that loan back in the form of a royalty I'm credited with for each copy of my book that sells. Only after I've paid back the advance do I get any more money.

So let's say a publisher really loves my book and decides to give me an advance of 10K for it. (I'm using round numbers to make this easy on my math-impaired brain.) The publisher prints a paperback and assigns a price of $15. If I have a good deal with them, my royalty rate is 8% of that $15 sale price, so for every copy of Painting Outside the Lines sold, I'm credited with $1.20. If my math is correct, this means I have to sell 8,334 copies of my book to pay back that 10K I was given as an advance. Only after that's done does the publisher owe me anything else.

And here's the thing--most writers never earn back that advance. 8,334 copies is a lot to sell. Most books sell far fewer copies than that. FAR fewer. So most authors are never going to see any money beyond what they were given for an advance. And advances are getting smaller and smaller as publishers get more and more reluctant to take chances on anything other than books with broad commercial appeal.

Part of the problem, of course, is that 92% of a book's sale price (on the paperback in my example) goes to the publisher. Now, they've taken all the risk and put up the money for editing, designing, printing, marketing, and distribution, so maybe this is fair. I'm not here to argue that. I'm just trying to explain why it is that the authors of the books you love to read so often seem to be in financial distress. 

This is why I love things like Indiegogo. It gives writers (and all artists) a chance to take our work directly to readers. A huge percentage of what you donate will still go to covering the costs of editing, designing, and printing a book, or recording a CD. But because more of what our work earns is going to us, the artists you support will have a fighting chance of going on to make the next record, or write the next book, or create the next show. By removing the obstacles created by outdated ways of operating, we're creating new opportunities. And that's exciting.

Please--share my campaign with friends you think might be into it. Put it on your Facebook page. Send out one of those awful "My friend is doing this cool thing!" emails. You'll get karma points. And if we meet in person, a hug. Possibly cookies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

• Share this campaign with your friends and family

• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.

story:
Support The Campaign

If you're like most people you want to be healthy and make good food choices.  When you're at the grocery store do you feel like the ingredients on the label are confusing and hard to understand?  Do you get so overwhelmed by what's on the label that you give up and stop paying attention?  That can make it difficult to be sure you're eating well. 

Let me help.  My name is Mira Dessy and my book, "The Pantry Principle: learning to read the labels and understand what's in your food" will help you learn about the different, often confusing things that are in your food.  You'll also learn some of the ways that manufacturers try to deliberately mislead, confuse or hide the issues.  This knowledge will allow you to become a smarter, healthier shopper.
 
I have a Bachelor's degree in Fine Arts however later in life, after a personal health crisis, I chose to go back to school, Bauman College of Holistic Nutrition, and become a Certified Nutrition Educator.  Bauman College is a highly respected school in my field and one of the few which is accredited by the National Association of Nutrition Professionals.  The NANP is the leading body setting standards for holistic nutrition and it does require me to earn CEUs in my field to maintain my professional status. 
 
I currently have a private practice working with individual clients and groups doing consultations, classes, and lectures.  I also work at a Functional Medicine Clinic which specializes in people with neurobiological disorders (ADD, Anxiety, Bipolar Disorder, Tourette's, etc).  My biggest focus with clients is to help them find bio-individual food-based solutions to their challenges.  As an example I have helped clients find food-based solutions for conditions such as arthritis, psoriasis, poor sleep, digestive ailments, and calm the symptoms of their neurobiological disorders.  I have also helped clients who have come to me because their doctors have told them that they "need to change their diet" but have not given them a culturally sensitive approach or the information necessarily to successfully do this.  Part of the reason doctor's don't do what I do is because they don't have the time.  I spend hours with clients when I work with them; my focus is to help them eat the way they like to eat yet modify it to meet the needs of their body and help them to achieve their health goals.
 
This book came about after years of going into people's homes to help them learn how to understand what was really in their food.  Now I want to help you.
 
Your contribution will allow me to fund the publication costs associated with my book so I can get it off the press into your hands.  I want to help more people eat well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help get the word out:

  • email this information to friends and family
  • share through social media:  Facebook, twitter, Google +, LinkedIn and more
  • don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your support.

story:
Story of My Book

The Creative Engineer is about the importance of creativity to STEM fields and how it’s an important skill that should be taught and practiced the same way math and science are.

My name is Jonina Yang and I am the author of The Creative Engineer. I wrote this book because I grew up wanting to be an engineer but found it difficult to bring my passion for art and creativity into my work and classes as a mechanical engineering student. For the longest time I thought that creativity and engineering had to exist as two separate parts of my life and there was no way I could blend the two together.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that creativity is also an important skill that should be taught in engineering. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to take a step back from the view that engineering is purely just math and science and see that creativity is still extremely important to becoming a good engineer and solving more complex problems in the world.

You will love this book if you want to see STEM fields from a different perspective and learn more about how education translates into the working world.

The Creative Engineer speaks to students and educators who want to grapple with creativity and engineering in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Creative Engineer inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • Is creativity really something that I should practice as an engineer?
  • Do people around me see engineers as creative people or just someone who plugs numbers into equations all day?
  • How important has creativity been to the world around me?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing an education in creativity, the science behind it, and how to bring this skill to the classrooms will change us all for the better.

 

The Book - The Creative Engineer

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1 - 4. This part discusses the science behind creativity and the history of engineering as a whole. My story about my freshman year project of building an autonomous chime machine demonstrates how creativity has been brought into my college education.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5 - 8. This part mentions the specific traits or principles that a creative engineer would have. Some of these traits are not being afraid and making skills into habits. It also answers a common question that gets thrown into the mix of trying to bring creativity into engineering: is creativity really something that can be taught?

Part 3 contains Chapters 9 - 12. This last section of The Creative Engineer speaks about how to actually become a creative engineer. The traits mentioned in the previous part are important but it is also necessary to see different things that can be applied to our work that make us better engineers.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020!
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter!
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Jonina Yang is a mechanical engineering student at Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT), a private research university in Henrietta, NY.

As a child, she dreamed of being an engineer. As someone who took part in things such as dance and art since she could walk, she still wanted the chance to be creative while pursuing an education as a mechanical engineering student. Within her first year of college, she realized that creativity wasn’t something that seemed to be touched on in her classes. Everything was focused on science and things that had already been proven and studied. As someone with a passion for art and an interest in solving the world’s problems, she wanted to take a deeper dive into learning how a strong creative ability could benefit her as an engineer.

Outside of engineering and the arts, she enjoys working out and being outside hiking or spending time with friends at the beach. Anything that gets her out of a chair and keeps her active is up her alleyway.

For more information you can connect with Jonina at joninayang73@gmail.com and along with Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheCreativeEngineer and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jonina Yang

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

About the Author Jonina Yang is a mechanical engineering student at Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT), a private research university in Henrietta, NY.As a child, she dreamed of being an engineer. As someone who took part in things such as dance and art since she could walk, she still wanted the chance to be creative while pursuing an education as a mechanical engineering student. Within her first year of college, she realized that creativity wasn’t something that seemed to be touched on in her classes. Everything was focused on science and things that had already been proven and studied. As someone with a passion for art and an interest in solving the world’s problems, she wanted to take a deeper dive into learning how a strong creative ability could benefit her as an engineer.Outside of engineering and the arts, she enjoys working out and being outside hiking or spending time with friends at the beach. Anything that gets her out of a chair and keeps her active is up her alleyway.For more information you can connect with Jonina at joninayang73@gmail.com and along with Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn.Risks & Challenges
