story:
Pen.fm  is a community of living narratives, powered by cutting-edge cloud publishing technology and analytics.

  

--- recently featured as #3 on front page of Hacker News! ---

Imagine a creative community of readers and writers empowered with: 

+ cloud writing / e-reader publishing tools 

+ interactive social reader to showcase work

+ real-time feedback & engagement analytics

It's not just your imagination. Welcome to Pen.fm.

 

See a reader mode demo of a fun story beta testers wrote on Pen.fm

See how academic papers can be reviewed and discussed on Pen.fm

(sections are clickable) 

** Donations go to help keep Pen.fm in development over the next few months and pay for hosting and engineering costs as the site expands.

----------- 

 

... Great. But what does that mean for me? 

Glad you asked.

 

1) Pen.fm will make you actually to write

Anytime, all the time. Alone, with friends, with classmates, with strangers... creating awesome narratives you can save, review, publish, and share at the click of a button! 

It's an experience unlike any other.

 

2) Work on your own or work with others, get feedback as you write

No more clunky gdocs and confusing Word comment annotations. No more waiting forever for editing feedback and peer review.  

Give and receive real-time feedback directly on live work showcased on Pen.fm's social cloud reader. Make life easier for everyone.
 

3) From onscreen to your Kindle, Nook, Amazon in seconds

We're probably underemphasizing it, but this feature alone is pure magic.

Even professional authors must spend hours adding HTML and formatting tags by hand and use complicated conversion software just to make sure work published on the ereader looks decent. We've developed a way to do it in seconds, all prep work done.

From your first typed word, what you see is what you get. And what you get is one-click, perfectly-formatted story exports to any ereader of your choice. Presto!

 

4) Shy about writing? Plenty of other things to do!

There's no pressure to put pen to paper. Feel free to spend your time reading, commenting, and sharing all the cool content people are creating every day! There's tons of stories in progress to explore and you'll likely be tempted to join in on your own.

 

Stories come to life with comments and feedback from your friends as you write

 

View open works neatly organized with detailed data and statistics

 

Who should use Pen.fm?

- anyone who wants to explore writing or self-publishing 

- anyone who wants to enjoy and interact with cool stories in real time

You don't have to be a professional writer or editor to benefit from how awesome Pen.fm is (but if you are, then you'll really thank us).

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

 

THE PROBLEM WITH EPUBLISHING TODAY

The publishing process can be broken down into 3 steps:

Writing, Converting into file formats, and Distribution. 

 

Problem #1: The writing process itself is very time intensive and inefficient because of delays in the editing stages to collect/incorporate feedback.

Writers have to go through a painful cycle writing, getting feedback, incorporating feedback, editing, and repeat. This is frustrating for both writer and editor, delaying publication, which in turn unfairly frustrates readers.

Pen.fm gives writers a way to easily collect specific, real-time feedback on their work. Saves time for writers and editors, improves quality of writing.

 

Problem #2: To publish, writers must spend too much of their time handling conversion and distribution

We want to help writers get back to doing what they do best: writing. To get work properly formatted onto an ereader, writers must use obscure, complicated software programs that require them hours of work to add html by hand to manuscripts. The alternative is exporting a pdf using Word, at the cost of terrible formatting which undermines the work's value.

With Pen.fm, you get exactly what you see: perfectly formatted work in seconds at the click of a button, ready to share or gift.

 

[L] Hours of man labor adding HTML and formatting tags prepare a manuscript for e-reader conversion using complicated programs. Will still give you horribly formatted results.

[R] Written work on Pen.fm's platform auto-converted to e-reader ready format in seconds. 

 

--------------------

Help us help fix epublishing (and get cool stuff doing it!)

We're not talking smoke and snake oil here. Pen.fm is already built. 

But while functional, it'll still be a couple more months of hard work before Pen.fm can be prepared for public release. 

We need your help to be able to finish production. 

We've been working on Pen.fm completely bootstrapped and while we're hungry young entrepreneurs who love building a product we believe in, there are a lot of personal costs to continue to be able to continue to build out and maintain Pen.fm over the next few months.

 

Check out donation options to see how you can help keep Pen.fm in production and share this widely! >>>

**FIRST 75 DONATIONS of $20 and over will get free Pen.fm tshirts.

 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

 

So please, 

Support the campaign and help us keep Pen.fm in production. 

Tell your family, tell your friends, share with anyone you think will want to make a difference in helping revitalizing the online writing community and revolutionize self-publishing.

Keep the Pen.fm dream alive. :)

 

Interested in learning more?

Feel free to drop us a line at info@pen.fm. Thanks!

 

ABOUT THE TEAM

Pen.fm is driven by a dynamic coder + designer duo who feel writing is becoming a neglected art and want to reinspire and empower writers through innovative technology. 

The Pen.fm team met while working at an epublishing startup where we witnessed firsthand the many challenges of today's writers, editors, and publishers adapting to growing pains of the online media era. 

Michael (UCLA '10) is a self-taught frontend and backend engineer who previously masterminded an interactive social cloudreader and is a published author. His favorite writers range from Douglas Adams to Orphan Pamuk.

Kat (Stanford '11) is a UI/UX designer and illustrator. She has produced cover branding for over 500 ebooks, does strategic design consulting, and staffs as resident designer at StartX startup accelerator. She not-so-secretly enjoys scifi fiction, comics, and nutella.

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Special thanks to Ryan Witt, Laura Griffiths, Tyler White, and Kyle Wong for starring in the video (in order of appearance)

story:
About The Author:

I was born in Munich in the late sixties and live in Ireland since 2000. I work as Holistic Health Researcher, Anti- Aging Expert, Feng Shui Consultant, Bio-Resonance Therapist, Author, Workshop leader, Spiritual Counsellor.

My research has led me to discover the underlying principles of human health and disease. In contrary to conventional medicine, my focus is not the study of diseases but the detailed comprehension of health and the conditions that lead towards health.
I believe that incurable diseases do not exist. It is our misunderstanding about the biochemical, biophysical and spiritual aspects of the human system that prevent the cure of serious illnesses.

One main focus of my work is to unite science and spirituality. I believe there is no real science without the underlying understanding of the spiritual realms.

 

The Campaign

Is to help raise the lacking funds for the finishing touch of my e-book - such as illustrations.

The e-book "Lifeprocesses - the science of health and longevity" gives some uniquie insights into why we age, how ageing and the causes of degenerative diseases are linked and how we can actually avoid both.
The book gives a very detailed understanding about the 3 different categories of causes for all degenerative diseases and shows how to clear these causative factors to come to a healing process. The book is not just theory - everything I write isderived from my practical experiences in this field.


The information presented in this book help the reader to gain absolute self - reliance and independence about his health and his ageing process. It aims to take away the fear of serious disease by simply describing all the underlying factors that causes them.


The Funding

This book already takes more then one year of my attention, which I didn't really anticipate. I had to abandon a lot of other activities that I usually did to build a modest livelyhood.
My work is not funded through any other source and my means have reached a limit. The writing is already finished but I do need some more funding for illustrations, since I want to make this a nice visual experience as well.

 
The Impact
 
It really depends on the openness and imagination of the reader. I am giving a road map to a complete understanding of how the body works and how we can stop or significantly slow down the dacay of it and prevent serious diseases.

Of course there is no magic pill, its about changing your awareness to your environment, your nutrition and to who YOU actually are....

I would hope that this work leads to various cooperations in the fields of health and that it may be a tiny contribution to a totally new health system that operates for the benefit of the people and not for the benefit of multinationals.

Other ways you can help
 
Please spread the word and put this campaign on your facebook wall or email it to friends.

story:
Now more than ever, stories that champion equality, social justice, and inclusion are so important to the future of our society. That’s why this Giving Tuesday we at Belletrist have partnered with global literacy nonprofit NABU to run an Indiegogo fundraising campaign to create the first book in a world-changing children’s series.  

 

The motivation for this creative Giving Tuesday campaign is to use the power of stories to create global connections and share culture, aiming to increase diversity and representation in children’s stories. 58% of parents report that diversity is extremely important in the books their children read and yet only 13% of children’s books published in the US in the last 24 years contain any kind of multicultural content.

 

Founded by actress Emma Roberts and Karah Preiss, Belletrist celebrates great books and the people who read them. Our charity partner NABU is a global literacy non-profit that provides access to quality, culturally relevant, native language storybooks for children in low-income countries, by commissioning local artists and writers to create these books. 

 

 

'Many Stars, One Moon' is a world-changing children’s series made entirely possible by YOU! Your contributions to the campaign will allow NABU’s authors and illustrators in Rwanda and Kenya, to create this one-of-a-kind children’s book edition. We at Belletrist hope to raise $2,000 to create the first story in the 'Many Stars, One Moon' series, with contributors being able to see the storyline and illustrations come to life in real-time- how cool is that?

 

If we reach our $2,000 goal, not only will a digital and printed edition be available in English to our contributors, but also in many more native languages for free in digital format to the over 100,000 readers accessing NABU’s low bandwidth reading application in Rwanda, Kenya, and Haiti. 

 

Now is the time. Your contributions will start a movement to support the creation of locally-made native language books for 250M underserved children who are failing to acquire basic literacy skills. 40% of children worldwide do not have access to books in their native language, even though native-language instruction is the most cost-effective intervention in early-grade literacy, helping children to reap the benefits of education. 

 

Contributions to the campaign will be felt for generations to come. The first book in the ‘Many Stars, One Moon’ series will empower children around the world, and equip them to self-advocate and participate in critical conversations around gender equality, prejudice, social justice, and climate change. 

Help us fund this book! Join Belletrist and NABU in championing social justice, by contributing to the ‘Many Stars, One Moon’ series, together let us use the power of diverse storytelling to help us build back better, a more just and equal world. 

 

Please note: physical copies of the books are only available to residents with a USA shipping address. Digital copies are available for worldwide distribution.

story:
Story of My Book

Unaware is about injustice and equality and how everyone has something in common. 

My name is L.C. Reid and I am the author of Unaware. I wrote this book because I want to call attention to how the media portrays minorities and how people need to start looking at their similarities, not their differences.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover why prejudices and biases, while common in human nature, are harmful and think about why they exist. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to explore forgiveness, move past obstacles, and examine a life worth living. 

My book is for young people who want to escape this world and fall into another place beyond the mundane routine of lock-down. In Unaware, my characters get transported into a new world where each learns more about themselves and each other. As they navigate their new environment and understand the cultural similarities it has with their own society, they explore all that this new place has to offer. In the end, they learn about their inner strengths as they begin to help the people around them. 

You will love this book if you like fantasy stories with a contemporary twist.

Unaware speaks to young adults and fantasy fanatics who want to grapple with racism and inequality in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Unaware inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  1. How can I find and spread tolerance in an unfair world?
  2. Where did prejudices come from?
  3. How does the media influence and enforce these prejudices?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing injustice and equality will change us all for the better. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

L.C. Reid is an English major at Arizona State University, double minoring in Women and Gender Studies and Justice Studies.

She wrote this book because she is passionate about justice and how people are represented in society. She hopes that through this book people will be able to have more self-awareness about their place in their communities and think about their actions.

In her free time, she is often listening to music, reading, playing card games with her family, or cuddling with her dog.

For more information, you can connect with L.C. Reid at lereid3@asu.edu and at @/l.c.reid_author on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Unaware and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
L.C. Reid

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!
About the Author
L.C. Reid is an English major at Arizona State University, double minoring in Women and Gender Studies and Justice Studies.She wrote this book because she is passionate about justice and how people are represented in society. She hopes that through this book people will be able to have more self-awareness about their place in their communities and think about their actions.In her free time, she is often listening to music, reading, playing card games with her family, or cuddling with her dog.For more information, you can connect with L.C. Reid at lereid3@asu.edu and at @/l.c.reid_author on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Unaware and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,L.C. Reid

story:
За начинанието

Здравейте и благодарим на всички отворили тази страница.

Може би не сте запознати, но в Ихтиман все още има хора занимаващи се с култура, изкуство и литература. Една от тях е Веселка Гълъбова, автор на първия том на "История на Ихтиман", който се превърна в голям успех сред малобройната, но взискателна читателска аудитория.

Запознати сте вероятно, че хората занимаващи се с култура трудно намират подкрепа за начинанията си. За късмет има платформи за поделено финансиране, като напр. indiegogo и чрез нея се надяваме да ви убедим, да подпомогнете издаването на Том 2 на Историята на Ихтиман.

Всяка малка финансова подкрепа от ваша страна, ще помогне на госпожа Веселка Гълъбова да издаде книгата си и няма да и се налага да разпродава покъщнина и собственост за целта.

За вас е малка сума, за авторката е голяма помощ, а резултатът ще е един хубав книжен спомен, на който и вие ще може да се насладите.


Какво ни е нужно и какво получавате вие

Помощта ще е, всеки от вас да си закупи книгата преди да е издадена и при набиране на необходимите средства, всеки от вас ще получи изпратен по пощата един екземпляр.

Вашата помощ ще се употреби за издаването, редакцията, труда на автора, пощенски разходи и разходите в тази кампания.

Книгата ще бъде издадена и дори при не достигане на целта от 1000 долара. Вашите помощи няма да отидат напразно. Вие ще получите книгата, но забавено, когато средствата за издаване станат налице.

Резултатът от вашата помощ

Всяко ваше дарение или предварителна покупка, ще подпомогнат и насърчат авторката да продължи с творческата си дейност. А тя е име за качествено творение. Трудни са времената за издаване в България и вие може да помогнете и на нея и на вашата малка библиотека в чужбина.

Други начини да помогнете

Ако все пак не можете да подпомогнете финансово, помогнете ни с малко маркетинг. Разпостранете сред вашите познати и приятели тази кампания. Може би някой от тях би могъл да стане дарител.


Благодарим ви предварително и дано вече се радвате, че можете да помогнете. 

С удоволствие ще ви изпратим веднага щом излезе, пресен екземпляр от печатницата.

story:
A book of jobs

My name is Will Carruthers. I have played music for all of my adult life, performing  with Spacemen3 , Spiritualized, Spectrum, The Brian Jonestown Massacre, Dead Skeletons and many other bands that you may not have heard of. While pursuing my musical adventures I found myself doing many unglamorous jobs in an effort to survive. I have written a book of short stories that describe some of these experiences. I intend to publish it and make the books by hand. I need your support to get it done. If you would like a book (or something else), check out what is on offer on the right hand side of this page and send the money through this site.

This kickstarter is now closed but if you would like to know when the book is available then please sign up for my mailing list HERE


What is the book about ?

This book contains twenty one autobiographical stories concerning my time in factories and on building sites, whilst playing with some notorious and ground breaking bands.
It contains eighty five thousand words, (that's book sized), lovingly arranged into the best possible order, with a cast of characters and situations including :
A plutonium factory, badgers, playing the bass with three left hands, fireballs. the ghosts of dead navvies, Millicant Dalton, the northern lights, a giant turd,(possibly belonging to Jimmy Page), Midland meat packers, sleeping under a hedge eating nuts and berries, life with dead skeletons, poaching a thousand eggs, a very loud cow, Reassuring Dave, robot snipers, a deranged imp, real life Tetris, the lead content of paint, a river of piss, Oasis at Knebworth, a winking fox, the ghost of Billie Holiday ... and some other stuff. 
It's a merry and largely good natured romp through the blunt end of the deregulated labour market of the late eighties, nineties, and beyond, presented for the discerning reader in digestible and minimal attention span pleasing chunks. There are also some band stories.

What is in it for you?

I recently published my first book. It is called "A spoon for the air". I made it entirely by hand in my kitchen. Here is a video of that procedure 

It is available as a download here

    Do not be misled by the seemingly unprofessional work environment. The books actually came out rather well. During the process I learned all sorts of important things about the venerable art of bookbinding.

 It took me two months to make the first one but the production rate rose to nearly four a day towards the end of the run. There were many choice words, cut fingers, and random scraps of gluey paper in strange places along the way.  The last of them  came out out of my home made book press with a little sadness and some relief. It was hard work but strangely rewarding in itself. The books sold out as quickly as I could make them. 

It was satisfying  to know the names of the people who were going to receive them and to take the trip up to the post office each day to send them off around the world. Here is a picture of a book that found its way to Ethiopia. 


  • With your help, I would like to repeat the process with "A book of jobs". This time I am going to work in an artists collective here in Berlin that has many beautiful old bookbinding tools and machines that are available to local artists. 

    The writing  is in the final editing stages and work will begin on the hardback prototypes of the book this month.

    I will be posting information and photographs to let you know how the work is progressing.  A series of around twenty, hand printed, linoleum cuts will be hand bound into the hard back copies and the cover will also be hand printed and hand made. Each book will be unique. It will a take lot of work. I really want to make these things beautifully and beautiful. 

    Sometimes it is only in the production of a thing that you become aware of what it is that you can actually make, so the final design will  become apparent during the the coming months. 

    The hardback edition of "A book of Jobs" will be strictly limited to one hundred signed and numbered copies and a soft back edition will also be available, (with a hand printed cover). 

    This is your opportunity to get your hands on one .  

    The funds that you contribute here will buy the time and the materials I need to make these books. It will also serve as a useful pre-ordering system, so that I can have an idea of how many to make.

    Eventually, a digital copy will be produced so that the stories are available to everyone who wants to read them. 

     In the digital age, it is becoming increasingly difficult to produce anything that takes time without the support and encouragement of the people who appreciate your work. Your involvement here will not only fund the making of this book, it will also be the springboard for the next. 

     If you can't contribute financially perhaps you could help by spreading the word in some way.

    You can find me on twitter here ,on Facebook here , and on tumblr here.

     It is a new experience for me to work with crowd funding and I hope that this proves to be rewarding  for everybody involved. Your support and interest is appreciated and valued. 

    Thank you for your time.

 In the digital age, it is becoming increasingly difficult to produce anything that takes time without the support and encouragement of the people who appreciate your work. Your involvement here will not only fund the making of this book, it will also be the springboard for the next. 

 If you can't contribute financially perhaps you could help by spreading the word in some way.
You can find me on twitter here ,on Facebook here , and on tumblr here.

story:
Willowmena's Quest is the tale of a motherless girl named Willowmena, her friend Merloo, a fairy with a broken wing and her companion Gore, a rhinoceros with a flashing red eye. They are all lost and wandering without purpose in the Land of Bleak.  Together they embark on a life-changing journey and an unlikely quest with a very surprising ending. Joined by a mute prince and pursued by an evil miner who is rapidly closing in, they are all trying to make their way through and out of Bleak's challenging landscape.  Faced with insurmountable obstacles, and armed only with the strength of their desire to find their way out, Willowmena and her friends cross the plain of Bleak in search of redemption.

 

What will happen to such an unlikely band of travelers? Will they manage to escape the miner?  Will they ever return home?

A professional educator, I wrote Willowmena’s Quest because I believe that stories can save us.  Willowmena's Quest offers something very special for its readers, a story that helps each of us to remember that rare friendships, perseverance, and, most of all, hope can be found in the most desolate of places.  It is the story of how one little girl, in the face of tragedy but armed with a pure heart, can redeem us all.

The money from pre-sales will be used to fund the printing and marketing of the book and allow me to enter some national award programs. I would gratefully appreciate your help and support to bring Willowmena's Quest forward by choosing one of the perks on this page, such as a signed, autographed copy, a print of our of our inner illustrations, a reading of the book at your school or other group, or even dinner with the author -- me!

I’d also like to ask a special favor. Would you also assist me by telling others about my campaign, by sharing my campaign link on social media, by following Willowmena's Quest on Facebook, by purchasing additional copies as gifts, and by telling your 200 or so closest friends about Willowmena's Quest and encouraging then to pre-order a signed copy?  Thank you so much for your effort and involvement.  I am deeply grateful for your support.

About the Author: Sandra Rhea is a teacher, a mother, a writer, and an animal lover.  She believes strongly in the power of stories and helping children find their own voices early in life through the written word.  She lives in a sprawling old house in the Houston Heights with her family and a changing number of dogs and cats.  She teaches elementary school in the Houston public school system and conducts private writing workshops for children out of her home.  She has written and published some personal essays over the years.  

Willowmena’s Quest is her first published book.

story:
The book is a glimpse into the ten-year life of my restaurant, bread&cup, a small establishment situated on the corner of 8th & S streets in Lincoln, Nebraska, a downtown area called the Haymarket. In spite of the painful conclusion, the decade we operated the restaurant was filled with unexpected joy and abundant experiences. It was a rich season of time. After much thought and numerous encouragements from friends, I concluded it was important to chronicle these memories and capture the ethos that we all encountered.

bread&cup: beyond simple food and drink will be a beautiful hardcover book featuring more than 140 outstanding photographs by Lincoln photographer Kris Reiswig. The book is approximately 250 pages. It contains 25 of our favorite restaurant recipes for you to recreate and enjoy at home. However, it’s not intended to only be a cookbook.

This is a book about hope.

Hope doesn’t remove hardship or make life’s challenges go away. It doesn’t ensure a pain-free existence. What it does provide is the ability to keep going and forge ahead, despite all these things. Difficulty in life can never be prevented, but hope is there to convince me that I can always start again.

In hope, 

Chef Kevin

story:
Congratulations! We did it!!! Now, let's go beyond our wildest dreams!

Thank you! In just two days, we've met the basic goal of the Community Publishing campaign. We will keep the campaign open so our friends and circles can still buy books for the holidays and support the creation of the next novels in the series. (YAY!!!) Thank you for your support and for being a part of this adventure! It feels GREAT to be a part of such a creative, generous, and visionary community. - Rivera Sun

You can be a part of the community that publishes this heart-warming story for people of all ages!

"The story has all the beauty of the great stories of old: adventure, action, courage, surprises, friendships; but with bold nonviolent action instead of the usual dose of violence."
- Rivera Sun on The Way Between

Everyone loves a good story! In an exciting blend of action, adventure, and fantasy author Rivera Sun boldly takes the genre in a new direction . . . that of waging peace, active nonviolence, and nonviolent movements. Challenging war cultures and military societies, The Way Between brings the skills of resolving conflict, anti-bullying, and ending violence into a coming of age story for a new generation of readers.

"If our children and our communities are to be trained for the world that is emerging, then we must put the tools of peace and active nonviolence in their hands, hearts, minds, dreams, and stories."  - Rivera Sun on The Way Between

Bring this book to people everywhere!

Between flight and fight lies a mysterious third path called the Way Between, and young shepherdess and orphan Ari Ara must master it . . . before war destroys everything she loves! She begins training as the apprentice of the great warrior Shulen, and enters a world of warriors and secrets, swords and magic, friendship and mystery. She uncovers forbidden prophecies, searches for the lost heir to two thrones, and chases the elusive forest-dwelling Fanten to unravel their hidden knowledge. Full of twists and turns and surprises, The Way Between is bound to carve out a niche on bookshelves everywhere!

"The Way Between offers the younger generations - and the older ones - the values of peace and nonviolence, anti-bullying, compassion, inclusion and belonging." - Rivera Sun

You're invited to be one of the people

who publish this book!

Rivera Sun's novels are published by a community of creative visionaries who work together to bring these great stories into the world. Contribute a small or large amount and join the adventure! Get a copy for yourself, a friend, the kids next door, grandkids, the library or local school. Support the writing process for the sequel or the whole series. Bring the book to your book club or pitch in to share the magic and adventure far and wide. Everyone is welcome. All contributions are received with gratitude and enthusiasm!

 

A Message from Rivera Sun

Fun. Fantasy. Action. Adventure. If you're anything like me, you grew up reading great books and imagining yourself swinging swords and chasing orcs. The Way Between takes the joy of an adventure story into a realm where waging peace and nonviolence lead a young heroine into courageous action and exciting escapades.

Are you ready to take action with me? Together, we can bring this book to people everywhere! Writing and sharing this novel is, for me and maybe for you, too, an act of literary intervention in the culture of war and violence. Every time someone reads The Way Between, a mind and heart is liberated from the myth of violence, and empowered by the true skills of active nonviolence! Reading and sharing this story is a powerful form of taking action for a culture of peace and active nonviolence.

If we look around the world today, the most exciting adventures of our times are unfolding in nonviolent movements for change. Our literature needs a 21st century update. We need stories of heroes and heroines engaging the viable, amazing skills of unarmed peacekeeping, restorative justice, conflict resolution, and nonviolent action.

The Way Between weaves these incredible skills into a story of fantasy and fun that will bring the practical and inspiring examples of nonviolence into the hearts, minds, and imaginations of people both young and old.

I hope you will think and act boldly in support of this novel, our children, our friends and families, and the whole world. I think The Way Between will uplift our hearts and inspire our actions. Together, we can send this powerful story everywhere!

Thank you for being a part of this journey!

In gratitude, Rivera Sun

 

You already know you're gonna love it.

Get a copy for yourself as well as for your grandkids. Here are a couple of comments from our all-grown-up, but young-at-heart early readers about The Way Between:

"Thank you so much for this wonderful story! I cried and rejoiced and cried again."

"I love this book and can't wait to see the movie ... and the prequel and the sequel. It reminds me of the work of Madeleine L'Engle in it's pace and action and depth. "

story:
The Legend of the Dragonskinner

Hello, my name is Christopher Goodrum.  I am an actor, writer, composer, and director.  I was born to entertain and I have tried my hands in just about everything from stand-up to theme parks, and from theater to short films.  What I have always been passionate about was writing, from the time I wrote my first talent show skit at 13 years of age.  I love creating characters and developing stories. 

This campaign is created for a short story I wrote in 2009 entitled "The Legend of the Dragonskinner", which is the first of three short stories.  It is a comedic tale about a man and his quest to find Bigfoot, the Loch Ness monster, and dragons.  Ryan Henderson is not the brigthest man in the world or the bravest.  He is hapless, frequently wrong about a great many things, and always a step behind on the coolest trends.  But he stays true to his beliefs in the existence of mythical and legendary creatures in the same way children believe in Santa Claus.  The tale is filled with humor borderline on existentialism, suitable for teen readers, and pop culture references adults may enjoy.

This project was originally a side project for a couple of friends to read and enjoy.  Positive responses had led to encouragement in publishing it.

I am hoping "The Legend of the Dragonskinner" will springboard future works into the publishing world, either by being picked up by a publishing company, or continued self-publication.

And I need your help to make it a reality. 

The Campaign

Set Goal

The campaign goal is set at $1800 which will cover the production of the book as well as necessary costs to acquire copyright registration, and if enough is raised, registration with the Library of Congress.  You may contribute as much as you like, as often as you like.  A $3 contribution is as equally appreciative as a $20 contribution.  Any and all contributions will be released to me 10 days after the conclusion of the campaign period whether I make my goal or not.  However, the fee for Indiegogo services is higher for not making the set goal, so every little bit counts.  Publication of the book should be within 180 days from the time the book is put into production.

Campaign Period and the Perks

The campaign period will run for 45 days.

So...what's in it for you?  I have created some perks for certain contribution amounts.

- A contribution of $10  will get you mentioned on the Acknowledgement page.

- A contribution of $20 will get you a free soft cover copy of the book.

- And the highest contributor of starting from $25 will receive an autographed soft cover copy of the book.  If the goal is met, the perk will be upgraded to a free autographed hard cover copy.

Off to the Races

It is my hope that the goal is met and this campaign paves the way for future publications of "The Dragonskinner Saga" and other works.  Please, spread the word and suggests to family and friends to check out this campaign.

I appreciate your time and consideration.

story:
Short Summary

I have been reading fantasy since before I even knew the word, and I started writing novels of my own at the age of twelve. The wild creative process that produces brand new worlds, races and cultures has always fascinated me, and I adore studying the hidden methods which create beautiful, moving literature. There was never really any doubt that I would study English.

Having completed the more formal Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees, I have finally reached the point where I can start researching something entirely new. I am campaigning to fund my research into the creation of fantasy languages, using linguistic techniques to develop a new set of guidelines for writers.

For J.R.R. Tolkien, Middle Earth was a place to showcase languages he had spent many years developing. However, most of us are not Tolkien, and would rather pour our time into telling our stories than developing entire languages of which the reader might only see a few words. On the other hand, having a few words, names for people or places, or even a few sentences can be enormously helpful in establishing a foreign world or culture. If done well, fantasy languages help immerse the reader in the writer’s new world. Of course, that’s only if they are done well. Mismatched words and overly convoluted spellings can only disrupt reader immersion.

So, how do we get the positive effect without the hundreds of hours of language work? I believe that by studying the phonetic and morphological techniques used by writers of literary nonsense (such as Roald Dahl and Edward Lear), and breaking down the structure of existing successful fantasy languages, I can develop guidelines for authors who are creating their own, making the process of inventing coherent words and phrases much faster.

This linguistic “tool box” would be hugely valuable to fantasy writers for many years to come, but three years of dedicated research do not happen for free, and I need your help to make this happen. Dr Cathy Butler and Dr Jeanette Sakel at the University of the West of England have agreed to supervise the research, but I have to find the funds. Fellow fantasy lovers, this research will benefit all of us. Please help!

What I Need & What You Get

I am attempting to raise £16,000.

This will cover three years of university fees at £4935 per year and the fees for using indiegogo. If the campaign goal is reached the indiegogo fees will be lower, but the difference would allow funding for valuable research trips. I intend to visit Great Missenden to study the Roald Dahl archives, and travel to the Bodleian Library in Oxford if possible to see Tolkien's papers.

Everyone who contributes at least £15 will get a complete digital copy of my thesis when the research is complete, sharing all my findings and guidelines for writers creating languages.

More generous contributors of £50 or more will also receive a physical copy to add to their home library as a reference text, ideal for scribbling in the margins, bookmarking with sticky notes and grabbing for a quick check while writing.

Amazing people who give £100 or more will also receive a personal invitation to a lecture on the creation of fantasy languages, which will be held in Bristol once my research is complete.

Those who go beyond £150 will receive digital and physical copies of the research, as well as a lecture invite, and will also receive a signed, personalised copy of my next fantasy novel as an additional thank you.

If there are any further perks you would like to see here, don't hesitate to let me know. For example, perhaps if someone made a particularly fantastic contribution I could dedicate a book to them.

Even if the goal is not reached, any funds would still be enormously helpful in paying some of the university fees to allow the research to go ahead.

The Impact

Although it is my PhD project, this research is not about me. The linguistic toolbox which I hope to develop would allow every budding fantasy writer to create coherent, etymologically sound languages without dedicating years of their lives to their development.

The research would be especially useful for those attempting fantasy works during NaNoWriMo – given the extremely tight schedule of writing 50,000 words in a month, who could possibly have time to develop languages without these new linguistic tools? With this research, gone will be the dodgy Latin-clones, the sneaky borrowings from Tolkien, the unpronounceable words littered with strange punctuation!

For readers and lovers of fantasy, this can only be a blessing. After all, who doesn’t find it weird and distracting when names and words make no sense in the context? If cousins Bob and T’zaarleth grew up in the same city, surely we shouldn’t struggle to make their names match?

This is not the first time I have completed a large academic research project. My undergraduate dissertation was on “Realism, Mimesis and Social Critique in Modern Fantasy Fiction”. My MA dissertation was “Three Plays and Three Princes: Textual Variation in Shakespeare’s Hamlet.”

I am also no stranger to the process of writing fantasy and building new worlds. Two of my books, The Red Mage and Darkness Visible, are already available on Amazon, and I have written several others. I have three major series in entirely new worlds in progress, so I am intimately familiar with the problems of inventing cultures and languages.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some of you may not be able to contribute financially, but you can still help! Share the campaign with any friends and family who love fantasy. Share it with fellow writers. Shout it from the lofty rooftops of facebook, twitter and tumblr. Anything that gets the word out would be hugely helpful.

Thank you!

Refer to the updates for samples of writings

With Muslim mainstream views that homosexual relations were forbidden, is it possible for Muslim gays who had accepted themselves to be gay to find their partners? Or will it be just another struggle one after the other?

In June this year I had the opportunity to travel to Washington DC and Seattle where I met two Muslims convert; Daiyee Abdullah and Fatima Thompson. They have some radicals ideas about being Muslims and gays. For Daiyee it is possible for Muslim gays to get married. While Fatima appeared apprehensive about getting married again after five failed previous marriages.

When I got back home I did a little bit of a research of my own and found out several people who are living their own version of living as Muslim gays. One include a gay man who used to cross dressed and later married a lesbian! And another was allegedly having a sexless life and finding no man despite being in the cosmopolitan city of London!

Support them to get their stories to be told!

What I Need & What You Get

I'm targetting to raise some USD12,000 for the project. This is to help with the cost to do research and interviews, for my travels to meet sources, for editing the book and for buying me the time to write and to get the book ready in a year's time. If I'm not able to achieve the target I will have to do this part time.

I'm thinking for a contribution of USD20 you will get a note of appreciation from me and a note of recognition as one of the backers for the project.

For a contribution of USD100 you will get a pledge of getting a signed copy of the finished book and a recognition of the amount of your contribution to the project.

For a contribution of USD500 you will get a pledge of getting a signed copy of the finished book and a recognition of the amount of you contribution to the project to the project. In addition the first 5 contributors will get a silver pendant that I have designed.

For a contribution of USD1000, you will get a pledge of getting a signed copy of the finished book and a recognition of the amount of your contribution. In addition, the first to contribute will get a silver pendant made up of three components that I have designed.

The Impact

Your contribution will help to get the stories which otherwise would be swept under the carpet out.

Other Ways You Can Help

We'll if you can't contribute, you are more than welcome to like Desperate Heart facebook page at facebook.com/Ataleofdesperatehearts and to get the word out. Also those interested could model for the project! Thank you guys!

story:
About In God's Hands

Outstanding, my first book! In God's Hand is written and ready for production. This is the first book in a series of children's books that engage and encourage in a fun
familiar way, which sparks conversations about the Word of God.

Have you ever sang a song about being in God's hands? Do you remember how you felt when you said those words? Well in this book, we meet Ms. Teacher in her vibrant Sunday school classroom filled with images of Bible characters and displays of the achievements of her students. With enthusiasm, she shares the comfort and protection that is revealed in Psalm 139:10. 

This book is only the beginning of the lessons and adventures that occur in Ms. Teacher's classroom.  The 3 part series is fast-paced, fun, and meets the child's mind in a place of curiosity and inspiration. Designed for preschoolers to young readers (ages 3 to 8), the Ms. Teacher's Classroom Series will motivate children to seek God's Word and have faith in the knowledge it provides. But, I need your help to print theses adventures, beginning with In God's Hands. 

Ms. Teacher's Classroom Series: 

  1. In God's Hands (A story that reveals God's protection is for everyone.)
  2. Our Father (A story that explores the many roles that God plays in our lives.)
  3. Faith is Not Just My Name (This story introduces a critic to a faith hero in the Bible.)

Your one time donation launches a small dream into a motivational movement for our children in the world wide faith-community.

Why I Need Your Help

"Money is only a tool.  It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver." --Ayn Rand

The production of an eye-catching, fun, and colorful children's book is costly.  I know authors who have published for less then what I have projected as expenses.  But, I am confident in the vision that God has trusted me with for this faith adventure,
In God's Hands.  I prefer to not settle for anything of lower quality.  For the God I serve is the I Am; the work that I exhibit is a representation of His excellence.

I've partnered with the Jenis Group, LLC in Lemon Grove California to produce this first book in a series of three.  Production includes: illustration, cover art, copywriting,
printing, design and layout.  The second phase to this project includes: networking, marketing, and travel.  This upcoming year, my goal is to introduce In God's Hands to California (San Diego and Los Angeles), Oregon, and Texas.

Upcoming Exhibitions: 

  • National Christian Writer's Conference (San Diego, CA)
  • Los Angeles Times: Festival of Books (Los Angeles, CA)
  • Chicks Connect Inspiration Celebration (California/ Arizona Region)
  • Fayette County Fair (La Grange, TX)

Me and This Mission

I am faithful and dedicated servant of the Most High God, wife to one, mother of three, and friend of many.  As an author, writer, and blogger, I aim to nurture and empower children to stand firm on God's Word because the Kingdom of Heaven is theirs. (Matthew 5:10)  For years, I've served diligently  as a parent volunteer, Because  Jesus himself said: "Those who are the greatest among you should take the lowest rank, and the leader should be like a servant." (Luke 22:26)

Mom in Children's Ministry Blog (http://mominchildrensministry.blogspot.com) is for the community of parents, volunteers, and leaders in Children's Ministry who are searching for inspiration, creative ideas for crafts and activities, and reviews for faith
based children's books.  The blog site offers my perspective, of a mother and
servant who does not identify herself as a theologian or certified accredited expert in the field of Christian Education. But, the readers can identify with my desire to teach the Word of God in a fun-filled creative way that encourages the children of the world to know who God is and trust in His promises
and love.

The production of an eye-catching, fun, and colorful children's book is costly.  I know authors who have published for less then what I have projected as expenses.  But, I am confident in the vision that God has trusted me with for this faith adventure,In God's Hands.  I prefer to not settle for anything of lower quality.  For the God I serve is the I Am; the work that I exhibit is a representation of His excellence.
I've partnered with the Jenis Group, LLC in Lemon Grove California to produce this first book in a series of three.  Production includes: illustration, cover art, copywriting,printing, design and layout.  The second phase to this project includes: networking, marketing, and travel.  This upcoming year, my goal is to introduce In God's Hands to California (San Diego and Los Angeles), Oregon, and Texas.
Upcoming Exhibitions: 

National Christian Writer's Conference (San Diego, CA) Los Angeles Times: Festival of Books (Los Angeles, CA) Chicks Connect Inspiration Celebration (California/ Arizona Region) Fayette County Fair (La Grange, TX)

Me and This Mission
I am faithful and dedicated servant of the Most High God, wife to one, mother of three, and friend of many.  As an author, writer, and blogger, I aim to nurture and empower children to stand firm on God's Word because the Kingdom of Heaven is theirs. (Matthew 5:10)  For years, I've served diligently  as a parent volunteer, Because  Jesus himself said: "Those who are the greatest among you should take the lowest rank, and the leader should be like a servant." (Luke 22:26)
Mom in Children's Ministry Blog (http://mominchildrensministry.blogspot.com) is for the community of parents, volunteers, and leaders in Children's Ministry who are searching for inspiration, creative ideas for crafts and activities, and reviews for faithbased children's books.  The blog site offers my perspective, of a mother and servant who does not identify herself as a theologian or certified accredited expert in the field of Christian Education. But, the readers can identify with my desire to teach the Word of God in a fun-filled creative way that encourages the children of the world to know who God is and trust in His promisesand love.

story:
Hello everyone! The beautiful oranges and reds of the fall leaves have fallen and are now blanketing my home state; Minnesota! It's an indicator to me that it's time to migrate south for a warmer climate. I'm thinking about all the beautiful times I've had on the road and sharing it with everyone.

 

As most of you know I wrote an ebook with tips and tricks for living full time on the road. I've gotten a whole bunch of positive reviews on it, and those who have read it find it very helpful! Now I want to write the all around go to book for full time RVing! Which will be much more in depth, all the little things people can easily look past. Or things they may not have even thought of! I have many years of experience writing as I've written two novels and the ebook I mentioned. I also have a lot of experience traveling which has taught me a lot and I have so much to share!

 

I spent the summer getting the cabin ready for my grandfather and taking care of him, taking care of my dogs injuries and also creating videos to share on YouTube. Which was a necessary labor of love. Well, everything is set for a cozy winter for him here and my uncle will be taking care of him when I leave. So I want to get back on the road now and do some more research for this giant project I want to work on! The all around go to book for full time RVing and Vandwelling!

As most of you know I live in the middle of nowhere so there is no work around here. Once you deplete your funds here you're basically stuck! If I can just get back on the road I will be able to find work which will keep me going permanently. I just need the jumpstart! Got some jumper-cables? 

 The money will go towards repairing some things on my RV (van), gas for travel and research, also life costs while writing and workamping. If you can help with this campaign please do! Anyone who contributes $100 or more I will put their name or company in the book as a contributor.

 If I do not get all the funds I will use what I did get for the same thing. I have more perks for people whom contribute! Be part of something BIG! This book and the audiobook are going to be huge! So let's make this happen! Thanks everyone!

story:
About the author and this project!

Hello! I am Julia Barcalow, the proud author of That's Not My Momma's Milk!  

When my daughter was born a little over a year ago, we embarked on two major journeys together: exclusively breastfeeding and becoming vegan. My husband and I agreed that this was the best path for our family, and the more I researched and experienced life with my little one, the more motivated I became to write a book for children her age that supported and normalized the beauty of breastfeeding and the compassion of living a vegan life. 

When my daughter was born, it strengthened my veganism because it helped affirm the connection that all animals have with their babies. It truly hit home more than ever how the animal use industries separate moms from their babies without any thought, for the consumption and use of animal products.   

 

As an educator for over 15 years, a mother, natural parenting blogger, and vegan, I know that teaching our children kindness towards all starts on day one. This book shows the life-giving bond between mother and child through simple phrases and beautiful illustrations, created by the amazing Kayleigh Castle, that introduce the reader to different animals who are nursing their young.  

Your contribution to this campaign will help make our book a reality, and bring another important learning tool into the hands of the next generation of vegan parents.

Where does my money go?

Our goal is to raise $6,000 to complete this project. Your contribution will go directly to completing, printing, and distributing this book. For your contribution, you will receive a gift from us ranging from a post card to a personalized illustration of you and your child. You will also receive our deepest thanks and appreciation for making the book happen! Without your support, this book won't make it into the hands of parents who can use it.

Campaign Perks

We have a variety of perks that you can purchase in order to support this campaign. You can purchase a signed copy of the book, an eBook, or an activity packet that includes stickers and a downloadable coloring book. Our perks also include a tee shirt and a matching onesie, or a limited addition illustration print from the book. Also, you can receive an original personalized print of you and your child created by the illustrator, Kayleigh Castle.

Matching Tee Shirt & Onesie

Get the eBook!

  

Coloring Book

Stickers

 

Receive a personalized illustration of you and your little one!

 

 

What makes this book important?

For our non-human animal friends, many of them, especially cows on dairy farms, have their young taken away from them within hours after their birth. On dairy farms, milk from non-human animals is viewed as a commodity for human consumption, and their babies are often not permitted to do the most natural thing, nurse from their mothers. Non-human animals bond with their young just as humans do, and their bodies are made to feed and sustain their babies, just as humans are. This book is meant to show that bond and to remind us that when it comes to non-human animals, That's Not My Momma's Milk!

  

The World Health Organization (WHO) and The American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) recommend that babies be exclusively breastfeed from birth to six months, if possible. WHO recommends that breastfeeding should continue until a child is two years or older, while AAP recommends breastfeeding until the age of one. Despite these recommendations, in the United States, for example, the average length of breastfeeding is only three months. There is a desperate need in our society to normalize and support breastfeeding so that children can benefit from the many health benefits that breast milk has to offer.  

                        

Other ways you can help!

Financial contributions are a key part to making this book a reality, but getting our message out to as many people as possible is also vital. Sharing, posting, and talking about this campaign with your family, friends, and anyone you know will help this project reach its goal and get more support for our message. 

When will I get my book?

Books will be delivered within two months after the campaign ends!

story:
My Goal:

I am on a mission to raise $5,000 to cover production/editing for my upcoming coffee table book One Million Strong: Photos from the Million Man, World Day of Atonement, Million Women, Million Youth, Million Youth Movement, Million Family, and Millions More Movement Marches.

Perks for this campaign include prints on artist-grade metal, 2014 calendars, a downloadable e-book, & an autographed coffee table book featuring more than 300 images from the marches.

Both Deborah Willis (renowned photo curator, Macarthur Fellow and Chair of the New York University Photography Department) and Jamel Shabazz (internationally acclaimed documentary photographer) have agreed to mentor me re: the book and the touring exhibit (detailed below).

Later this year, I will hand-design and self-publish a special edition of the coffee table book and an e-book to accompany the touring exhibit.

Your donations will be used to cover design, editing, and production costs. Any money raised in excess of the funding goal will be used for copy editing and additional production days on creating the coffee table book and the e-book.

If you donated to the previous campaign for the exhibit launch and would like to donate again, please know that the featured images for all the perks in this campaign are different than the last, so even if you donate at the same level, you'll get 2 distinct gifts in return.

About the One Million Strong Coffee Table Book:

The One Million Strong Photo Book (Fall 2013) features more than 300 images from the seven marches. The book also offers essays from noteworthy thought leaders, organizers, clergy, and artists. The text explores African American roots in social protest and the ways in which our forms of resistence have evolved over the years:

  • From quilts that contained hidden messages about escape plans to coded language and spirituals that described paths to freedom,
  • From civil disobedience to policing the police,
  • From slave revolts to self-defense,
  • From massive social protest to local political organizing,
  • From using our churches and mosques as meeting places for civil rights organizing to megachurches that have actively abandoned social justice issues,
  • From being the objectified subjects of traditional media to becoming the content producers of our own digital meda campaigns that advance authentic images of Black life as well as our political concerns.

About the One Million Strong Exhibit:

The One Million Strong Traveling Photo Exhibit captures the essence of the Million Man March (Washington, D.C.) and the 10 years of subsequent political/cultural gatherings it inspired: The World Day of Atonement in New York City (1996); The Million Women March in Philadelphia (1997); The Million Youth March in Harlem (1998); The Million Youth Movement in Atlanta (1998); The Million Family March in Washington, DC. (2000); and the Millions More Movement March in Washington, DC (2005).

The One Million Strong Exhibit consists of one hundred 16" x 20" photos, as well as essay text and video, and caters to community and educational groups. This the first full-showing of the collected work and it will become a traveling exhibit, available to colleges, community centers, and museums.

Installations of this work have previously been shown at the North Carolina Museum of History (Raleigh, NC), the International Center & Civil Rights Museum (Greensboro, NC), Delta Fine Arts Center (Winston-Salem, NC), and Lucy Florence Coffee House (Los Angeles, CA).

You may view images here: http://www.facebook.com/onemillionstrong.

One Million Strong is being used to:

• Celebrate and affirm images of Black people who have engaged in political protest for the betterment of their families and communities.

• Foster critical dialogue about the diversity of political perspectives that exist in Black communities and develop methods to work across our differences.

• Inspire participants (youth in particular) to document their communities.

• Engage, activate, and organize participants around pressing issues that continue to threaten the health of our families like the prison industrial complex, youth violence, housing, education, and unemployment. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

• Get your friends & family to donate.

• Like One Million Strong on Facebook.

• Tweet about One Million Strong. Direct your Tweets @KatinaParker.

• Host a discussion, exhibit or presentation (for community, academic, and museum spaces only) by emailing katina@onemillionstrong.com.

• Book Katina Parker to speak about One Million Strong at your school, church, or museum by emailing katina@onemillionstrong.com.

story:
Living With the Dead is a zombie apocalypse tale by Joshua Guess (that's me!). The story itself is a blog (which can be found at Livingwiththedead.net) and is a fully-realized fictional world with a story told in real time. LWtD began in March of 2010 and continues today. 

The blog itself is collected into eBooks and sold on the Kindle store. The format generates some love, some hate, but tells the bones of the story as I want to tell it; survival day-by-day in a world overrun with the undead. 

Victim Zero is to be the first in a series of actual novels set in the LWtD universe. This volume will explore the origin of the zombie plague and give background on the world itself. There will be no lack of action, betrayal, death and survival. 

While the collected editions of the blog and this book (and its sequels) will each stand alone (that is, you won't need to read both series to understand what is happening in either one), they will be woven together in some key ways. Characters in one series will appear in the other, for example. While each series can be read and enjoyed alone, together they will create a complex tapestry depicting an entire world at war with the dead.

To make that happen I have to give this project the time it deserves. For that, I need your help.

This project is being run through flexible funding. That means that even if we don't hit the $5,000 goal, I will still get your contribution and you will still get your perk. The only difference is that if we don't reach the goal I'll have to pay a higher fee when processing the money. 

As to where the money goes, well...

I will be making this novel into a print book. Some of the money will go to a cover artist, some to a layout person to arrange the book, some to an excellent editor or two, and a good chunk will go toward the costs of fulfilling the perks. Whatever is left over will help pay the bills while I write this thing. 

Here is a list of the perks. This list may expand if there is call to do so, and it WILL expand if we manage to get past the goal. Then we I will add stuff to every level of perks, and if the system will allow I'll even add new perks. Once past the $5,000 point I will begin announcing stretch goals to give each backer more bang for their buck.

Perks:


$5-eBook Version

This perk nets you the eBook version of Victim Zero and your name in the front matter of the book. Every backer (unless they choose not to) will be credited in the book itself. At least, the electronic version. If fifty thousand people back the project I would A) have a heart attack of joy and B) not be able to realistically put that many names in a printed form.

$10-eBook Plus Short Story

Exactly what it says. You'll get the eBook version as well as an original short story set in the LWtD universe that will be exclusive to this campaign. Each digital copy will be sent in a variety of electronic formats to fit whatever ereader or program you use. 

$25-eBook, Short Story, Print edition

This perk is self-explanatory. You get all of the above plus a print copy of the book. It will cost me money to have the book printed, so please add $5 for shipping. However! You may select this perk and add additional amounts for extra copies of the book without paying additional shipping. Add $8 per extra copy you would like to order. Oh, and you'll also get a nifty LWtD bookmark and bumber sticker, design to be revealed.

$50-Personalized Autograph

With this perk you get the eBook, short story, 2 (TWO) copies of the print edition as well as two bumber stickers and bookmarks. Shipping is included with this perk unless you choose to order additional copies, in which case add $8 per copy above the first two. I will autograph and inscribe each book however you like (you can tell me how in the survey email at the end of the campaign). 

$75-Beta Read

This perk is identical to the $50 perk in all ways but one: you get to be a beta reader for Victim Zero. This is a chance for you to become a part of the process, read the book before its release, and make your mark on my world and characters. 

$100-Fictional You

Identical to the $75 beta read perk, but you also get to name a character in the final book. This one is limited, but the name can be yours or one you make up. You get to choose gender and characteristics. The names have to be realistic, so if you choose "Donkey McGingersnack" I will veto that for something more reasonable.

-$500-Your Own Story

For $500 I will write a novella about you in the LWtD universe. You get all the perks up to the beta read (and obviously a character you name will be in this story). This novella will be created between the two of us and when I'm finished it will be your story. You will own the rights to it and be able to do with it whatever you please. Want to publish it yourself under your name? Cool. Want me to publish it and give the proceeds to charity? Fine and dandy. Whatever you want to do, we'll do. 

 

I've been broke and living paycheck to paycheck. Hell, I still work a full-time job to keep the lights on. I understand if you want to help but don't have five bucks to spare. If that's the case, don't start digging into the change jar on my account. Instead you can spread the word on your social networks and in real life. Point people to this campaign and share the links for all you can. I'm just happy you've read this far, to be honest. I wrote this whole thing and even I'm a little tired of it. You're a trooper, and your support means the world to me. 

That being said, by all means back the project with money if you can afford it. If you're feeling super-generous you can actually back the project with a larger amount than your perk requires or even put money in the pot without requesting a perk. I do that sometimes for campaigns I really like, but I'm of course happy to have you get rewards for your hard-earned benjamins.

Your call. 

 

Joshua Guess (that's me again! Third person is hilarious.) is an independent author living in Frankfort, Kentucky. Writing is a part-time job and a full-time passion for him. He enjoys donating to charities, singing badly, and telling lies for money.

This perk is identical to the $50 perk in all ways but one: you get to be a beta reader for Victim Zero. This is a chance for you to become a part of the process, read the book before its release, and make your mark on my world and characters. 
$100-Fictional You
Identical to the $75 beta read perk, but you also get to name a character in the final book. This one is limited, but the name can be yours or one you make up. You get to choose gender and characteristics. The names have to be realistic, so if you choose "Donkey McGingersnack" I will veto that for something more reasonable.
-$500-Your Own Story
For $500 I will write a novella about you in the LWtD universe. You get all the perks up to the beta read (and obviously a character you name will be in this story). This novella will be created between the two of us and when I'm finished it will be your story. You will own the rights to it and be able to do with it whatever you please. Want to publish it yourself under your name? Cool. Want me to publish it and give the proceeds to charity? Fine and dandy. Whatever you want to do, we'll do. 
 



I've been broke and living paycheck to paycheck. Hell, I still work a full-time job to keep the lights on. I understand if you want to help but don't have five bucks to spare. If that's the case, don't start digging into the change jar on my account. Instead you can spread the word on your social networks and in real life. Point people to this campaign and share the links for all you can. I'm just happy you've read this far, to be honest. I wrote this whole thing and even I'm a little tired of it. You're a trooper, and your support means the world to me. 
That being said, by all means back the project with money if you can afford it. If you're feeling super-generous you can actually back the project with a larger amount than your perk requires or even put money in the pot without requesting a perk. I do that sometimes for campaigns I really like, but I'm of course happy to have you get rewards for your hard-earned benjamins.
Your call. 
 

Joshua Guess (that's me again! Third person is hilarious.) is an independent author living in Frankfort, Kentucky. Writing is a part-time job and a full-time passion for him. He enjoys donating to charities, singing badly, and telling lies for money.

story:
THE COMPANY BODY

 

PROJECT

 

An ORGANIZATIONAL MODEL & WORK DESIGN based on the Human Body's principles showing the Interactions to Best Performance in Organizations.

The Book will also include a series of charts showing the different interactions based on the principles of Coordination, Connection, Collaboration in a Company Body Model. 

 

HOW COULD A COMPANY BODY BE IF IT REPLICATED A HUMAN BODY'S SYSTEMIC PRINCIPLES & COORDINATION?


LEVERAGE ON PARTS - VALUE TO THE WHOLE

  • What is one of the most complex organized systems in nature? We all know that: the Human Body! And its working principles?

Coordination: the process where a human body’s neurons and limbs work together to produce movement and also balance and reaction. It is a highly complicated process that most people do effortlessly, like tying their own shoes. On the contrary, it is a highly complicated process that most organizations do with a big effort. 

Connection: a human body is made of many cells, organized into sheets of tissue, then in structures called organs composing the organ systems. And each system in the Body serves to assist other systems for the good of the organism. Likewise organizations are formed by people, gathered in layers of expertise, organized in structures called units or divisions or whatsoever composing what we call a structured Company. And each department in the company should serve to assist other departments for the good of the organization.

Collaboration: how many hearts or livers does a human body need to work better? Or can you imagine the scenario if heart and lungs didn't collaborate? 



 

Thanks so much! 

Alma

story:
Send Writer Ash Blankenship to California!

I'm a writer and author who’s work has appeared on the Urban Times, Tiny Buddha, Medium and other sites. I've also published two books, An Introvert’s Way and Writing Beautifully.  

I am planning my next writing adventure in California! I've always dreamed of driving the Pacific Coast Highway from San Francisco to Los Angeles. In doing so, I plan to write about the trip, what it's like traveling alone and how we can learn from our solo adventures.

Part travel essay, part memoir, the book will be unlike any other. How does traveling influence our lives? What can we take away from traveling alone? These questions and others will be sought as I explore unknown territories and seek to find the answers to these questions. 

There's beauty in traveling alone. It's something mystical and freeing. 

My plans include making stops along the way at many landmarks, parks and beaches. I've never seen the West Coast. Actually, I've never been farther west than Alabama, so this will be an eye-opening experience for me. 

Help me get there by supporting my campaign. There's no doubt that this will be a wonderful experience and I will write about my emotions, challenges and experiences in the book that is the purpose of this journey. 


What the Money Goes Toward

The cost of travel including airfare, hotel and rental car is $1,500.

Expenses break down like this:

  • Round trip airfare: $450
  • Rental car for 2 to 3 days: $400
  • Vehicle gas for 2 to 3 days: $100 
  • Hotel for 5 nights: $550 
The biggest expense is certainly the hotel stays. This include two nights in San Francisco (where my trip will begin), one night in central California (a rest night along the 470-mile journey) and two nights in Los Angeles. I am currently in discussion with friends who may offer me a place to stay for a few nights during my journey. 


If I don't reach my entire goal, I will still use the funds toward my trip. Paying for the entire trip would be a stretch for me, so by helping to fund this project, you are offering a chance for me to pursue this journey and to share it with others through a book. 


Please share this project with your friends and help spread the word about this important and life-changing journey that everyone will be able to experience through my book! 

When the Trip Will Take Place

This campaign will run for 42 days, which means it will end June 15. I will book my trip shortly after that and plan to actually take the trip in either mid-August or early September.

When to Expect the Book Release

The book will be partially written during the trip and complete following the trip. Supporters can expect to see the book released around November 2014. 

How the Book Will Be Sold

The book will be sold through Amazon on the Kindle platform. This is a technique that has proven results. I already have two Kindle books published on Amazon. I already have a growing email newsletter list, which allows me direct access to my supporters. To stay updated on the outcome of the trip and the book, I recommend that you sign up for my email newsletter.
