story:
The Opportunity

Support the BESTSELLER OR BUST campaign and help eloves me, eloves me not become a self-published bestseller. Together, we can make publishing history by being the example that proves there’s a new publishing option available to self published authors that involves crowdfunding.

 

Campaign Goal

To raise a $100K marketing budget to globally promote the self-published novel, eloves me, eloves me not, and take it to the bestseller list, proving that crowdfunding plus self-publishing can equal a bestseller. This will show authors everywhere that there is a viable option that exists between going the traditional publishing route and going it alone. This third option can make publishing history while demonstrating that crowdfunding not only works, it works in publishing.

 

The Author’s Conundrum

Those of us who write books want them to be read and enjoyed. Once a book is written, authors have two options for sharing their work - find a publisher or self publish. There are pros and cons to each, but the reality is that less than 5% of submitted manuscripts ever get published and that number is even less for new authors. 

While most authors would love to get a publishing deal, in the rare case they do, it too often means sacrifice, compromise and inequitable royalty arrangements. So many authors are turning to self-publishing.

With self-publishing, the responsibility for writing, editing, cover, design and the financial burden of all publishing, marketing, and promotion for the book is the sole responsibility of the author. It can easily exceed $10K. While authors may earn more per unit on their books publishing this way, the total number of books sold rarely rivals that of their traditionally published counterparts. In fiction best-sellers are rarely self-published.

 

The Solution

I want to create another option that is achieves the best of both worlds. We need an alternative where it’s the market, and not a just a few big publishers, that decides what gets read and what doesn’t.

This third option combines self-published and crowd funded. Once a book is published, the author then turns to investors/supporters who believe in the book to provide the financial backing required to adequately launch and promote it.

Help me to set an example that I will then share with indie authors around the globe showing that success in fiction outside the traditional publishing industry is possible. It just requires new ways of thinking, new tools, and the support of people, like you, who see the possibilities.

 

How?  

To do this requires a work of fiction to set the example and the funds to internationally promote it.  My new novel ‘eloves me, eloves me not’ is up for the challenge, are you?

I’m not asking you for the $5 - $10K to fund the writing, editing, cover design, web and social media development, launch, or distribution of the book. I’ve already done all that.

What’s I need now is a $100K marketing budget to promote the book globally.

If you support this campaign, you will help make publishing history by supporting the power of the indie author to achieve recognition that until now has been the bastion of the big publishers, you’ll help this author achieve a lifelong dream, and, you’ll also get some pretty awesome perks, like bookmarks, autographed copies of ‘eloves me, eloves me not’, author interviews, social media shout outs, the chance to name a character in an upcoming work or have the author write you an online dating profile. You’ll give singles and readers around the world some well-needed laughs ‘cause this book is funny! And, if I meet my target sales goal, I’ll refund your initial investment and keep your original perks!

 

Why me?

I traded a 20-year career in corporate marketing and communications career for the fresh challenge of indie author/publisher/entrepreneur so let’s just say I’m motivated to make this work!

 

I’m an advocate for innovation, technology, the power of community, and I am a staunch supporter of the crowdsourcing movement. I successfully used crowdsourcing through a number of stages of the book’s development so, it makes sense to embrace crowd funding as well.

My dream is to have eloves me, eloves me not make the NYT Bestseller List, and to affect change in the publishing industry. I want to prove that we’ve finally reached a time when independent fiction authors can reach the pinnacle of publishing success and land themselves on the NYT bestseller list, without going the traditional publishing route. 

 

Why this book?

 

eloves me, eloves me not is a contemporary romantic comedy about the modern quest for love. It follows singleton Kayte Wexford’s online and offline adventures, as she turns to online dating to find Mr Right. Does she find him? I can tell you this much, she certainly has fun trying!

Readers love ‘eloves me, eloves me not’ giving it four and five start reviews. They’re saying it’s a timely coming-of-age story, that it’s witty, relatable, detailed and well written. You can find reader reviews here: http://lajohannesson.com/eloves-me-eloves-me-not/reader-reviews/

This book has global resonance and needs to be promoted to a larger audience. When readers worldwide have the chance to enjoy it, it can then achieve the commercial success it deserves.

The market potential for a novel about online dating is mammoth. Statistics from the US alone indicate that 40 million people have visited online dating sites. 40 million! If just .25 per cent of them were to buy this book, this would meet this year’s target sales goal. That’s less than one per cent and that represents the US alone! Have I mentioned that the book is for sale in at least 10 countries?

 

What I Need & What You Get

A marketing budget of $100K is required to fund this vital promotional stage.

Yes, it’s a sizable amount of money, but it is also a sizable goal that is capable of realising sizable returns!

This money will be used to globally promote the independently authored and published novel, ‘eloves me, eloves me not’ so that it can make it to The New York Times bestseller list, proving the commercial potential of the indie fiction author of today.

If you help, and I hope that you do, you will receive the perks as outlined here by investment level. They will be delivered to investors by 01 July 2013, with the exception of the speaking and in-person appearances. These will need to be scheduled in advance and delivered throughout the balance of the 2013 calendar year.

Being a romance author, I’m expected to provide you the happily ever after.

SO… HERE’S THE CLINCHER!

If the funds raised lead to the realisation of a sales target of 100,000 copies buy the end of 2013, I WILL REFUND YOUR INITIAL INVESTMENT AMOUNT AND YOU’LL GET TO KEEP YOUR ORIGINAL CAMPAIGN PERKS.

Plus, I will make a $5,000 donation to my pet charity, Golden Retriever Rescue. 

Plus, I will create a best practice case study based on my experiences and share it freely with the independent author community.

How’s that for a happy ending?

In the event that I do not raise the whole $100K, (but that’s not going to happen, right?) I will divide whatever funds are raised in a similar ratio to what is outlned.  Here's a basic breakout as to how the funds will be spent.

$100K MARKETING BUDGET DISTRIBUTION

$

Component

Duration

$12K

Indiegogo campaign perks and fees

May - July

$15K

Services of a professional publicist/development of PR plan

May - September

$28K

Integrated Advertising/PR Plan implementation in four countries:

  1. USA
  2. Canada
  3. UK
  4. Australia

Focus on two key target groups:

  1. Fiction reader community
  2. Online dating community

May - December

30K

Author Appearances, Book Tours, and related travel expenses

May - November

$8K

Book giveaways, contests, printing, promotional materials and related expenses

May - December

$7K

Development, refinement and management of author/book digital presence – website, social media, videos, events,

May - December

$100K

 

 

 

The Impact

We both know this project isn’t going to create world peace. But it can make a difference.

It can help to drive needed change within the publishing industry. It can provide hope, inspiration and a shining example for independent authors around the globe.

It can help raise the awareness of the ‘business of creativity’ and it gives you a chance to demonstrate that crowd funding offers a viable alternative to more traditional approaches.  And your support can help this dedicated indie author to earn a living doing what she loves and to realise a dream – one she is already so deeply vested in.

And you will have done your part to bring a great story to bibliophiles and singletons everywhere, by introducing them to ‘eloves me, eloves me not’ – it’s sure to deliver a few hours of reading enjoyment, some insight into online dating and heaps of laughs! 

And, if things work out as I hope they will (sales of 100,000 copies within 2013), not only will you get some fabulous perks, a great feeling from supporting a worthy initiative, but you will also get your initial investment back. How many campaigns offer you that?

And, a case study, with step by step actions, tips and suggestions will be shared with other indie authors to help them to achieve similar success. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Some people want to help but can’t contribute financially, and that’s okay. There are other ways you can help. You can:

  • share the link for this campaign with your network – friends, families, co-workers
  • connect and share the links for the book through social media - follow us, friend us, link to us, blog us, like us, share us, circle us, tweet us, pin us… you get the idea (see all the links below)
  • tell anyone you know who’s online dating about the book – trust me, they’ll relate
  • say a prayer, if that’s your thing
  • send positive thoughts out into the universe
  • discuss the campaign, the crowd funding movement, the book, the changes in the publishing industry, the challenge of the indie author
  • consider an indie book, the next time you’re looking for a good read.

 

Thank You!

Thank you for considering supporting my dream.

What are your dreams?

We all have them. To everyone reading, I’m sending you my sincerest wishes toward achieving yours!

For those of you who have chosen to help me in achieving mine, I offer you my sincerest thanks and gratitude. I’ll make you proud!

Support the BESTSELLER OR BUST campaign and help eloves me, eloves me not become a self-published bestseller. Together, we can make publishing history by being the example that proves there’s a new publishing option available to self published authors that involves crowdfunding.
 
Campaign Goal
To raise a $100K marketing budget to globally promote the self-published novel, eloves me, eloves me not, and take it to the bestseller list, proving that crowdfunding plus self-publishing can equal a bestseller. This will show authors everywhere that there is a viable option that exists between going the traditional publishing route and going it alone. This third option can make publishing history while demonstrating that crowdfunding not only works, it works in publishing.
 
The Author’s Conundrum
Those of us who write books want them to be read and enjoyed. Once a book is written, authors have two options for sharing their work - find a publisher or self publish. There are pros and cons to each, but the reality is that less than 5% of submitted manuscripts ever get published and that number is even less for new authors. 
While most authors would love to get a publishing deal, in the rare case they do, it too often means sacrifice, compromise and inequitable royalty arrangements. So many authors are turning to self-publishing.
With self-publishing, the responsibility for writing, editing, cover, design and the financial burden of all publishing, marketing, and promotion for the book is the sole responsibility of the author. It can easily exceed $10K. While authors may earn more per unit on their books publishing this way, the total number of books sold rarely rivals that of their traditionally published counterparts. In fiction best-sellers are rarely self-published.
 
The Solution
I want to create another option that is achieves the best of both worlds. We need an alternative where it’s the market, and not a just a few big publishers, that decides what gets read and what doesn’t.
This third option combines self-published and crowd funded. Once a book is published, the author then turns to investors/supporters who believe in the book to provide the financial backing required to adequately launch and promote it.
Help me to set an example that I will then share with indie authors around the globe showing that success in fiction outside the traditional publishing industry is possible. It just requires new ways of thinking, new tools, and the support of people, like you, who see the possibilities.

To do this requires a work of fiction to set the example and the funds to internationally promote it.  My new novel ‘eloves me, eloves me not’ is up for the challenge, are you?

story:
Help us reach our new goal of $5,000!

Thanks to all of our fantastic supporters who helped us reach our initial goal of $2,000! Meeting that goal means that we will be able to purchase the tools we need to help our volunteers become the most effective advocates possible! 


Our new goal of $5,000 will provide a modest stipend to our full-time organizer to organize press events, create a team of effective public advocates, and film/produce a series of interviews with supporters from around the state!

Marijuana prohibition has failed

It's time for a new approach

For the past five years I've been working to reform the drug laws in the Rhode Island. Believing that no one should be treated as a criminal for using marijuana, I have been a tireless advocate for the medical marijuana program in our state, and in 2012 I helped lead the student movement to decriminalize possession of small amounts of marijuana. Now my eyes are set on an even larger goal: ending marijuana prohibition in the Ocean State. 

Treating marijuana use, sale, and cultivation as crimes has proven to be one of the most destructive and wasteful government policies of the last century. Regulate Rhode Island represents a broad coalition of advocates who believe it's time for a new approach. We seek to implement a responsible regulatory model for marijuana with a system of licenses, taxes, and age restrictions. 

With the success of Colorado and Washington and growing public support nationwide, our chances of winning have never been better. But we need your help. Please consider making a donation today.

Our plan to win

Unlike Colorado and Washington, we have to end marijuana prohibition through the state legislature in Rhode Island. The Marijuana Control, Regulation, and Taxation Act is our bill this year, sponsored by allies Representative Edith Ajello in the House and Senator Josh Miller in the Senate. Rallying public support and putting political pressure on legislators will be the key to winning. That means activating constituents in key legislative districts and directing them to contact their legislators and express their support. 

Your donation will help our volunteers become more effective advocates. We plan to use the funds to 1) purchase targeted voters lists for phone banking, 2) expand the functionality of our website, and 3) develop a printing budget to purchase signs and flyers. Regulate Rhode Island is an entirely grassroots campaign, with support coming only from citizen advocates like you. That's why every dollar counts, and even a small donation goes a long way. 

The Impact

Ending marijuana prohibition in Rhode Island represents a critical step towards ending the failed war on drugs in our state. Legalizing and regulating marijuana would allow law enforcement officers to focus more on serious crime; it would end an unfair form of discrimination against poor communities and people of color; and it would take control of the marijuana market away from illegal drug cartels and put it in the hands of the citizens. By regulating and taxing marijuana we can improve public health and safety while also providing a much needed boost to Rhode Island's economy. 

A victory in Rhode Island would also have significance beyond our borders. Adding another state to the list would send a strong message that our movement is growing nationwide, and it would bolster the evolving international conversation about our marijuana laws. By becoming the first state on the East Coast to legalize and regulate marijuana, Rhode Island would inspire its neighbors to take the next step, too. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t support the campaign. Here's what you can do to help Regulate Rhode Island without making a donation. 

  • Promote Regulate Rhode Island on social media. Share this campaign with your friends and family. Like our page on Facebook (www.facebook.com/RegulateRI) and follow us on Twitter @RegulateRI. 
  • Become a volunteer and participate in phonebanks and canvassing events. You can sign up by visiting www.RegulateRI.com. 
  • Write a letter to the editor in your local newspaper, a blog post on your site, or simply start a conversation on your social media page. Tell people about Regulate Rhode Island and encourage them to sign up for email updates and action alerts. 

The bottom line is that we need your help to win. This is Rhode Island's year! Please consider supporting us today.

story:
From Tupperware Lady to CEO

Short Summary:

Who's the ULTIMATE business partner?  The one who's always there by your side?  God, of course!  In this wonderful new book - Is God's Hand On Your Business? - CEO and author Kathy Hill describes her 20 years of "watching God's hand hover over" her business growth and development - guiding her from humble beginnings to great entrepreneurial success.  You'll be fascinated by her story - from her humble beginning selling Tupperware in her 20's - through her founding of the prominent tax representation company, Tax Tiger, which helps taxpayers resolve their liabilities to the IRS.

Author Biography:

Kathy Hill grew up as a pastor's kid spending time in both, Colorado and California.  She worked her way through business as a successful home-based Tupperware lady, to the CEO and founder of a national tax representation company, Tax Tiger, and along the way she inspired, motivated, and produced incredible results.  Her story is balanced with her unwavering faith in God, and what HIS place should be in your growing business and personal life.  Trial after trial, success after success, nothing seemed to stand in the way of a business backed by God, nor would it stop that train from moving forward.  After reading this book, you will most certainly envision a new outlook on your business today, and what the future should hold.  Kathy utilizes these same principles in leading church small groups and women's prison ministries.

Some of the most successful CEO's and companies alike, are headed by individuals with a strong and unwavering faith, morals, ethics, and care for others.  This book will take you on her journey and inspire you.


"For I know the plans I have for you declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you; plans to give you hope and a future." - NIV Jeremiah 29:11

Message from the Author:

I titled the book - Is God's Hand On Your Business? - because I have had the incredible experience over the past 20 years of my life to watch how God's hand hovers over my business growth and development.

It started when I became a Tupperware lady in my early 20's to earn some extra income for my family, and I found that God had given me skills that I didn't know I had.  Over the years, He led me through many new, and sometimes difficult business arenas, but all of them were for a reason and part of the grand plan that He had for my life.

Ultimately, I founded my own company Tax Tiger, a tax representation company established to help aid taxpayers with difficult tax situations and liabilities, who are left with nowhere to turn.

Is God's Hand On Your Business? - is not only my collection of stories  of God's favor and my unwavering faith, but also 15 key principles that I believe caused God's hand to hover over my endeavors.  These same principles can be applied to any business for greater financial and spiritual growth, and God has placed it on my heart to share them with both, successful and struggling business owners, so that they may soar like eagles.

"May the favor of the Lord our God rest upon us; establish the work of our hands for us - yes, establish the work of our hands." - NIV Psalm 90:17

Why I wrote this book:

This book comes from the encouragement and prodding of so many people who have heard my amazing story and told me to put it down on paper.  I've never quite had the time to tackle such a large project until last year when I was encouraged once again by a dear friend, and it was in that moment that God clearly said to me, "Yes, you need to do this."  At that moment, writing the book became more about the people I could help by sharing my story, than about the time sacrifice it would take to develop it.

I reflected on the things that I do on a regular basis, day in and day out, which would cause God's hand to be on my business, and what I found were 15 Essential Principles for Success and Prosperity.  I am 100% certain that God is going to use this book in a mighty and powerful way for struggling businesses to promote a turn around in today's tough economy, and for already successful businesses to prosper further.

This became another "burning bush" moment for me, and clearly outside of my comfort zone, but then again, God has been doing things with me for years that pushed me outside of my comfort zone, and because I was obedient, He has blessed me each and every time.

My company, Tax Tiger, just celebrated its 11 year anniversary, and over those 11 years we have helped thousands of taxpayers resolve their tax liabilities with the IRS.  The financial burdens they carried were lifted off of their shoulders, erasing fear, stress, and sleepless nights.  We have even literally saved lives, giving back hope and peace of mind with exceptional results. 

Here are a few words from someone essential in helping me start my business:

"I joined forces with Kathy in 2002 to aid her in starting Tax Tiger.  There were constant challenges and we had our share of bumps and bruises along the way, but we were determined, and you never have met a more tenacious person with unshakable faith than Kathy Hill.  On one particular occasion, Kathy had let me know of a specific direction she wanted to take the business.  I was thinking to myself how she was nuts to think we could make that plan work.  Doing my best to be supportive though, I shared with Kathy that I would be in the trenches with her, however challenging and far reaching it was.  She assured me that she has been praying on it that morning, and that it was the exact course to take.  I chuckled, knowing her strength and mind, and we went to work.  Not twenty minutes later, I received a phone call from a random company that had been referred to us about opening a dialogue towards an alliance and partnership, the exact goal we were speaking of earlier that morning.  I said to her, "There you go praying again!".  That phrase has turned out to be one of my most used phrases with Kathy.  She should be the poster child for "Prayer Works"!  I have now had the pleasure of knowing this amazing woman for eleven years and am blessed to have her in my life.  Little does Kathy know what a huge influence she has been, and continues to be, for me.  Often times when I'm setting out to accomplish a specific goal and I'm feeling a little insecure, I think to myself, "How would Kathy handle this?"  Undoubtedly, the answer always follows, "Pray on it, and then give thanks knowing it IS done."  Listen to this woman, you will learn a lot. - Past Director of Operations, Carla Giampapa

Endorsements:

Rick J. Cole

story_txt:
From Tupperware Lady to CEO
Short Summary:
Who's the ULTIMATE business partner?  The one who's always there by your side?  God, of course!  In this wonderful new book - Is God's Hand On Your Business? - CEO and author Kathy Hill describes her 20 years of "watching God's hand hover over" her business growth and development - guiding her from humble beginnings to great entrepreneurial success.  You'll be fascinated by her story - from her humble beginning selling Tupperware in her 20's - through her founding of the prominent tax representation company, Tax Tiger, which helps taxpayers resolve their liabilities to the IRS.

Author Biography:
Kathy Hill grew up as a pastor's kid spending time in both, Colorado and California.  She worked her way through business as a successful home-based Tupperware lady, to the CEO and founder of a national tax representation company, Tax Tiger, and along the way she inspired, motivated, and produced incredible results.  Her story is balanced with her unwavering faith in God, and what HIS place should be in your growing business and personal life.  Trial after trial, success after success, nothing seemed to stand in the way of a business backed by God, nor would it stop that train from moving forward.  After reading this book, you will most certainly envision a new outlook on your business today, and what the future should hold.  Kathy utilizes these same principles in leading church small groups and women's prison ministries.
Some of the most successful CEO's and companies alike, are headed by individuals with a strong and unwavering faith, morals, ethics, and care for others.  This book will take you on her journey and inspire you.
"For I know the plans I have for you declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you; plans to give you hope and a future." - NIV Jeremiah 29:11
Message from the Author:
I titled the book - Is God's Hand On Your Business? - because I have had the incredible experience over the past 20 years of my life to watch how God's hand hovers over my business growth and development.
It started when I became a Tupperware lady in my early 20's to earn some extra income for my family, and I found that God had given me skills that I didn't know I had.  Over the years, He led me through many new, and sometimes difficult business arenas, but all of them were for a reason and part of the grand plan that He had for my life.
Ultimately, I founded my own company Tax Tiger, a tax representation company established to help aid taxpayers with difficult tax situations and liabilities, who are left with nowhere to turn.
Is God's Hand On Your Business? - is not only my collection of stories  of God's favor and my unwavering faith, but also 15 key principles that I believe caused God's hand to hover over my endeavors.  These same principles can be applied to any business for greater financial and spiritual growth, and God has placed it on my heart to share them with both, successful and struggling business owners, so that they may soar like eagles.
"May the favor of the Lord our God rest upon us; establish the work of our hands for us - yes, establish the work of our hands." - NIV Psalm 90:17
Why I wrote this book:
This book comes from the encouragement and prodding of so many people who have heard my amazing story and told me to put it down on paper.  I've never quite had the time to tackle such a large project until last year when I was encouraged once again by a dear friend, and it was in that moment that God clearly said to me, "Yes, you need to do this."  At that moment, writing the book became more about the people I could help by sharing my story, than about the time sacrifice it would take to develop it.
I reflected on the things that I do on a regular basis, day in and day out, which would cause God's hand to be on my business, and what I found were 15 Essential Principles for Success and Prosperity.  I am 100% certain that God is going to use this book in a mighty and powerful way for struggling businesses to promote a turn around in today's tough economy, and for already successful businesses to prosper further.
This became another "burning bush" moment for me, and clearly outside of my comfort zone, but then again, God has been doing things with me for years that pushed me outside of my comfort zone, and because I was obedient, He has blessed me each and every time.
My company, Tax Tiger, just celebrated its 11 year anniversary, and over those 11 years we have helped thousands of taxpayers resolve their tax liabilities with the IRS.  The financial burdens they carried were lifted off of their shoulders, erasing fear, stress, and sleepless nights.  We have even literally saved lives, giving back hope and peace of mind with exceptional results.

story:
Every movie begins with a screenplay

Making movies employs many people. Every movie begins as a screenplay. Getting our stories seen by studio decision makers benefits us, and others as well. Contests and film festivals are one way to do that. But getting two projects into just one venue can cost nearly $150. Right now, we don't have those kind of funds available, but we do have stories available that we think will make good entertainment.

Our immediate goal

Our goal is to attain the funds to promote them to studios with the resources to do them well. Thus we need to get the screenplays into contests and film festivals where they can be seen. These venues have entry fees, as do promotion sites such as Black List (blklst.com) and others, some of which require monthly fees per script.

The artists and editing people who have helped deserve some compensation for their hard work. With full funding we can even make "elevator pitch" videos to help promote each project directly to studios.

First Competition in November

We need the entry fee for both screenplays, before mid November. So please make a donation now, even a smaller one. It counts. 

The stories of the two screenplays

Of course, the stories, the stories. Here are quick synopses. (Please note that the titles and stories are still in a bit of flux as we wrap up the writing.)

Title of screenplay 1. "Search for the Missing Heir" (animation) STORY. In the Red Kingdom, a spirited young woman leads a band of other contest winners in a race against time to find the missing heir before the kingdom is forfeit due to an obscure clause in a treaty. What are their obstacles? Just about everything: faeries, both good and evil, and lurking monsters, just to name a few.

Title of screenplay 2. "Love in the Mega-City" (science-fiction) STORY. A half century hence, a single mega-structure holds an entire city. A troublesome young woman and her friends find themselves pitted against a greedy corporation. But they have help, and hindrance, from otherworldly influences. As they seek to right wrongs, they uncover a threat to the city itself.

What are your perks?

The higher-valued perks get you a copy of one or both screenplays. But most importantly, and if all goes as hoped, a couple years from now one or both projects could bloom out into the world as a new release movie. In the theater, you could nudge the person next to you and tell them how you took part in making it happen.

We are a team

We are a writing team made of two writers and a graphic artist.

I'm Henry Tjernlund. I'm a US writer. I have had science-fiction short stories in sci-fi magazines and an anthology. I have also been working on numerous student and independent film projects. Claire Andrews is my co-writer from Europe. Eric Von Lauderman is our graphic artist, from US.

A BIG Thank You

We thank the contributors, and invite you to donate as much as you like. 

P.S. Visit again and stay tuned for updates and progress. And check out our Facebook page for the project as well.

story:
I am COMMITTED to DESTROYING THE STIGMA of PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder)! There's no shame in asking for help because it is hard. I hope my book inspires people to adapt that world view.

A bit about me:

Smokes Torres is my pen name.

I am a 30-something professional in the social work field whose daily duties deals directly with the trauma of others and assisting them through their own darkness.

Like most suffering with Post Traumatic Stress (PTSD) I suffer the same paralyzing fear of being exposed as damaged or crazy. Due to the sensitive nature of the book, I am Smokes and wish to remain under an anonymous but unforgettable name. This actually allows me to be more honest- without fear of professional persecution/judgement or family shame.

I was born and raised in the province of Newfoundland, exploring many parts of Canada and the United States after high school. I graduated from Memorial University with a Bachelor of Arts with a Double Major in Folklore & Sociology and a Criminology certificate.

I live with my two beautiful cats who help haul me out of the darkness when I go too deep.

I am your typical jack of all arts type, with a soul full of humanity, spirituality and social justice.

Smokes does not use Facebook under any name, call me old school!

What will the money be used for?

I am raising money to publish my first book and to create a sense of hope for others suffering from the darkness of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).   The money will be used to self-publish the book as it is the quickest and easiest way to get the message out there.  This is also the lost dream that reawakened when all seemed lost.  And when I think about the beauty of all this pain, my heart overflows with love and conviction.  Still working to keep my hope alive 24/7, but this project really has given me a new found sense of empowerment. 

People love stories stranger than fiction so it should have that popular allure to a wide demographic.  More importantly in my eyes, it will break the silence and tell just how dark and dramatic the effects of my PTSD have had on my life due to my motor vehicle accident.  I look around and identify people suffering and have yet to be wrong when I have asked someone.  I want people to hear an honest story so they can have more understanding and patience, in return creating a greater sense of community, peace and harmony for the world one smile at a time. Peace.

Excerpt from LIVING THE DARKNESS:MY LIFE WITH PTSD

Of course my name isn't really Smokes (who would make their child suffer such a cruel fate!?!).  But in my most broken state, Smokes was born inside of me and that monster took over.  Many people reassured me I was not a monster, even though the growingly familiar look of fear in their eyes showed their lie.

 Smokes is not cruel or destructive by nature.  She is the dominant aggressor who has been growing and training inside me with every pain over the last 32 years; waiting in the shadows to help and protect.  Not a multiple personality (despite the language I use)  but a natural and relatively healthy defense mechanism  to escape danger in emergency situations.  But I got stuck and this protector that I had created to save myself in these times, took over.

I went into hiding and Smokes took over my body & mind.  Not fully though; the lack of self awareness would have allowed for a smooth ride through Smokes' self harming, destructive behaviors. Instead my true self had to sit by and watch the path of destruction.  I am as helpless as a family squatting underground inside the makeshift bomb shelter; waiting for the storm to pass.  I just have to watch as my monster acts in ways I don't.  Then I try my best to clean up the mess she has left me.

I essentially believe myself to be an addict of sorts.  My body has been pumped up with adrenalin and cortisol on a daily basis.  Unlike most addicts I don't have to pay because my body creates these chemicals for itself.  The catch is it also administers it when it wants it.  I do not even have the control of what goes into my body because my body is also my dealer; and a very generous one.

With Blessings, Light & Love to accompany you through the darkness, this is my story.

Smokes Torres

Knowledge is TRUE POWER so let us begin with the education portion:

What is Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)?

Despite the fact that 1 in 10 Canadians will suffer from PTSD in their lifetime (www.chma.ca), PTSD is still very much a misunderstood & stigmatized condition.

I have tried writing based upon the research I have gathered for myself, but things did not seem very clear.  I came across a great article at a wonderful website from which I am going to share.  The website and article link is: 

http://www.helpguide.org/mental/post_traumatic_stress_disorder_symptoms_treatment.htm

Please visit it for further information to help you and your loved one!  I will be tweeting the link to this article regularly as a big thank you for them having created it and for their help in providing me with insight into my own disorder.

 As Melinda Smith, M.A., and Jeanne Segal, Ph.D. (2013) so kindly wrote:

Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) can develop following a traumatic event that threatens your safety or makes you feel helpless. Most people associate PTSD with battle-scarred soldiers—and military combat is the most common cause in men—but any overwhelming life experience can trigger PTSD, especially if the event feels unpredictable and uncontrollable.

Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) can affect those who personally experience the catastrophe, those who witness it, and those who pick up the pieces afterwards, including emergency workers and law enforcement officers. It can even occur in the friends or family members of those who went through the actual trauma. PTSD develops differently from person to person. While the symptoms of PTSD most commonly develop in the hours or days following the traumatic event, it can sometimes take weeks, months, or even years before they appear. 

Following a traumatic event, almost everyone experiences at least some of the symptoms of PTSD. When your sense of safety and trust are shattered, it’s normal to feel crazy, disconnected, or numb. It’s very common to have bad dreams, feel fearful, and find it difficult to stop thinking about what happened. These are normal reactions to abnormal events.

For most people, however, these symptoms are short-lived. They may last for several days or even weeks, but they gradually lift. But if you have post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), the symptoms don’t decrease. You don’t feel a little better each day. In fact, you may start to feel worse.

A normal response to trauma becomes PTSD when you become stuck 

After a traumatic experience, the mind and the body are in shock. But as you make sense of what happened and process your emotions, you come out of it. With post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), however, you remain in psychological shock. Your memory of what happened and your feelings about it are disconnected. In order to move on, it’s important to face and feel your memories and emotions.

Symptoms of PTSD: Re-experiencing the traumatic event

  • Intrusive, upsetting memories of the event
  • Flashbacks (acting or feeling like the event is happening again)
  • Nightmares (either of the event or of other frightening things)
  • Feelings of intense distress when reminded of the trauma
  • Intense physical reactions to reminders of the event (e.g. pounding heart, rapid breathing, nausea, muscle tension, sweating)

Symptoms of PTSD: Avoidance and numbing

  • Avoiding activities, places, thoughts, or feelings that remind you of the trauma
  • Inability to remember important aspects of the trauma
  • Loss of interest in activities and life in general
  • Feeling detached from others and emotionally numb
  • Sense of a limited future (you don’t expect to live a normal life span, get married, have a career)

Symtoms of PTSD: Increased anxiety and emotional arousal

  • Difficulty falling or staying asleep
  • Irritability or outbursts of anger
  • Difficulty concentrating
  • Hypervigilance (on constant “red alert”)
  • Feeling jumpy and easily startled

 Other common symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)

  • Anger and irritability
  • Guilt, shame, or self-blame
  • Substance abuse
  • Feelings of mistrust and betrayal
  • Depression and hopelessness
  • Suicidal thoughts and feelings
  • Feeling alienated and alone
  • Physical aches and pains

Symptoms of PTSD in children and adolescents

In children—especially those who are very young—the symptoms of PTSD can be different than the symptoms in adults. Symptoms in children include:

  • Fear of being separated from parent
  • Losing previously-acquired skills (such as toilet training)
  • Sleep problems and nightmares without recognizable content
  • Somber, compulsive play in which themes or aspects of the trauma are repeated
  • New phobias and anxieties that seem unrelated to the trauma (such as a fear of monsters)
  • Acting out the trauma through play, stories, or drawings
  • Aches and pains with no apparent cause
  • Irritability and aggression

If you suspect that you or a loved one has post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), it’s important to seek help right away. The sooner PTSD is confronted, the easier it is to overcome. If you’re reluctant to seek help, keep in mind that PTSD is not a sign of weakness, and the only way to overcome it is to confront what happened to you and learn to accept it as a part of your past. This process is much easier with the guidance and support of an experienced therapist or doctor.

It’s only natural to want to avoid painful memories and feelings. But if you try to numb yourself and push your memories away, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) will only get worse. You can’t escape your emotions completely—they emerge under stress or whenever you let down your guard—and trying to do so is exhausting. The avoidance will ultimately harm your relationships, your ability to function, and the quality of your life.

 Why should I seek help for PTSD?

  • Early treatment is better. Symptoms of PTSD may get worse. Dealing with them now might help stop them from getting worse in the future. Finding out more about what treatments work, where to look for help, and what kind of questions to ask can make it easier to get help and lead to better outcomes.
  • PTSD symptoms can change family life. PTSD symptoms can get in the way of your family life. You may find that you pull away from loved ones, are not able to get along with people, or that you are angry or even violent. Getting help for your PTSD can help improve your family life.
  • PTSD can be related to other health problems. PTSD symptoms can make physical health problems worse. For example, studies have shown a relationship between PTSD and heart trouble. By getting help for your PTSD you could also improve your physical health.

Source: National Center for PTSD

Now the 'About Me' section.  Let's begin with my daily PSA:

Please help yourself and get the help you need, there is NO SHAME! Even though life might seem hopeless right now, there is hope because I have seen a glimpse of it and I'm gonna to at least fight to try to be my normal self again!

It is VERY important to find a counselor who is Trauma trained or familiar with PTSD (but any counselor can help you through a tough time until you find one!).  I could easily have been misdiagnosed if mine was not.  It is sad and scary but a reality, so Trauma trained & PTSD, remember to mention those!

LIVING THE DARKNESS:MY LIFE WITH PTSD, is my personal account of PTSD and my understanding of it. 

What caused my PTSD and inspired this project?

I was in a Motor Vehicle Accident and somehow got lost in the darkness of myself that I had no idea existed.  I went from listening to spiritual reggae music to gangsta rap.  My family doctor (who has saved me from a deep rooted depression in the past) looked at me almost in tears, shock apparent at the scared animal that had replaced the ever loving, humanitarian he has treated for almost 10 years now. The blankness in my eyes with the confident smile scared him as much as it did me the first time I noticed it. It is hard being in a room with people you love and them looking at you afraid of the stranger occupying the body that once belonged to someone they love. 

I saw two soldiers on their lunch break; I went to them and huddled, ensuring they knew there was no shame in getting help for PTSD, breaking into tears and explaining I am suffering and getting the help I need. Then I left. The older, distant man came to my car after reached in hugging me and said thank you. 

I knew then and there I need to tell my story, help the medical community and fighters/families of this dark, consuming illness understand the importance of continued research to fund better treatments for  PTSD. Within the hour someone had introduced me to crowdfunding and a light bulb went off. 

As an avid reader, I KNOW my honest, real life story to be greater and stranger than fiction. LIVING THE DARKNESS:MY LIFE WITH PTSD is my contribution to DESTROYING the stigma attached to PTSD ( and mental illness in general). I also believe that when things are meant to be, the universe lines things up (like in my story).  But it is up to us to open our hearts and listen. There is no shame in getting the needed help.  Please help me spread this message.

Stretch goals if my $7,500 goal is exceeded:

At $10,000 I will do the research for a local  PTSD Public education program.

At $15,000 I will locally implement PTSD Public education program (which is not currently available in my city).

At $20,000 I will create and run a community PTSD peer support group (which is not currently available in my city).

At $75,000 I will take a year off my job (when I get back there!)  to promote my book throughout North America in 2015.

At $100,000 or greater I will add as many international dates as possible to promote book and public education programs in 2015.

***Regardless of these stretch goals, I would like it to be clear these are projects my future hold regardless!  The time frame, as always, is dependent upon financial constraints.  It's the way of the world!

Blessings, Light & Love,

Smokes Torres@kwestladi (Twitter)

P.S I am also the artist of any visual art you see used in this project.

Please Note: This book deals with disturbing darkness and also sometimes uses explicit, classless language. After much consideration if this was necessary, I have decided it is to truly show what my monster looks like.  There will be no stretch of the facts because there is no need for it, I could not make up half of what I have had to live!  

Risks and Challenges

The biggest risk is that I am suffering with PTSD and have no idea where this journey will take me. If my illness gets even more severe, at worst my release date may be delayed. 
All the research I have read strongly suggests that helping others is one of the quickest ways to reconnect to emotions and begin reintegration back into one's previous community. 
Also I have always dreamed of writing a book, so in a sense telling readers how my dream life was taken away due to someone texting while driving, by fulfilling a different dream is empowering. 

Remember Most Importantly... 

I am COMMITTED to DESTROYING THE STIGMA of PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder)! There's no shame in asking for help because it is hard. I hope my book inspires people to adapt that world view.
story_txt:
I am COMMITTED to DESTROYING THE STIGMA of PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder)! There's no shame in asking for help because it is hard. I hope my book inspires people to adapt that world view.
A bit about me:
Smokes Torres is my pen name.
I am a 30-something professional in the social work field whose daily duties deals directly with the trauma of others and assisting them through their own darkness.
Like most suffering with Post Traumatic Stress (PTSD) I suffer the same paralyzing fear of being exposed as damaged or crazy. Due to the sensitive nature of the book, I am Smokes and wish to remain under an anonymous but unforgettable name. This actually allows me to be more honest- without fear of professional persecution/judgement or family shame.
I was born and raised in the province of Newfoundland, exploring many parts of Canada and the United States after high school. I graduated from Memorial University with a Bachelor of Arts with a Double Major in Folklore & Sociology and a Criminology certificate.
I live with my two beautiful cats who help haul me out of the darkness when I go too deep.
I am your typical jack of all arts type, with a soul full of humanity, spirituality and social justice.
Smokes does not use Facebook under any name, call me old school!

What will the money be used for?
I am raising money to publish my first book and to create a sense of hope for others suffering from the darkness of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).   The money will be used to self-publish the book as it is the quickest and easiest way to get the message out there.  This is also the lost dream that reawakened when all seemed lost.  And when I think about the beauty of all this pain, my heart overflows with love and conviction.  Still working to keep my hope alive 24/7, but this project really has given me a new found sense of empowerment. 
People love stories stranger than fiction so it should have that popular allure to a wide demographic.  More importantly in my eyes, it will break the silence and tell just how dark and dramatic the effects of my PTSD have had on my life due to my motor vehicle accident.  I look around and identify people suffering and have yet to be wrong when I have asked someone.  I want people to hear an honest story so they can have more understanding and patience, in return creating a greater sense of community, peace and harmony for the world one smile at a time. Peace.
Excerpt from LIVING THE DARKNESS:MY LIFE WITH PTSD
Of course my name isn't really Smokes (who would make their child suffer such a cruel fate!?!).  But in my most broken state, Smokes was born inside of me and that monster took over.  Many people reassured me I was not a monster, even though the growingly familiar look of fear in their eyes showed their lie. Smokes is not cruel or destructive by nature.  She is the dominant aggressor who has been growing and training inside me with every pain over the last 32 years; waiting in the shadows to help and protect.  Not a multiple personality (despite the language I use)  but a natural and relatively healthy defense mechanism  to escape danger in emergency situations.  But I got stuck and this protector that I had created to save myself in these times, took over.I went into hiding and Smokes took over my body & mind.  Not fully though; the lack of self awareness would have allowed for a smooth ride through Smokes' self harming, destructive behaviors. Instead my true self had to sit by and watch the path of destruction.  I am as helpless as a family squatting underground inside the makeshift bomb shelter; waiting for the storm to pass.  I just have to watch as my monster acts in ways I don't.  Then I try my best to clean up the mess she has left me.I essentially believe myself to be an addict of sorts.  My body has been pumped up with adrenalin and cortisol on a daily basis.  Unlike most addicts I don't have to pay because my body creates these chemicals for itself.  The catch is it also administers it when it wants it.  I do not even have the control of what goes into my body because my body is also my dealer; and a very generous one.With Blessings, Light & Love to accompany you through the darkness, this is my story.Smokes Torres
Knowledge is TRUE POWER so let us begin with the education portion:
What is Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)?
Despite the fact that 1 in 10 Canadians will suffer from PTSD in their lifetime (www.chma.ca), PTSD is still very much a misunderstood & stigmatized condition.
I have tried writing based upon the research I have gathered for myself, but things did not seem very clear.  I came across a great article at a wonderful website from which I am going to share.  The website and article link is: 
http://www.helpguide.org/mental/post_traumatic_stress_disorder_symptoms_treatment.htm
Please visit it for further information to help you and your loved one!  I will be tweeting the link to this article regularly as a big thank you for them having created it and for their help in providing me with insight into my own disorder.
 As Melinda Smith, M.A., and Jeanne Segal, Ph.D. (2013) so kindly wrote:
Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) can develop following a traumatic event that threatens your safety or makes you feel helpless. Most people associate PTSD with battle-scarred soldiers—and military combat is the most common cause in men—but any overwhelming life experience can trigger PTSD, especially if the event feels unpredictable and uncontrollable.
Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) can affect those who personally experience the catastrophe, those who witness it, and those who pick up the pieces afterwards, including emergency workers and law enforcement officers. It can even occur in the friends or family members of those who went through the actual trauma. PTSD develops differently from person to person. While the symptoms of PTSD most commonly develop in the hours or days following the traumatic event, it can sometimes take weeks, months, or even years before they appear. 
Following a traumatic event, almost everyone experiences at least some of the symptoms of PTSD. When your sense of safety and trust are shattered, it’s normal to feel crazy, disconnected, or numb. It’s very common to have bad dreams, feel fearful, and find it difficult to stop thinking about what happened. These are normal reactions to abnormal events.
For most people, however, these symptoms are short-lived. They may last for several days or even weeks, but they gradually lift. But if you have post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), the symptoms don’t decrease. You don’t feel a little better each day. In fact, you may start to feel worse.
A normal response to trauma becomes PTSD when you become stuck 
After a traumatic experience, the mind and the body are in shock. But as you make sense of what happened and process your emotions, you come out of it. With post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), however, you remain in psychological shock. Your memory of what happened and your feelings about it are disconnected. In order to move on, it’s important to face and feel your memories and emotions.
Symptoms of PTSD: Re-experiencing the traumatic event

Intrusive, upsetting memories of the event
Flashbacks (acting or feeling like the event is happening again)
Nightmares (either of the event or of other frightening things)
Feelings of intense distress when reminded of the trauma
Intense physical reactions to reminders of the event (e.g. pounding heart, rapid breathing, nausea, muscle tension, sweating)

Symptoms of PTSD: Avoidance and numbing

Avoiding activities, places, thoughts, or feelings that remind you of the trauma
Inability to remember important aspects of the trauma
Loss of interest in activities and life in general
Feeling detached from others and emotionally numb
Sense of a limited future (you don’t expect to live a normal life span, get married, have a career)

Symtoms of PTSD: Increased anxiety and emotional arousal

Difficulty falling or staying asleep
Irritability or outbursts of anger
Difficulty concentrating
Hypervigilance (on constant “red alert”)
Feeling jumpy and easily startled

 Other common symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)

Anger and irritability
Guilt, shame, or self-blame
Substance abuse
Feelings of mistrust and betrayal


Depression and hopelessness
Suicidal thoughts and feelings
Feeling alienated and alone
Physical aches and pains

Symptoms of PTSD in children and adolescents
In children—especially those who are very young—the symptoms of PTSD can be different than the symptoms in adults. Symptoms in children include:

Fear of being separated from parent
Losing previously-acquired skills (such as toilet training)
Sleep problems and nightmares without recognizable content
Somber, compulsive play in which themes or aspects of the trauma are repeated
New phobias and anxieties that seem unrelated to the trauma (such as a fear of monsters)
Acting out the trauma through play, stories, or drawings
Aches and pains with no apparent cause
Irritability and aggression

If you suspect that you or a loved one has post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), it’s important to seek help right away. The sooner PTSD is confronted, the easier it is to overcome. If you’re reluctant to seek help, keep in mind that PTSD is not a sign of weakness, and the only way to overcome it is to confront what happened to you and learn to accept it as a part of your past. This process is much easier with the guidance and support of an experienced therapist or doctor.
It’s only natural to want to avoid painful memories and feelings. But if you try to numb yourself and push your memories away, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) will only get worse. You can’t escape your emotions completely—they emerge under stress or whenever you let down your guard—and trying to do so is exhausting. The avoidance will ultimately harm your relationships, your ability to function, and the quality of your life.
 Why should I seek help for PTSD?

Early treatment is better. Symptoms of PTSD may get worse. Dealing with them now might help stop them from getting worse in the future. Finding out more about what treatments work, where to look for help, and what kind of questions to ask can make it easier to get help and lead to better outcomes.
PTSD symptoms can change family life. PTSD symptoms can get in the way of your family life. You may find that you pull away from loved ones, are not able to get along with people, or that you are angry or even violent. Getting help for your PTSD can help improve your family life.
PTSD can be related to other health problems. PTSD symptoms can make physical health problems worse. For example, studies have shown a relationship between PTSD and heart trouble. By getting help for your PTSD you could also improve your physical health.

Source: National Center for PTSD
Now the 'About Me' section.  Let's begin with my daily PSA:
Please help yourself and get the help you need, there is NO SHAME! Even though life might seem hopeless right now, there is hope because I have seen a glimpse of it and I'm gonna to at least fight to try to be my normal self again!
It is VERY important to find a counselor who is Trauma trained or familiar with PTSD (but any counselor can help you through a tough time until you find one!).  I could easily have been misdiagnosed if mine was not.  It is sad and scary but a reality, so Trauma trained & PTSD, remember to mention those!
LIVING THE DARKNESS:MY LIFE WITH PTSD, is my personal account of PTSD and my understanding of it. 
What caused my PTSD and inspired this project?
I was in a Motor Vehicle Accident and somehow got lost in the darkness of myself that I had no idea existed.  I went from listening to spiritual reggae music to gangsta rap.  My family doctor (who has saved me from a deep rooted depression in the past) looked at me almost in tears, shock apparent at the scared animal that had replaced the ever loving, humanitarian he has treated for almost 10 years now. The blankness in my eyes with the confident smile scared him as much as it did me the first time I noticed it. It is hard being in a room with people you love and them looking at you afraid of the stranger occupying the body that once belonged to someone they love. 
I saw two soldiers on their lunch break; I went to them and huddled, ensuring they knew there was no shame in getting help for PTSD, breaking into tears and explaining I am suffering and getting the help I need. Then I left. The older, distant man came to my car after reached in hugging me and said thank you. 
I knew then and there I need to tell my story, help the medical community and fighters/families of this dark, consuming illness understand the importance of continued research to fund better treatments for  PTSD. Within the hour someone had introduced me to crowdfunding and a light bulb went off. 
As an avid reader, I KNOW my honest, real life story to be greater and stranger than fiction. LIVING THE DARKNESS:MY LIFE WITH PTSD is my contribution to DESTROYING the stigma attached to PTSD ( and mental illness in general). I also believe that when things are meant to be, the universe lines things up (like in my story).  But it is up to us to open our hearts and listen. There is no shame in getting the needed help.  Please help me spread this message.
Stretch goals if my $7,500 goal is exceeded:
At $10,000 I will do the research for a local  PTSD Public education program.
At $15,000 I will locally implement PTSD Public education program (which is not currently available in my city).
At $20,000 I will create and run a community PTSD peer support group (which is not currently available in my city).
At $75,000 I will take a year off my job (when I get back there!)  to promote my book throughout North America in 2015.
At $100,000 or greater I will add as many international dates as possible to promote book and public education programs in 2015.
***Regardless of these stretch goals, I would like it to be clear these are projects my future hold regardless!  The time frame, as always, is dependent upon financial constraints.  It's the way of the world!
Blessings, Light & Love,
Smokes Torres@kwestladi (Twitter)
P.S I am also the artist of any visual art you see used in this project.
Please Note: This book deals with disturbing darkness and also sometimes uses explicit, classless language. After much consideration if this was necessary, I have decided it is to truly show what my monster looks like.  There will be no stretch of the facts because there is no need for it, I could not make up half of what I have had to live!  
Risks and Challenges
The biggest risk is that I am suffering with PTSD and have no idea where this journey will take me. If my illness gets even more severe, at worst my release date may be delayed. All the research I have read strongly suggests that helping others is one of the quickest ways to reconnect to emotions and begin reintegration back into one's previous community. Also I have always dreamed of writing a book, so in a sense telling readers how my dream life was taken away due to someone texting while driving, by fulfilling a different dream is empowering. 
Remember Most Importantly... 
I am COMMITTED to DESTROYING THE STIGMA of PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder)! There's no shame in asking for help because it is hard. I hope my book inspires people to adapt that world view.

story:
Tell all the Truth but tell it slant —  Emily Dickinson  

Last year we partied with Robert  B.  Parker, and the year before that, Edgar Allen Poe. This year we're going a more sedate route with No-Show Gala featured guest Emily Dickinson. (She has already assured us she will not come.) 

What is the No-Show Gala? Well, it's a fictitious  party. An excuse to be antisocial. A way to support a really, really  good cause. And it's our biggest – and only – annual fundraiser here at the Writers' Room of Boston (WROB). Your $20" ticket" is really just a donation to our fake party on November 23rd.  (Plus, it's a tax write-off, since we're a non-profit).  

So what exactly are you supporting? Us – The Writer's Room of Boston (WROB).  We are a co-working space for writers in downtown Boston, where members have 24/7 access. Our mission is to provide affordable and secure writing space for emerging and established writers. We provide four annual fellowships to local writers of limited means, with special consideration given to members of underrepresented groups.  This year we are excited to announce the Barbara Helfgott Hyett Fellowship, named in honor of one of our founding  members.  The WROB has been around for more than 30 years, and some of our furniture is looking rather worn. So this year we are also raising funds to replace our chairs.  

Please buy a ticket, spread the word, and support literature! We hope to not-see you there!

#NoShowGala2019

story:
Me

Hi, my name’s Natalia! I’m an author of Young Adult/New Adult romance. To be honest, doing this makes me sooooo nervous, but I’m taking a deep breath and a chance. So here we go . . .

The Backstory

Last year, I self-published my first novel. It’s called TOUCH. It's set in the contemporary world and is the story of a female Eros who’s forced to pair up the mortal boy she loves with another mortal girl.

The book was an absolute labor of love, and it got amazing reviews by bloggers, including magic-in-every-book, readaroundtherosie, tilly and her books, butter my books, and pollyandbooks. Also, an original song, "Just One," was recorded for TOUCH by some special people in my life, Pawing at the Ceiling.

The New Story

Now, I have a second book coming out this fall. It’s called TRICK, and it's about the forbidden love between a righteous princess and a rakish court jester. Yes, the hero’s a court jester, though not in the traditional sense. I’ve subverted the image, eliminated the garish costume, and turned him into someone much more enticing. TRICK is completed and in the final stages of editing. My goal is to release it in early November.

The Plot

There is a rule amongst his kind: A jester doesn’t lie.

In the kingdom of Whimtany, Poet is renowned. He’s young and pretty, a lover of men and women. He performs for the court, kisses like a scoundrel, and mocks with a silver tongue.

Yet allow him this: It’s only the most cunning, most manipulative soul who can play the fool. For Poet guards a secret. One the Crown would shackle him for. One that he’ll risk everything to protect.

Alas, it will take more than clever words to deceive Princess Briar. Convinced that he’s juggling lies as well as verse, this righteous nuisance of a girl is determined to expose him.

But not all falsehoods are fiendish. Poet’s secret is delicate, binding the jester to the princess in an unlikely alliance—and kindling a breathless attraction, as alluring as it is forbidden.

*Mature YA. Intended for readers 17 and older*

The Cover


Why I’m Here

I’m hoping for a little boost from you guys, to please help fund TRICK's publication. And I'd like to invite you to decide for yourselves what this story is worth and how you’d like to support it. If that sounds cool, read on :)

Funding Will Help Pay For

The cover design (as seen above and created by Nicole Jaffe), the editor, promotional materials (including shipping), and hopefully a few extra coins in the tip-jar to help this humble author keep writing.

But if You Can’t Donate

Spreading the word on social media about this page, or my books, or my website . . . just anything would be greatly appreciated, you have no idea. It’s hard to get exposure as an indie author, so every post and kind word truly counts.

And if You’d Like to Know More

Take a peek at the video. There’s a ferret in it.

Thank you so very much!
Natalia

Goodreads
Tumblr
Pinterest

story:
Low Down Publishing is producing ultra-high-quality resources for music educators and self-guided learners. By donating to our campaign you will aid us in producing these five texts, written to fill gaps in music education literature. Starting with a $25 donation, we will gift you with the book of your choice! What do you want the low down on?

Overview

Few things are more exciting than finding a book that really helps you learn something deeply. Whether it’s learning how to play guitar, or how to handle your first classroom as a teacher, nothing beats finding the right tool to help you succeed. We all know this tool, too—the one that enables the"aha!" moment—and instantly connects with you, leaving you feeling empowered.

However, searching for the right book can often feel like a herculean task. We've been there, trying to find the right book to use with our students or just on our own. That’s why we created Low Down Publishing—to develop books specifically for music teachers and self-guided learners—and eliminate the stressful process of finding the right resource. We make the "aha!" moment a core part of your learning experience.

 

Here’s the truth—books have a seemingly impossible job.

 

Imagine having to create a resource that captures the interest of a diverse audience and teaches them a skill in detail, yet you don't know exactly who will be using it. You may never meet your reader face to face or understand what their individual needs are. Further, once it leaves your hands, you can’t control how they use or interpret it. No wonder it can be so hard to find the right book that connects with you!

 

It doesn’t have to be, though.

 

Look—we understand that no book is a catch-all and no book can ever replace a great teacher. However, we recognize that great teachers and students need great resources; books and tools that are:

  • Up-to-date with current musical trends and issues
  • Targeted to produce specific learning outcomes
  • Broad enough to reach students with diverse interests, yet
  • Helpful to teachers with wide-ranging teaching experiences

 

Everything we produce is built on research findings. Our resources provide expert opinions and leave room for teachers and students to draw their own conclusions and decide how to best apply them. Our resources help to eliminate the question, "Will this resource work for me?"

 

Our Story

The publishing bug hit Danny in 2013 while teaching at SUNY Oswego. After studying available bass resources, and unable to find the exact right book to fit his bass students’ needs, he wrote The Low Down Vol. 1—a teaching sequence for walking bass lines, targeted directly at his students. Inspired by the results in his students and positive feedback from the bass community, Danny continued in 2016 with The Low Down Vol. 2.

(Creating DIY books can feel like an insane task, especially without many author resources available to musicians. This was the major impetus for us offering author services—but more on that later).

Danny's first three publications

 

Danny's curiosities led him back to the Eastman School of Music in 2016, where he also met Erik Piazza, John Mills, and Michael Sherman. Danny's research focus and master’s thesis was on jazz double bass pedagogy, which helped form the basis of Topics in Jazz Bass (2018). Numerous discussions amongst the founders about teaching, research, and the need for more resources ultimately formed the foundation of LDP.

 

Okay, so technically Danny’s first book was written when he was 7, not 24… but his mom and dad paid for the only available copy. It was a low budget production (<$10) and he was forced to do his own illustrative work.

 

Our 2020 Catalog

These books represent research of their respective fields and are written by some of the best musicians and educators today.  [Titles are subject to change; content will not change]

The Art of Combining Chords and Melodies on Guitar by Bob Sneider (Guitarist, Professor at Eastman School of Music). Bob presents his innovative approach to playing chord melodies on guitar in solo and trio settings, complete with supplemental audio. 

A Practical Rudimental Approach to Drumming Vol. 1 By Carmen Intorre Jr (Drummer for the Pat Martino Trio). Carmen's book will help beginning percussion students learn the rudiments and how to musically apply them to the drumset.

Jazz Warmups for All Instrumentalists by Doug Stone (Saxophonist, Professor of Jazz at Louisiana State University). Doug's jazz warmup helps all instrumentalists, regardless of experience, develop vocabulary as a part of their daily practice routine.

Topics in Jazz Bass Vol. 2: Soloing by Danny Ziemann. This book will serve bassists looking to improve their soloing practice. Each chapter serves as a standalone topic, offering many practice techniques bassists can incorporate to develop soloing vocabulary. Many exercises include embedded ear training, perfect for bassists of all experience levels.

Practical Advice for Reflective Music Teachers by John Mills, Erik Piazza, and Danny Ziemann. This resource is targeted at pre-service and beginning music teachers, using scenarios and vignettes to examine some of the common beliefs or questions teachers might have in their careers.

 

Rewards

In addition to our 2020 catalog, we're providing perks including: skype lessons, internet masterclasses, compositions named after you, special videos, and book dedications. These perks are only available through our campaign. If your reward includes one or more of our titles, please email info@lowdownpublishing.com with your choice!

Note: All rewards have an estimated delivery date of "by December 2020", though our projected timeline for the books is mid-2020. 

Budget & Timeline

Making a book is expensive, let alone five!  The bulk of our operating costs are design-related. Compelling artwork and proper typesetting ensure that you will have the best engagement with the book. Then, of course, there’s the cost of printing, print setup fees, ISBNs, copyrights, online hosting for our supplemental material, shipping costs, and revisions.

All books are currently being written and in various editing stages. We have our latest deadline as December 2020, though we aim to have everything done much earlier than that!

 

Who We Are

LDP is a four-person team, led by Danny Ziemann, with combined decades of teaching experience and professional performing experience, and mentorship by the NextCorps business incubator.

 

Risks & Challenges

Meeting deadlines while managing the production of multiple books can be difficult, and of course, presents the biggest risk. However, the founders' publishing experience helps to mitigate risk and keep a strict production deadline. Each author follows a schedule, in collaboration with the founders, to help meet projected deadlines.

Thank you for bringing our campaign to great success!

We know not everyone can donate. However, you can still be a HUGE help to us by:

  • Sharing our campaign through social media, and
  • Helping us to create some buzz and excitement!

Please use the Indiegogo tools at the bottom of the page to share our project.
